title: Senior Game Developer
job_description:
About Us
Join us to create a virtual livestreaming experience like no other! We're building tools for videogame streamers that blur the lines between games and software, creating a social MMORPG for streamers and fans.

As a Senior Game Developer on our fast-growing team, you'll work in a small, agile environment with a focus on delivering high-quality, performant code. The ideal candidate is excited to work with a unique tech stack that includes C++ and Unity, and is eager to jump in and tackle all aspects of our codebase.

We're a company committed to an open, fun, supportive, and collaborative environment. Join us in making a difference and enjoying team activities along the way! If this opportunity sounds like a fit for you, apply now!


Key Responsibilities
- Close collaboration with founders on solving core engineering challenges
- Ability to execute in ambiguous situations and make informed technical decisions with ownership
- Strong experience with Unity engine and UI development
- Collaboration with game designers, artists, and other developers to create user-friendly interfaces
- Debugging skills for both Unity and native DLLs 
- Implementation and optimization of game features, including physics, animations, and special effects
- Integration of models, assets, textures, and shaders into game scenes
- Maintaining reusable, documented codebases across multiple projects
- Proficient in version control (git) with understanding of merge/conflict resolutions and submodules
- Stay current with emerging trends and technologies in the gaming industry.


Requirements
- 3+ of industry experience in game development, with a focus on Unity and UI development
- Strong proficiency in C# and Unity engine
- Shipped at least one commercial game/software
- Experience with UI/UX design and development
- Ability to work independently and as part of a team
- Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills
- Playing and watching videogames is your lifestyle!

Nice to haves
- Familiarity with technical art skills (shaders, texture and geometry coding)
- Nerd out over geometry optimization tricks
- Understanding of linear algebra
- Experience with networking /async programming
- Like giving and receiving feedback


Working With Us
Our office is based at the heart of Downtown Kitchener, ON, which is about an hour away from Toronto. If you like the idea of working with a fast-growing startup, and aspire to take leads on larger self-directed projects in the future, then this is the opportunity for you. 

A lot of our approach to work is based around learning, experimenting, and pushing boundaries. We love nerding out over new graphics techniques and watching HCI, GDC, and SIGGRAPH presentations. 


Compensation and benefits
- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Generous stock options. We believe that everyone working with us should share in the success of the company.
- Opportunities for growth and career advancement
- Dynamic and creative work environment
- Collaborative and supportive team culture

Recruitment Process
- Click the link to apply!
- You'll get an email from us to acknowledge receipt, and then another email within a week to let you know if you've made it to stage 2.
- Stage 2 will be a video chat with 2-3 people from the team to get context on your experience, personal goals, and what you could bring to the company.
- Stage 3 will be a "culture fit" chat with 2-4 people from the team that you might interact with less frequently. This is less formal and helps us maintain a friendly atmosphere.
- Then you'll get a final email letting you know if we will or won‚Äôt extend an offer!

title: Unreal Gameplay Programmer- Blueprints
job_description:
About Worlds

Worlds is a VC-backed stealth startup and game studio creating next-gen PC games using proprietary tooling.

Our fully-remote team comes from studios such as Epic Games, Krafton, and Gearbox. We're building on the newest technology introduced in Unreal Engine 5,  and our culture celebrates both technical rigor & experimentation.

With a war chest of >$8M in funding, we are building a lean, elite team of creative technologists to push the limits of gaming technology and delight players with novel experiences.

Responsibilities

- Implement gameplay systems in a multiplayer FPS currently in development

- Write elegant and performant Blueprints code 

- Work alongside a small team of Unreal developers and tech artists

Requirements

- You have substantial experience working with Blueprints on a game that has successfully shipped

- You have experience with Gameplay Ability System (GAS) and ideally multiplayer replication

- You excel at working independently, without excessive structure or oversight

Compensation

- Industry-leading compensation + equity package

- Accelerated promotion and senior leadership opportunities

- Best-in-class benefits: generous 401K matching, healthcare, and donation matching


Work environment

- Remote work, no 'camera-on' policy for meetings

- Flexible hours + unlimited vacation

- No internal emails or Slack
.

title: Senior Game Developer
job_description:
Senior Game Developer

Project Iroh is a MOBRPG (multiplayer online battle roleplaying game) styled in hand-illustrated 2.5D art. Our aim is to create a persistent MOBA-like experience with socially competitive gameplay that is not only fun, but creates meaningful experiences and friendships that people can engage in for years to come.   

Do you love games like DotA, League of Legends, Ultima Online, Eve Online, Runescape, Realm of the Mad God, or MapleStory? Do you yearn to create a game with less grind, more fun, and lots of socializing?

As our Senior Game Developer, you will be working in a team solving challenging problems using C++. You will be developing features and systems alongside our artists that fundamentally shape the product. Our developers have a high level of ownership over their work and it‚Äôs important that you can plan and manage your work efficiently. As a senior, we expect you to solve problems and provide guidance using your expert-level knowledge.

How you will make an impact:

- Build and maintain well-engineered C++ code with high levels of stability and performance
- Implement gameplay mechanics, tools and debug tools supporting gameplay development
- Promote consistent best practices, processes, and procedures for game development, quality assurance, and maintenance
- Build and scale high-load distributed systems with microservice architecture
- Solve interesting problems, from designing and building new systems from scratch to optimizing features to be both performant and scriptable
- Collaborate daily with other team members

Your character build:
- Strong software engineer with experience using C++ / C# / Java / Scala
- 7+ years of professional full stack development experience
- 2+ years of experience developing multiplayer games with Unreal or Unity (required)
- Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Bachelor‚Äôs of Engineering (preferred) 
- Video game enthusiast with a deep understanding of game development, especially multiplayer games
- Have an entrepreneurial spirit that calls you to do build something people love
- Focused on learning, guiding, collaboration, and growth
- Familiar with modern consumer web technologies, such as Figma, Miro, and Notion

Our bonus attributes:

Dress: Wear whatever makes you feel most comfortable, PJs are also acceptable.
Vacation: Stay relaxed with our unlimited vacation policy, we don't count your days off as long as you bring back snacks.
Flexibility: Work from home, office, coworking space, or beach.
Relocation: Discover Thailand's vibrant culture and lush landscapes with our comprehensive relocation benefit.
Wellness: We invest in your wellness, whether you want to focus on physical or mental health.
Health: We‚Äôve got you covered, comprehensive insurance is the name of the game.
Team: Join our awesome team and enjoy cat memes, games and most importantly food!
Salary: We‚Äôll make sure you‚Äôre covered, so that you don‚Äôt have to stress about your finances.
Investors: We are backed by the top VC‚Äôs in the space, including Solana Ventures, Griffin Gaming Partners, Animoca Brands, and more...
Bureaucracy: We don‚Äôt like it either, we prefer direct communication and trust that in times of need we will support each other.

If this sounds interesting to you, we‚Äôd love to speak with you more about it. Please send us as a message in Discord at Ahmad117#6273 or by email at ahmad@projectiroh.com and we can set up a casual, no pressure introduction.

title: Development Director
job_description: About Splash Damage¬†Splash Damage¬†is¬†dedicated to¬†crafting¬†team-based¬†games that ignite friendships as much as they do healthy competition and teamwork.¬†We‚Äôve¬†forged¬†enduring¬†experiences within¬†some of gaming‚Äôs most beloved franchises over the years and¬†are now entering a bold new era fuelled by ambitious projects¬†utilising¬†both established and original IP, a¬†move into self-publishing and expansion into new locations.¬†¬†We're advocates for a healthy work-life balance¬†and¬†believe that our teams create the best work when they have a range of perspectives and experiences to draw from. We're committed to increasing diversity across our studio, fostering an inclusive environment to ensure everyone's voices are heard.¬†Our efforts have been recognised with several best employer awards over the years. Most recently,¬†we were awarded the coveted¬†3-star¬†‚Äòworld-class employer‚Äô¬†accreditation¬†by Best Companies¬†and¬†named the 58th¬†best large company to work for in the UK, and the 29th¬†best large company in London.¬†Due to the on-going COVID-19¬†situation, we're all currently working from home.¬†We continue to hire across our projects and will set you up remotely¬†for the time being.¬†¬†We¬†offer a comprehensive benefits package¬†for¬†you¬†and¬†your¬†family, including:¬†Private Medical and Dental Cover for you and your family,¬†along with the¬†24/7¬†Babylon digital GP service¬†Get mental health support from our trained Mental Health First Aiders or via our third-party¬†counselling¬†service¬†24/7 employee assistance helpline offering advice and support¬†on¬†a range of¬†topics, including health, relationships, finances, and¬†the law¬†25 days of annual leave, plus 8¬†public¬†holidays¬†and our¬†annual closure between Christmas and New Year‚Äôs¬†Industry-leading¬†fully-paid¬†30 weeks maternity leave & 10 weeks paternity leave¬†Enhanced company pension contributions¬†Our famous¬†social events¬†are open to¬†you and your family¬†to help you build friendships and have some fun along the way¬†Group life assurance scheme¬†About Development Management at Splash Damage¬†Development Managers are the execution pioneers here at Splash Damage, responsible for building and delivering game experiences that continually delight our fans on a daily basis.¬†We are the guardians of agile development process and practice; are responsible for driving alignment and accountability within each game team; are relentlessly focused on continued improvement; and ensure partners goals are met with mind-blowing ends.¬†The Development Management team is a collective hivemind, collaborating with their product teams, operational disciplines and studio leadership, sharing knowledge and best practices. We are stewards of accountability making sure every developer here owns their products, processes and quality. We keep teams balanced, projects on track and stakeholders informed. We strive for smarter delivery, stronger teams and building forward-thinking live experiences that our players, and ourselves are all proud of.¬†What you're responsible for:¬†A Development Director leads and drives a game's overall development plan, constantly focused on team performance and health whilst executing against the ongoing vision for the game. They are entrusted with bringing together the people, materials and tools, un encumbering teams through constant direction, mentoring and management; and are not afraid to change agile production process to match team performance to ensure a strong focus on quality, teamwork, communication and improvement to continually execute great games and content.¬†As a Development Director you own the project plan to launch and continually operate the game in on time, to quality, and within budget. Drawing on your agile leadership experience, you are able to continually review and improve the development process and team performance, and executive development plans to suit different projects.¬†You are quality-first focused and understand the needs of our players and the business. You will be accountable for the overall project plan and make data-driven decisions to improve your teams and align them around the long-term plans for operating a GaaS. You will be the voice of reason when needed, as teams balance creative ambition with their proven capacity to execute on time. You will be the single source of truth and represent the state and the outlook of the project internally and to external clients; and able to foster a open, fun and transparent development culture that makes teams and players love the games we make.¬†If you pull this off in year one, you can expect to gain additional scale to your role and everything that comes with that.What we'd like to see:¬†- A gamer: you love games, you play games, you take play seriously ‚Äì it‚Äôs what drove you to the industry and why you love coming to work every single day¬†- A strategist: your careful planning and dream to produce results makes you an effective leader who can balance and prioritize short-term solutions with the long-term vision and goals; when making key decisions, you leave no stone unturned.¬†- A tactical delegator: you know how to get things done by using your tailored and proven management skills and clinical handling of agile development to allow your team to execute on the goals and craft the best product possible.¬†- Aspirational leader: you help others empower themselves by fostering an environment of shared ownership, accountability, constructive criticism, recognition, appreciation, and collaboration; you communicate daily with the team to update them on issues, achievements, priorities and goals.¬†- An information sponge: You are able to collect and articulate it with the teams and clients on a regular basis, tailoring your style and the content suitable to the audience at hand.¬†- A communications specialist: you know that good leadership is based on clear and aligned communication and trust. You are an ambitious leader that constantly maintains a high standard of openness and trust with every team member and expect the same high level of patience from your team as you do yourself.¬†- A flawless executioner: you've got the entire project mapped out with a clear view of the likely obstacles that are in your path and always have a crafted plan to steer clear of them through agile production and planning and advise other project leaders from falling over the same pitfalls.¬†Splash Damage is an equal opportunity employer. We believe our teams create better work when they have a range of perspectives to draw from, and we are committed to creating an inclusive working environment that celebrates diversity.

title: Lead Game Designer
job_description: ABOUT SPLASH DAMAGEWe believe that games play better with friends. For more than 20 years, we‚Äôve been creating team-based multiplayer experiences that have entertained tens of millions of players all over the world and forged countless new friendships along the way.Our studio culture is rooted in our open, friendly, and collaborative environment. Our games are made by people from all over the world, from our entry-level Fresh Talent hires to industry veterans, and we believe that fostering that diverse culture is the best way to build both our games and our studio. We have won numerous awards, including a ‚ÄòWorld-Class‚Äô accreditation by Best Companies and being named one of the UK‚Äôs 100 Best Large Companies to work for.While our offices are based in Bromley, UK, our people have access to progressive working patterns that give them the flexibility to decide how to do their best work.THE OPPORTUNITYEver wanted to make your own mark on a shooter? Well at Splash Damage, there‚Äôs plenty of opportunity to do just that ‚Äì depending on the size of the team (we make different size projects to suit different people), you‚Äôll manage the design for the whole game, or own one of area of the game completely. Sound interesting? Good - this is a pivotal role at the heart of a dynamic team of talented people who love to get stuff done.THE TEAMAs a Lead Game Designer, you‚Äôll be a terrific mentor to designers and someone the Design Director trusts and looks toward to help to communicate and evangelise the game vision, helping the team express their goals through a fantastic player experience. At Splash Damage, we genuinely believe in teams collaborating, so you can expect to be talking to artists, animators, programmers, writers, and a whole load of other people on the team too. What better way to align teams, than by talking to them?THE DOCSWe often use documents to communicate our intent, keeping them fun, clear, and sometimes illustrated! We also use templates to make everyone lives a bit easier, so you won‚Äôt need to spend days locked in a room writing by candlelight. But in the end, documents are there to get ideas across, so expect to follow up in person to help people grasp ideas and answer questions. After all, it really helps if everyone is bought into the idea and is excited to help realise it in game.THE FUN STUFFYou‚Äôll own whole feature designs of the game, and at times, the whole game itself! Sometimes that will mean pitching an initial idea, getting feedback from feature teams and once design, art and programming have had a chance to kick the tyres, getting a prototype up and running. But at other times, that will mean you‚Äôll be managing, mentoring, and coaching Game Designers on your team, working alongside Production to help them realise their designs in the build.Once in game, the fun really begins ‚Äì you‚Äôll help teams with balancing, think about the metrics you need and let people know about any development restrictions, after all constraints can really help junior members find their feet! When you‚Äôre ready, you‚Äôll lead focus group sessions, gather feedback, and share your findings with the product team ‚Äì together you can figure out whether it‚Äôs what your players really want!COMMUNICATING WELLAt Splash Damage, we believe in communicating well, always remembering who we‚Äôre talking to and how they might perceive what we‚Äôre saying. You‚Äôll have the chance to talk to external partners and feedback on their deliverables and manage relationships, plus chat to the Press, our Fans, and the community, as well as speak in pre-recorded sessions and live events. And don‚Äôt worry, if public speaking isn‚Äôt your thing, there‚Äôs even help with that too. You will regularly present the areas of the game you are responsible for to the studio. Where necessary you will act as the deputy to the Design Director.We believe everyone can be a leader in their field. We‚Äôd like you to become one of them.YOUR EXPERIENCEA love of games ‚Äì you make them, you buy them, you play them & talk about them!A strong grasp of game design, but with an area you really get excited about ‚Äì it could be narrative, game-feel, retention, usability, player motivation or something else.Industry experience in a Lead position on one AAA console or PC title that featured a multiplayer component and worked on it from beginning to end: hopefully a 1st or 3rd person shooter!Capacity to think and communicate in terms of the player experienceHappy working independently and are drawn to solving problemsLeadership experience, including running a multi-person design team and familiarity with managing the performance of designers on your team. Experience planning, challenging and refining task estimates for junior designers.You are used to communicating vision and getting buy-in from teams & stakeholdersExcellent verbal and presentation skillsComfortable writing quality design documentation; including wiki-based design documentation, flow charts and spreadsheetsKnowledge of industry trends regarding genres, gameplay, and development and financial modelsExperience of prototyping gameplay mechanics using UE4, Unity, or similarAn understanding of systems, systemic design, emergent gameplay, and the place of procedural content generation in developmentSplash Damage is an equal opportunity employer. We believe our teams create better work when they have a range of perspectives to draw from, and we are committed to creating an inclusive working environment that celebrates diversity.BENEFITSWe offer a comprehensive benefits package for you and your family, including:Work your way with access to progressive working patterns including hybrid and fully remoteSubstantial performance-related pay system on top of your basic compensation, along with enhanced pension contributions and our life assurance schemeBespoke VISA and relocation packages for you and your family, with support from our team throughout the whole process25 days of holiday and 8 Bank Holidays a year, plus our annual studio closure between Christmas and New Year‚ÄôsPrivate Medical and Dental Cover for you and your family, along with a 24/7 digital GP serviceExtensive Mental Health support, with Line Manager Mental Health training, a group of Mental Health First-Aiders, and on-site or remote counsellingOur bespoke Learning and Development course framework to help you grow as an employee, manager, and leaderIndustry-leading fully paid 30 weeks maternity leave & 10 weeks paternity leave

title: Lead UI UX Designer (H/F/NB)
job_description:
Position at Amplitude Studios


Amplitude Studios¬†  Amplitude is a team of experienced, quality driven video game lovers and creators of the finest strategy games with the help of our players! Founded in 2011 and acquired by SEGA in 2016, we are a team of over 170 developers based in Paris with an international team hailing from all over the world.We recently released HUMANKIND‚Ñ¢, a historical strategy epic where players combine cultures and lead their people from the Bronze to the Modern age.We‚Äôre also well known for our critically acclaimed ENDLESS‚Ñ¢ series, played by millions worldwide, including ENDLESS‚Ñ¢ Space, ENDLESS‚Ñ¢ Legend, Dungeon of the ENDLESS‚Ñ¢, and ENDLESS‚Ñ¢ ¬†Space 2. Access to SEGA games portfolio¬† Friendly atmosphere, team cohesion and stimulating work environment :)¬† Remote policy¬†:¬†3 days/week at the studio Recruitment process: 3 interviews¬†+ technical test And also...¬† Weekly sports classes to stay in shape. Many events throughout the year: cooking workshops, tasting sessions, virtual escape games, etc. Monthly meetings with the entire studio to communicate the latest company news. A complete onboarding, allowing to accompany step by step the new team members.Amplitude Studios is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company.¬†__________   Amplitude Studios¬† ¬†Fond√©e en 2011, Amplitude Studios est une filiale du groupe SEGA sp√©cialis√©e dans les jeux de strat√©gie.¬†¬†Le studio est actuellement bas√© √† Paris et compte aujourd'hui plus de 170 personnes venant des quatre coins du monde.Nous avons r√©cemment sorti HUMANKIND‚Ñ¢, un jeu de strat√©gie historique dans lequel les joueurs et joueuses peuvent mener leur civilisation du N√©olithique √† l'√®re moderne, en combinant diff√©rentes cultures.¬†¬†Nous sommes aussi connus pour la s√©rie des jeux Endless, qui comptent des millions d‚Äôadeptes √† travers le monde¬†: ENDLESS‚Ñ¢¬†Space,¬†ENDLESS‚Ñ¢ Legend, Dungeon of the¬†ENDLESS‚Ñ¢¬†et¬†ENDLESS‚Ñ¢¬†Space¬†2.¬†Notre prochain titre r√©cemment annonc√© est ENDLESS‚Ñ¢ Dungeon, un jeu d'action rogue-lite en √©quipe.Le lien entre Amplitude et sa communaut√© est au c≈ìur de la philosophie du studio, et les √©quipes sont fi√®res de collaborer main dans la main avec leurs joueurs/joueuses. C‚Äôest dans cet esprit qu‚ÄôAmplitude a lanc√© le Games2Gether, une approche innovante de co-d√©veloppement, permettant de s'impliquer au plus pr√®s du processus de cr√©ation des jeux¬†!¬†D√©tails¬†du poste¬†Nous¬†recherchons¬†un(e) Lead UI UX Designer, en contrat √† dur√©e ind√©termin√©e, nous aider √† cr√©er la meilleure exp√©rience utilisateur pour nos joueurs sur un projet non annonc√©. Sous la supervision du Lead UI UX Designer, vos¬†principales missions¬†seront les suivantes¬†:¬†¬† Cr√©er et d√©livrer des interfaces ergonomiques,¬†attrayantes¬†et des ic√¥nes pertinentes. Proposer activement des am√©liorations visuelles √† nos jeux, aux interfaces des outils et au style des documents afin d'am√©liorer l'accessibilit√© de nos jeux (compr√©hension des ic√¥nes, ajustement du daltonisme, motion design...). title: Mid to Senior Tools Engineer
job_description:
Position at Creative Assembly


                This is an excellent opportunity for a passionate, and experienced Tools Engineer, to join the team behind Total War, Alien: Isolation and Halo Wars 2, to create thrilling game experiences on a new project being built in Unreal Engine 5 (UE5). This will be based at our studio in Horsham, in the heart of West Sussex. We‚Äôre building an agile team focused on continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will have a passion for learning, innovation and developing simple, powerful solutions and will bring a focus on delivering value to customers quickly. In this role you will iterate quickly not only on our technical solutions but also on our teams‚Äô own practices and patterns of work to continuously improve our ability to support the project and develop amazing experiences with UE5. Flexible working at Creative Assembly includes hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio. We recognise that there is no one-size-fits-all approach and empower our teams to define the working patterns which work best for them, which may mean different things for different teams and roles and at different times. This role is Hybrid and has an expectation of 1 day every 2 weeks in our Horsham studio. This role would consider fully remote working within country of employment. Further details can be discussed during the recruitment process.Key Responsibilities On a day-to-day basis, you willDevelop tools and solutions to support our developers & enable fast flow of work and fast feedback for their changes to our UE5 projectParticipate in our team‚Äôs process of ongoing continuous improvementWork closely with developers to help improve their processes and solve problems in active development on our UE5 projectWork closely with your team to further our team, project and studio values of continuous improvement, learning and rewarding, joyful workFoster sustainable development by maintaining the health and simplicity of our portfolio of solutionsPartner, share knowledge and assist colleagues in their personal developmentHave a tangible positive impact on the effectiveness of our team.Knowledge, Skill and Experience Essential Experience with and interest in working with Unreal EngineStrong experience developing in C++Strong technical programming skillsKnowledge of and active interest in Software Delivery Performance, modern working practices and development methodologies (ToC, Agile, DevOps, Lean, SoPK)Comfortable working in an innovative, experimental environment with an emphasis on rapid iterationPassion for games development and making software development enjoyable.Desirable Passion for improving the way we work and finding new solutions to existing problemsFlexible mentality and desire to experimentInterested in working in a generative, learning environment where experimentation and safety to fail are prioritisedFocus on Continuous Improvement, delivering proven value and taking an evidence-based approach to evaluating performancePassion for games.About Creative AssemblyIt‚Äôs an exciting time to be a part of our craft-led studio as we push boundaries, creating deep and detailed experiences that last.¬†Our teams are diverse from across the world, from trainees to industry veterans who constantly challenge us and make sure we are striving for the best within our games and our studio life. We are united through our shared values of Quality, Focus, Teamwork, Respect and Trust and we win awards for our culture and our people-centric approach, having won a Best Place to Work Award for six consecutive years. We invest in our people, the studio, and our projects. We are a company that‚Äôs secure and safe ‚Äì you don‚Äôt need to worry about job security at CA.Flexible working at Creative Assembly includes hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio. We recognise that there is no one-size-fits-all approach and empower our teams to define the working patterns which work best for them, which may mean different things for different teams and roles and at different times.We‚Äôll give you the creative freedom, tools, support, and development to achieve your potential.¬†Our studios are based in Horsham, UK and Sofia, Bulgaria, including several bespoke state-of-the-art audio suites and a dedicated motion capture facility.¬†We offer many benefits to support you and your family including:Flexible working: hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio workingWork from Anywhere for a temporary period each year (restrictions apply such as VISAs)Enhanced holiday allowance, maternity and paternity breaks, flexibility with our core hours, and no-notice holidaysBespoke relocation package for you and your dependents, with support throughout the process from our dedicated Relocation SpecialistsPrivate medical and dental insurance, life insurance, permanent health insurance, critical illness cover and free health care screeningGenerous holiday allowance plus full studio closure over the Christmas and New Year period, and all UK Bank holidaysAnnual discretionary studio bonusJoin our award-winning education and social responsibility programme; the Legacy Project, as an industry ambassador to mentor and educate othersDefined career development pathways and personalised training support including SEGA Dev Day, internal masterclasses, prestigious creative workshops, on-site training with renowned specialists and global conference attendanceOpportunity to join our Diversity and Inclusion Network ‚Äì an employee-led groupSeason ticket travel loans and cycle to work scheme with free bike servicing and discounted car valet service on siteFree games and merchandise plus access to our extensive games libraryFree breakfast in the studio every day - toast, bagels, pancakes, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, smoothies, juices, milkshakes and more in our fully stocked kitchenWellbeing support with an employee assistance programme and onsite confidential sessionsIn-studio heavily subsidised massage therapyDiscounts for home technology, travel insurance, corporate gym membership, cinema tickets, holidays, trips out and Ikea vouchers, and many local businesses including estate agentsStudio parties for you and your family; such as our Summer Festival, Christmas Party plus a separate Children‚Äôs Christmas Party. We also have Cinema days and wrap parties for game releasesStudio community activities such as life drawing, creative writing, Pilates, Walking Challenges, Couch to 5k, basketball, game and movie evenings, board game club, 5-a-side football, CA Choir, Sword fighting (yes, sword fighting) and loads more.Our studio sites have disabled access. We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

We are a company that‚Äôs secure and safe ‚Äì you don‚Äôt need to worry about job security at CA.Flexible working at Creative Assembly includes hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio. We recognise that there is no one-size-fits-all approach and empower our teams to define the working patterns which work best for them, which may mean different things for different teams and roles and at different times.We‚Äôll give you the creative freedom, tools, support, and development to achieve your potential.¬†Our studios are based in Horsham, UK and Sofia, Bulgaria, including several bespoke state-of-the-art audio suites and a dedicated motion capture facility.¬†We offer many benefits to support you and your family including:Flexible working: hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio workingWork from Anywhere for a temporary period each year (restrictions apply such as VISAs)Enhanced holiday allowance, maternity and paternity breaks, flexibility with our core hours, and no-notice holidaysBespoke relocation package for you and your dependents, with support throughout the process from our dedicated Relocation SpecialistsPrivate medical and dental insurance, life insurance, permanent health insurance, critical illness cover and free health care screeningGenerous holiday allowance plus full studio closure over the Christmas and New Year period, and all UK Bank holidaysAnnual discretionary studio bonusJoin our award-winning education and social responsibility programme; the Legacy Project, as an industry ambassador to mentor and educate othersDefined career development pathways and personalised training support including SEGA Dev Day, internal masterclasses, prestigious creative workshops, on-site training with renowned specialists and global conference attendanceOpportunity to join our Diversity and Inclusion Network ‚Äì an employee-led groupSeason ticket travel loans and cycle to work scheme with free bike servicing and discounted car valet service on siteFree games and merchandise plus access to our extensive games libraryFree breakfast in the studio every day - toast, bagels, pancakes, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, smoothies, juices, milkshakes and more in our fully stocked kitchenWellbeing support with an employee assistance programme and onsite confidential sessionsIn-studio heavily subsidised massage therapyDiscounts for home technology, travel insurance, corporate gym membership, cinema tickets, holidays, trips out and Ikea vouchers, and many local businesses including estate agentsStudio parties for you and your family; such as our Summer Festival, Christmas Party plus a separate Children‚Äôs Christmas Party. We also have Cinema days and wrap parties for game releasesStudio community activities such as life drawing, creative writing, Pilates, Walking Challenges, Couch to 5k, basketball, game and movie evenings, board game club, 5-a-side football, CA Choir, Sword fighting (yes, sword fighting) and loads more.Our studio sites have disabled access. We are an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.

title: Experienced/Senior Software Engineer ‚Äì Character Team
job_description:
Position at Hardlight


Experienced/Senior Software Engineer ‚Äì Character TeamAt SEGA HARDlight we're looking for a Software Engineer to take charge of our game character pipeline for our live F2P games. As part of the software engineering team you will help design and implement game systems & project features, setting up new game characters & power-ups as well as optimising the runtime to deal with a large roster of game characters. You should enjoy live-ops driven F2P games and understand what makes them tick. Our games are played by millions of people weekly with a large active community - come and help our games reach their full potential.Essential Skills & ExperienceStrong software engineering skills are essential. You have a good level of C# OR C++ experience, and a passion for problem-solvingYou care about the development process and improve it at every opportunityGood understanding of Object Oriented programming techniquesWorking with continuous integration, source control, and code review softwareDesirableUnity and Node.js experience is a bonusExperience with client/server technologies is beneficial, as well as with networking, database engines, and server infrastructureExperience with running a live product, regular update releases, and development of live-ops focused toolsWhy work at¬†HARDlight?You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes ULEV car salary sacrifice, life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension schemeWe offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making HARDlight the best it can beFor gaming buffs, we offer free SEGA games on Steam and a home technology schemeFitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership and ride-to-work scheme. You can find your zen with weekly yoga classes as well as in-house massage therapyWe pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to help work fit around youThe opportunity to be a large part of a small team, developing innovative titles with a huge SEGA back catalogueWe pride ourselves on helping you achieve your ambitions and offer Udemy courses to help improve your skills to become better equipped to further your careerWe want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!We are taking a hybrid working approach and you will be expected to work 3 days in the office with the option of 2 days out of the office.

title: Events Manager (12 Month FTC)
job_description:
Position at SEGA European Head Office


EVENTS MANAGER¬†12 MONTH FTC¬†CENTRAL MARKETING ‚Äì COMMS TEAM¬†BASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORD¬†REPORTING TO COMMUNICATIONS DIRECTOR, CENTRAL MARKETING¬†¬†POSITION OVERVIEW¬†¬†You will manage the overall direction and day-to-day activities needed to execute our global marketing events participation. This will include trade, industry and consumer facing events such as E3, Gamescom, TwitchCon, other relevant events and any bespoke events in relation to the SEGA roadmap and SEGA Europe business objectives. We‚Äôre looking for someone with a strong event management background, creative astuteness and a strategic mindset.¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†Working within the Central Marketing team, you‚Äôll get great insight and experience into the video games sector. You‚Äôll develop your knowledge across international marketplaces, physical and digital retail, consumer profiling and marketing initiatives within a leading games industry publisher. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone who is passionate and aspires to work as part of a successful team.¬†¬†You‚Äôll have excellent communication and rapport building skills as a core part of your role will be working closely with several internal SEGA teams including creative services, digital sales and international sales teams, communications teams, plus business development and commercial teams.¬†¬†¬†You will need strong strategic planning and meticulous budget management skills. Attention to detail is a must and knowledge and passion for gaming / entertainment forums is essential.¬†¬†¬†¬†KEY RESPONSIBILITIES¬†¬†¬†You will work in tandem with the Senior Product Managers in the Central Marketing Team and the studio marketing teams where relevant. Your core responsibility is to provide support in the planning and execution of the global events strategy by delivering on the following tasks:¬†¬†Lead overall event activations from inception to post event analysis (as assigned)¬†Collaborate with key stakeholders and internal teams to identify and establish event objectives, attendee experience, and budgets¬†Manage and cultivate agency relationships from pitch processes through to live events¬†Drive event production schedules with internal and external partners¬†Manage all aspects of event logistics including set up and tear-downs¬†Research venues, supporting agencies and 3rd party partnerships for event opportunities where relevant¬†Oversee all event equipment inventory and deployment for events¬†Conduct post-event reporting and tracking for ROI analysis¬†Communicating up-to-date information on progress by project to SEGA internal teams (inc Senior management)¬†Identifying and pursuing opportunities in existing and emerging markets with ROI analysis where relevant¬†Working collaboratively with our licensors to maximise our existing partnerships throughout the course of the product lifecycle¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE¬†¬†Must be detail oriented, possess good time management skills and be able to prioritize in a changing environment¬†Demonstrable record of delivering events to a quality level, by planned dates and within agreed budgets¬†Excellent project management, budget management and communication skills¬†Experience managing and running large scale consumer trade shows¬†Have a well-developed network of suppliers & agencies related to the field of event execution¬†Strong appreciation of publishing and broad, in-depth and up-to-date product knowledge of the mainstream games industry is preferable¬†Able to build and maintain strong professional and informal relationships within organisations and externally with members of the public¬†Pro-activeness to think ahead and identify tasks that need to be carried out and the motivation to complete these on own initiative¬†Flexibility to react quickly, reschedule and prioritise workload¬†Strong understanding of Gaming AV ‚Äì PCs, Consoles, Peripherals, Live Streaming, Capture Devices, etc¬†Must be strategic minded, creative, and be able to work effectively with internal and external teams¬†¬†Passion for the video game industry and a drive to have a career in gaming preferred

title: Licensing Coordinator - 12 Month FTC
job_description:
Position at SEGA European Head Office


LICENSING COORDINATORSEGA of AMERICA - EMEA LICENSINGBASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORDHYBRID WORKING - 2 DAYS IN SEGA OFFICE, UP TO 3 DAYS FROM HOMEPOSITION OVERVIEWThe Licensing Coordinator will provide administrative support in the day to day running of the licensing activities and aid in the communication with key internal stakeholders. The role will involve working with and supporting the Brand Licensing team in a varied, interesting and demanding environment and will be exposed to all areas of the licensing business including liaison with licensees, agents and other partners.¬†KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Assisting the Brand Licensing team with the creation, maintenance and operation of a licensing administration process including: ¬†Assistance in updating central documents (e.g. licensee lists, gap analyses, financial reports‚Ä¶), Assist in updating brand presentations.  Support in processing of deal memos and approvals process Support in contracts coordination including liaising with SEGA departments, agents and licensees Gathering licensee updates including retail listings, product release schedules and marketing activity Facilitate access for licensees to brand assets  Assist in the planning (diary management) and execution of meetings with existing and prospective licensees as well as retailers.  Day to day operational tasks such as mailings and archiving (product development submissions and deal memos/contracts)  Raise PO‚Äôs and process invoices  Raising NDA requests Carrying out miscellaneous administrational tasks ¬†KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: The successful candidate must possess the following attributes:-  Enthusiastic and self motivated  An extremely competent and capable administrator with outstanding organisational skills.  High attention to detail with the ability to produce accurate reports  Ability to work efficiently and in a team  Able to communicate effectively with internal and external customers  Flexible approach to work with willingness to take on extra responsibilities outside the remit of the job description  Ability to multi-task and prioritise with minimal supervision  Motivated to carry out routine administrative tasks  Able to handle sensitive information professionally and maintain confidentialityExtremely proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook

title: HR Business Partner  - Publishing
job_description:
Position at SEGA European Head Office


HR BUSINESS PARTNER ‚Äì PUBLISHINGHRBASED AT SEGA HQ IN BRENTFORDHYBRID WORKING ‚Äì 2 DAYS IN SEGA OFFICE, UP TO 3 DAYS FROM HOME¬†REPORTING TO HR DIRECTORA BIT ABOUT SEGA¬†SEGA is one of the leading interactive entertainment companies in the world, with our European HQ based in West London and our seven development studios spanning the UK, Bulgaria, France and Canada. Known for quality and creativity above all else, our studios include Sports Interactive, HARDlight, Amplitude Studios, Two Point Studios, The Creative Assembly and Relic Entertainment.‚ÄØ¬†At the heart of SEGA is our publishing team based in London, where we help the studios bring their creative vision to life. Here we have a hardworking bunch of people spanning Technology, Sales, Marketing, Finance, QA and more.‚ÄØ¬†Together, we drive the continued success and evolution of our Western business through living our company values of always collaborating, being entrepreneurial in spirit, having a winning mentality and focusing on uncompromising quality.POSITION OVERVIEWThis is a varied, hands-on role working with the HR Director in the Publishing HR team which supports our Publishing group in West London. A highly skilled, engaged and diverse group, the SEGA Europe publishing teams service our development studios and leading the SOE (SEGA of Europe) Publishing services, which acts as our European HQ and collaborating with our SOA (SEGA of America), who have a group of UK based staff that require local HR support.Our Publishing team is in West London and is currently home to approximately 180 staff with departments including Commercial Publishing through Sales, Marketing and PR, Business Development, Business and Product Planning, Online Technology and various support functions including HR, Legal and Finance.¬†¬† The HR Business Partner, Publishing will be part of a team of 4 dedicated staff with the goal of delivering a highly engaging, talent focused and proactive HR and recruitment service with full employee lifecycle support to the Publishing group, creating innovative experiences for our Publishing team that attract, engage, retain and develop talent.¬† The HR Publishing team is supported by the SEGA Central Services functions (Total Reward, Mobility, Systems, Payroll).¬†KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Business Partnering Responsible for Culture and Employee development & wellbeing for the publishing divisions in London. Engage in regular and effective communication with People Managers and wider SEGA HR Team to: Ensure early identification, intervention, and resolution of people challenges Drive Diversity & Inclusion initiatives Ensure SEGA‚Äôs employee life cycle operations are managed impeccably (Recruitment, On & Off boarding, probation, long service, etc) Provide support to managers and employees around performance management, including appraisals, development plans, objective setting, and career development. Provide guidance to organisational and team challenges in a commercial and compliant manner. Advise employees and management on policies, processes, and systems Champion and promote HR initiatives across the teams Identify opportunities & solutions for individual and team development needs, including training, coaching & performance management. Manage employee relations activity as required and coach leadership team on ER matters and policy development. Understand and advise managers on relevant UK law. Assist with ongoing review of policies and communications to ensure they are compliant and aligned to business and commercial goals across the whole region Regularly review, analyse, and prepare insights based on available analytics to recommend future approaches and incentives. Provide coaching and guidance to the publishing teams as required. Implement Enterprise HR initiatives and advise on local considerations. Process improvements - assistance in identifying areas for process streamlining & drawing up process workflow documents as required Updating & producing copy /content for HR Communications channels. Development of Learning & Career Development ChannelsKNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & EXPERIENCEEssential  CIPD Qualified (min level 5) Completer Finisher able to structure own workload and manage competing priorities Proven experience of resolving complex HR issues Demonstratable knowledge and experience of organisational change. Knowledge and experience of UK Employment Law & HR Practices Robust communication skills The ability to influence and challenge decisions whilst building relationships Resilient with good sense of humour Experience of using HRIS (Sage, PeopleSoft, Workday etc)¬†Desirable Experience working within a technology or development organisation Interest in Video Games, Video Games Development & the Games Industry.¬†WORKING THE SEGA WAY‚ÄØ¬†¬†We believe that making the best games relies on having the best people, so we make sure that we look after ours, even more so with most staff splitting their time between home and office working.¬†¬† For our gaming buffs, you can get involved in our online gaming nights and free SEGA games on Steam‚ÄØ Fitness fanatics will love our discounted gym membership and ride to work scheme. You can find your zen with our weekly virtual yoga classes as well as online physical therapy with our masseuse.‚ÄØ We hold regular company updates to keep everyone in the loop and we stay connected with social events like virtual pub quizzes and art workshops‚ÄØ We support your learning & development with access to online courses through Udemy, and webinars and resources on mental health and financial wellbeing‚ÄØ When you‚Äôre in the virtual office, we‚Äôll make sure you have everything you need when it comes to tech/furniture, and we pride ourselves on having flexible working hours to ensure that you have a life outside of your home office‚ÄØ You'll have access to a comprehensive benefits package that includes life assurance, income protection, private healthcare & dental insurance schemes and an enhanced contributory pension scheme. We offer competitive salaries and a fantastic bonus scheme so that you can stay motivated and focused on making SEGA the best it can be‚ÄØ¬†We want people of all backgrounds to see themselves represented and included in our work, so we actively seek to diversify our team and bring more voices to the table. All applicants are welcome!

title: Software Engineer (Console)
job_description:
Position at Sports Interactive


Job Title:¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† Software Engineer (Console)Team:¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†ConsoleLocation:¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† SI HQ, Here East, LondonReporting to:¬†¬†Senior Producer (Console)Position OverviewSports Interactive is looking for a talented Software Engineer to join the newly formed Console team and take the existing Football Manager Touch product to new and exciting heights. Your role will include integrating new features and quality of-life changes from Football Manager, as well as creating and reviewing technical designs for mainly console specific features. All Software Engineer‚Äôs are required to adhere to the coding standards set by the studio.¬†¬† We are looking for self-motivated people with good communication skills who can complete work independently as well as part of a team. Key ResponsibilitiesIntegrate new and existing Football Manager features and quality-of-life changes into the Football Manager Touch code base and ensure build stability.Work closely with the UX/UI Designers and Game Designers to create, scope and develop new console features for Football Manager Touch.Work across multiple platforms and projects to ensure we deliver the best performance and experience to our customer base.Collaborate with other disciplines, including QA, Producers, and other engineering teams, on both development and future planning.Contribute to research and support the console team in line with studio and department objectives.Knowledge, Skills and Experience Good knowledge of modern C++ and C# languages.  Good knowledge of design patterns and software engineering best practices.  Minimum of two years of professional experience using C++ as the main language and C# as a secondary language.  Minimum of three years‚Äô experience in both leading and mentoring a team.  Experience designing and developing systems for multiple platforms.  Strong academic background with a 2:1 degree (or equivalent) or higher in a relevant technical field such as computer science, software engineering, mathematics, or physics.  Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills.  Good communication skills for effective collaboration with software engineers, artists, animators, QA, and production staff.  Self-motivated with a drive to improve yourself and others continuously.  A good understanding of performance and optimisation.  Experience with Unity preferable.Studio OverviewSports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we‚Äôve captivated a global pool of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We‚Äôre a wholly owned subsidiary of SEGA having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.  We‚Äôre a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. But no matter how big we dream, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.Further information on the company and its games is available at www.sigames.comWorking Here¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†We approach everything with passion, whether that‚Äôs making our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who shows up to work here each day.¬†We like our talent tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to constantly topping our best, and encourage our people to fiercely realise their own personal potential.We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you‚Äôre in. Above all else, we‚Äôre a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic, that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do; one of the many reasons we‚Äôre one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry.biz 2021 Large studio category).And if you want a work/life balance, we‚Äôre behind you. Because while we live to create extraordinary games, we know that‚Äôs not all you‚Äôve got going on. You can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.Our flexible working culture gives team members the¬†responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid and remote working options dependent on role. Even in countries where we don‚Äôt directly employ*, we‚Äôll even explore what‚Äôs possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences. We‚Äôre also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.*We‚Äôre able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.Inclusivity Matters  We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.SI is proudly a Disability Confident Committed employer, and we are dedicated to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. Our studio has disabled access and facilities but please ensure you advise us if you require any other reasonable adjustments to be made to support you during the recruitment process. This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder. It does not form part of the contract of employment.

title: Lead UI Programmer (H/F/NB)
job_description:

title: Junior Software Engineer Intern
job_description:
Position at Sports Interactive


Position Overview‚ÄØ¬†Get ready to kick-off your games development career at Sports Interactive.¬†We are looking for a¬†talented and enthusiastic¬†Software Engineer Intern to join our¬†development¬†team¬†and work on the¬†code¬†behind the¬†next release of Football Manager.¬†¬†As a Software Engineer Intern at¬†Sports Interactive,¬†you will work closely with our¬†award-winning¬†development team¬†where you will gain knowledge and experience of games development practices and software engineering to create experiences played by millions.¬†¬†This role will commence in¬†May / June 2023. This¬†duration of the internship is available as¬†a full-year sandwich placement or for a period of at least six months.¬†Applications with no covering letter will not be accepted.¬†It will be¬†beneficial¬†to provide examples of¬†your¬†own demos¬†with source code.¬†Key‚ÄØResponsibilities¬†Iterate on existing features and mechanics¬†Work with Senior¬†developers and¬†gain in-depth knowledge of software and games development best practices.¬†Help analyse/profile¬†existing projects and improve upon them.¬†Knowledge, Skills and Experience¬†Currently pursuing a bachelors or masters level degree in computer sciences or games development at UK university¬†Strong C++ programming¬†and debugging¬†skills¬†¬†Good maths and problem-solving skills¬†An understanding of game engine architecture¬†Experience with using version control software¬†Excellent written and verbal communication skills¬†Excellent¬†team working skills¬†¬†Desirable¬†Passion for and knowledge of world football.¬†Passion for computer games highly advantageous.¬†Knowledge of Sports Interactive products and tools¬†(FM Editor)¬†highly advantageous.¬†Studio Overview  Sports Interactive (SI) is an ambitious development studio creating immersive sports management simulations. Since 1994, we‚Äôve captivated a global pool of players with our iconic, BAFTA award-winning game, Football Manager. We‚Äôre a wholly owned subsidiary of SEGA having caught their attention in 2006 with our continuous critical and commercial success.  We‚Äôre a tenacious community, coming together at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London. Always expanding, the SI team takes on the gaming genre through a diverse array of disciplines. But no matter how big we dream, we keep our approach (and your schedule) flexible, creating a relaxed atmosphere where collaboration can thrive.Working HereWe approach everything with passion, whether that‚Äôs making our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who shows up to work here each day.¬†We like our talent tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to constantly topping our best, and encourage our people to fiercely realise their own personal potential.We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you‚Äôre in. Above all else, we‚Äôre a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic, that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do; one of the many reasons we‚Äôre one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry.biz 2021 Large studio category).And if you want a work/life balance, we‚Äôre behind you. Because while we live to create extraordinary games, we know that‚Äôs not all you‚Äôve got going on. You can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.Our flexible working culture gives team members the¬†responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid and remote working options. Even in countries where we don‚Äôt directly employ*, we‚Äôll even explore what‚Äôs possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences.And when you‚Äôre not here making the world‚Äôs best management games, there‚Äôs a top-class benefits package for permanent team members based in the UK, including gym membership, private health, and dental care, plus many more perks. For those permanent team members outside of the UK, we strive to offer equivalent and localised benefits. ¬†We‚Äôre also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.*We‚Äôre able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.Inclusivity Matters  We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder.¬† It does not form part of the contract of employment.

title: Junior Software Engineer
job_description:
Position at Sports Interactive


Job Title:¬†Junior Software EngineerLocation: SI HQ, Here East, LondonPOSITION OVERVIEWOur studio is continuing to expand, and we have some amazing opportunities across all teams within Sports Interactive for Junior Software Engineers. We are seeking self-motivated people with good communication skills, who can demonstrate a solid understanding of developing in C++ and C# and knowledge of software development practices. We are offering you an exciting opportunity to become a part of the award-winning development team here at SI. We have an outstanding development history across sports simulation games and a proven track record of developing talent. Sports Interactive aims to create a solid foundation of knowledge and develop the successful candidate‚Äôs skills to aid in a long and fruitful career in the video games industry.We get a lot of applicants, and we have a high-quality bar for entry; make sure that you can stand out from the crowd by including a portfolio of your work. Be sure to provide links to try out games or apps and show us what you have made on your journey towards joining the games industry.Though not required, a passion and love for the beautiful game of Football is desirable.DEPARTMENTS YOU COULD WORK INCore TechnologyTools and AutomationMatch EngineCompetition and Rule groupsGameplayUIConsoleKnowledge, Skills, and Experience:¬†Good knowledge of modern C++ and C# languages.Basic knowledge of design patterns and software engineering best practices.Strong academic background with a 2:1 degree (or equivalent) or higher in a relevant technical field such as computer science, software engineering, mathematics, or physics.Strong analytical, and problem-solving skills.Good communication skills for effective collaboration with software engineers, artists, animators, QA, and production staff.Self-motivated with a drive to improve yourself and others continuously.IMPORTANT NOTESYou must have the right to work in the UKApplications with no cover letter or portfolio will not be accepted.Take the time to inform us of who you are, and why you want to be part of the Sports Interactive Team.Applications with no C++/C# experience will not be accepted.Experience with Unity beneficial.Studio OverviewSports Interactive (SI) is a multi-award-winning game development studio and the world‚Äôs leading developer of sports management simulations. Founded in 1994, SI became a wholly owned subsidiary of SEGA in 2006. Based at the Here East technology hub in Stratford, East London, the SI team continues to expand as it brings its titles to an ever-growing audience via an increasing variety of delivery platforms.SI has enjoyed sustained commercial and critical success for its extremely detailed and immersive simulation experiences. Its games are amongst the highest-rated PC titles (according to Metacritic) and frequently occupy both the ‚Äòtop selling‚Äô and ‚Äòmost played‚Äô charts on Steam.The Sports Interactive team is diverse and international, bringing together world class and high potential talent with a combined passion and drive for creating genre-defining games. Team members enjoy a flexible working schedule and a relaxed studio environment that encourages a close-knit, collaborative approach to game development.SI is an equal opportunities employer and encourages applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.SI offers a generous benefits package to all full-time team members including gym membership, in-house massage therapy and private healthcare (including dental). The studio is also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boasts one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry with just over 30% of the current full-time team members having been at the studio for 10 years or longer. SI also has many longstanding partnerships with leading charities, local schools and major sporting organisations.Further information on Sports Interactive, its games and life at the studio can be found at¬†www.sigames.com.Working HereWe approach everything with passion, whether that‚Äôs making our mark on the gaming and football industries or doing our bit for the world around us. We want to share that outlook with everyone who shows up to work here each day.¬†We like our talent tenacious, so you can expect to surround yourself with other ambitious individuals bringing their A-game to many different disciplines. We know collaboration is the key to constantly topping our best, and encourage our people to fiercely realise their own personal potential.We believe everyone matters, no matter which part of the business you‚Äôre in. Above all else, we‚Äôre a team. A team with a down-to-earth dynamic, that works and plays together. We have fun doing what we do; one of the many reasons we‚Äôre one of the best places to work in the UK games business (Gameindustry.biz 2021 Large studio category).And if you want a work/life balance, we‚Äôre behind you. Because while we live to create extraordinary games, we know that‚Äôs not all you‚Äôve got going on. You can trust that we always keep things in perspective, fostering an environment where work can be more than just a job.Our flexible working culture gives team members the¬†responsibility to optimise their workloads, with in-office, hybrid and remote working options dependent on role. Even in countries where we don‚Äôt directly employ*, we‚Äôll even explore what‚Äôs possible via third parties and do our best to accommodate location preferences. We‚Äôre also a London Living Wage employer and proudly boast one of the lowest staff turnover rates in the industry.*We‚Äôre able to directly employ in the UK, Ireland, France, Sweden and Finland.Inclusivity Matters  We‚Äôre proud to be an equal opportunities employer and encourage applications from any relevant candidate irrespective of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion, or belief. Our studio has disabled access and facilities.SI is proudly a Disability Confident Committed employer, and we are dedicated to ensuring our recruitment process is inclusive and accessible. Our studio has disabled access and facilities but please ensure you advise us if you require any other reasonable adjustments to be made to support you during the recruitment process. This job description is an accurate reflection of the duties and responsibilities of the post as at the time of writing but will be changed from time to time as the job is a career development job which will be adjusted according to the progress of the job holder. It does not form part of the contract of employment.

job_description:

As a Senior Game Designer, you will be responsible for creating and guiding the latest feature designs for Football Manager projects on PC. Typical activities will include features definition, systems, and interfaces, with the end goal to feed our football simulation with more quality and depth. You will join an ambitious and passionate team who care deeply about delivering an outstanding Football Manager experience for PC through improving its quality, usability, and unrivalled depth. The ideal candidate will be a dynamic, self-motivated, and creative individual, with outstanding communication skills, solid design methodology, the ability to champion features and work within a cross-disciplinary team to bring them to life. title: Narrative Lead
job_description:
Position at Creative Assembly


                This is an excellent opportunity for an experienced Narrative Lead to join the team behind Total War, Alien: Isolation and Halo Wars 2 on a new project being built in Unreal Engine 5 (UE5). This will be based at our studio in Horsham, in the heart of West Sussex.The successful candidate will lead the narrative team and development, weaving the narrative through the player experience in a variety of means and at a variety of levels. Reporting to the Creative Director and working closely with other key stakeholders (internally and externally) to create a compelling and engaging narrative player experience.Flexible working at Creative Assembly includes hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio. We recognise that there is no one-size-fits-all approach and empower our teams to define the working patterns which work best for them, which may mean different things for different teams and roles and at different times.This role is Hybrid and has an expectation of 1 day every 2 weeks in our Horsham studio. We will consider remote working in exceptional circumstances. Further details can be discussed during the recruitment process.Key Responsibilities¬†¬†On a day-to-day basis you will be:Lead the narrative development (worldbuilding, plot, characters, tone, themes, voice, style, cinematic direction, editing etc.) to create a compelling and engaging narrative that delivers on the project's visionDefine, direct and realise the means with which to communicate the narrativeCommunicate and champion the narrative within the teamBuild and mentor the narrative team (eg. from writers to implementors)Overseeing, planning and managing the narrative teamWork with key stakeholders and departments within the team or externally to ensure alignment, prioritisation and delivery of the narrativeHighlight and maximise opportunities for the narrative to enhance the player experience.Knowledge, Skill and ExperienceEssentialExcellent understanding of narrative delivery within video gamesProven experience delivering narrative within a game development environment (cinematics, VO, audio, marketing, external to the game etc.)Strong conceptualisation and communication skillsStrong creativity and imaginative problem-solving skillsStrong writing and editing ability, with the ability to rapidly iterateStrong understanding and experience of game developmentAbility to manage and lead narrative teamBroad understanding of game design with a focus on narrativeNatural collaborator with excellent communication and presentation skillsOpen attitude, able to work well in a creative environment, under pressure, adaptable and solution focusedPassion for job_description:

By becoming very familiar with the game, you‚Äôll check each version and detect problems early. Position at Hardlight

title: Senior Animator ‚Äì HYENAS (FPS)
job_description:
Position at Creative Assembly


                Creative Assembly is looking for an experienced Animator to join our talented team to work on HYENAS, our exciting new First-Person Multiplayer shooter. This role is Hybrid and has an expectation of 2-3 days a week, in our Horsham studio. We will consider remote working (within country of employment) for exceptional candidates. We are united through our shared values of Quality, Focus, Teamwork, Respect and Trust and we win awards for our culture and our people-centric approach, having won a Best Place to Work Award for six consecutive years. We invest in our people, the studio, and our projects. We are a company that‚Äôs secure and safe ‚Äì you don‚Äôt need to worry about job security at CA.We‚Äôll give you the creative freedom, tools, support, and development to achieve your potential.¬†Our studios are based in Horsham, UK and Sofia, Bulgaria, including several bespoke state-of-the-art audio suites and a dedicated motion capture facility.¬†We offer many benefits to support you and your family including:Flexible working: hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio workingWork from Anywhere for a temporary period each year (restrictions apply such as VISAs)Enhanced holiday allowance, maternity and paternity breaks, flexibility with our core hours, and no-notice holidaysBespoke relocation package for you and your dependents, with support throughout the process from our dedicated Relocation SpecialistsPrivate medical and dental insurance, life insurance, permanent health insurance, critical illness cover and free health care screeningGenerous holiday allowance plus full studio closure over the Christmas and New Year period, and all UK Bank holidaysAnnual discretionary studio bonusJoin our award-winning education and social responsibility programme; the Legacy Project, as an industry ambassador to mentor and educate othersDefined career development pathways and personalised training support including SEGA Dev Day, internal masterclasses, prestigious creative workshops, on-site training with renowned specialists and global conference attendanceOpportunity to join our Diversity and Inclusion Network ‚Äì an employee-led groupSeason ticket travel loans and cycle to work scheme with free bike servicing and discounted car valet service on siteFree games and merchandise plus access to our extensive games libraryFree breakfast in the studio every day - toast, bagels, pancakes, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, smoothies, juices, milkshakes and more in our fully stocked kitchenWellbeing support with an employee assistance programme and onsite confidential sessionsIn-studio heavily subsidised massage therapyDiscounts for home technology, travel insurance, corporate gym membership, cinema tickets, holidays, trips out and Ikea vouchers, and many local businesses including estate agentsStudio parties for you and your family; such as our Summer Festival, Christmas Party plus a separate Children‚Äôs Christmas Party. We also have Cinema days and wrap parties for game releasesStudio community activities such as life drawing, creative writing, Pilates, Walking Challenges, Couch to 5k, basketball, game and movie evenings, board game club, 5-a-side football, CA Choir, Sword fighting (yes, sword fighting) and loads more.Our studio sites have disabled access. title: Lead Software Engineer - Game Tools
job_description: Job Title - Lead Software Engineer - Game Tools¬†Reports Into - Tools Lead(UK)Location - Hybrid / Almada¬†A Little Bit about Kwalee‚Ä¶.Kwalee is one of the world‚Äôs leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let‚Äôs Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe.What‚Äôs In It For You?Profit sharing scheme - we win, you win¬†Quarterly Team Building daysPitch and make your own games on Creative Wednesdays!¬†Flexible working hours - we trust you to choose how and when you work bestAll the equipment that you need to be properly set up¬†Are You Up To The Challenge?As the Lead Software Engineer - Game Tools you‚Äôll be helping to lead the Tools and Core Tech team, you will have a highly motivated team of programmers that are driven by clean code, automation and get a kick out of finding ways to improve efficiency and the lives of others (by writing great tools).You will be the gatekeeper to the company‚Äôs Core code and make sure the basis for all our games is stable, quick and easy to use and versatile to allow us to keep pushing how creative our games can be.¬†Your Team MatesThe curious-minded Tools team power our Kwalee games with the tools we need to make chart-topping games. They always find a way to make what we can‚Äôt do possible. They‚Äôre always up for learning new APIs and technologies to make our gamedev efforts more convenient.What Does The Job Actually Involve?Alongside our Tools Lead you‚Äôll be managing dedicated teams each with their own objectives and challengesAlways on the lookout for new technologies that might benefit the businessUsing C# and Unity as the main technologies in your day to day work.Designing and writing high quality and reliable codeWriting Core Systems used by all gamesWorking with scripting languagesWorking closely with third party SDKsSolving any challenges that might appear on the way.Contributing towards ideas for tools and helping to grow the department.¬†Your Hard SkillsAt least 4 years of experience in development with C# or C++.Experience with Unity.Unity Editor Tools experience would be a plus.Experience with scripting languagesAndroid / iOS experience would be a plus.Excellent communication skills.An avid interest in either console or mobile games, preferably both.Good architecture knowledgeAble to lead a team and provide technical directionYour Soft SkillsKwalee has grown fast in recent years but we‚Äôre very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues.¬†We don‚Äôt like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together.
