title: Lead Software Engineer - Backend
job_description: Job Title - Lead Software Engineer - BackendReports Into - CTOLocation - Hybrid / AlmadaA Little Bit about Kwalee‚Ä¶.Kwalee is one of the world‚Äôs leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let‚Äôs Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe.What‚Äôs In It For You?Profit sharing scheme - we win, you win¬†Quarterly Team Building daysPitch and make your own games on Creative Wednesdays!¬†Flexible working hours - we trust you to choose how and when you work bestAll the equipment that you need to be properly set upAre You Up To The Challenge?¬†As the Lead Software Engineer - Backend you will write code that will run on 100s of servers thousands of times a second helping our games run smoothly, you will have to work out how to deal with massive amounts of data efficiently, train machines to crunch data and generally play around with the latest and greatest in tech.You love to write efficient code and tackle hard puzzles, you like working with a committed team.¬†Your Team MatesWe're a bunch of tech whizzes who are at the backbone of everything the company does. We maintain the servers' health to an optimum level so that our millions of players can continue enjoying themselves with our games.What Does The Job Actually Involve?Contributing to the design and architecture of our servers using Python with Flask deployed on AWS EC2 Servers.Building Lambda pipelines to process large amounts of data.Implementing server features to robustly support millions of mobile game players.You‚Äôll be working with a worldwide multi cluster Couchbase and Elasticsearch database, but always looking for the next technology that makes sense.Interfacing with other teams on any server-related issues affecting them.Leading a team of developers both onsite and remotely, closely supported by our CTO.¬†Your Hard SkillsA proven track record of writing high quality database and program code for servers with Python. We are considering different levels of experience (from several months to years).The ability to write quick scripts to accelerate manual tasks.¬†Knowledge of NoSQL databases (Couchbase, MongoDB, Cassandra, Memcache,etc.) could be useful but it‚Äôs not mandatory.Knowledge of Unix, Linux or equivalent development environmentsSome experience in game development would be a plus, although it‚Äôs not necessary.Team leadership / management experience¬†Your Soft SkillsKwalee has grown fast in recent years but we‚Äôre very much a family of colleagues. We also have a growing PC and Console team of incredible pedigree that is on the hunt for great new titles to join TENS!, Eternal Hope, Die by the Blade and Scathe.What‚Äôs In It For You?Profit sharing scheme - we win, you win¬†Quarterly Team Building daysPitch and make your own games on Creative Wednesdays!¬†Flexible working hours - we trust you to choose how and when you work bestAll the equipment that you need to be properly set upAre You Up To The Challenge?The main goal is to make sure all of the games we release meet our standards for quality and functionality. We also test a lot of backend systems behind the games that are fundamental to our success in the market.¬†Your Team MatesTictales create tailored stories-on-demand services for the digital age. We want our audiences to experience quality storytelling and emotions at any time, any place. A passion for telling stories, entertaining players and using technology to bring great experience to massive audiences is what drives the team.What Does The Job Actually Involve?Maintain quality conformance to internal standards and project specific requirementsUpdate all bug databases with accurate and complete informationComplete all tasks assigned, as per instructions and timelinesWork closely with other team-members to share, discuss and clarify issues essential to effective execution of projectYour Hard Skills3+ years of experience in a QA role.Strong critical thinking - ability to identify issues and bugs in gamesExcellent (English)¬† communication skills - ability to describe identified issues in clear and concise mannerExperience testing server dependant applicationsA methodical, scientific and analytical mindsetKnowledge of the PC, Console and Mobile Platforms in terms of hardware and softwarePassion for gamesStrong proficiency in usage of spreadsheets, MS office and PC & internetAbility to work effectively with other team-membersYour Soft SkillsKwalee has grown fast in recent years but we‚Äôre very much a family of colleagues. We welcome people of all ages, races, colours, beliefs, sexual orientations, genders and circumstances, and all we ask is that you collaborate, work hard, ask questions and have fun with your team and colleagues.¬†We don‚Äôt like egos or arrogance and we love playing games and celebrating success together. If that sounds like you, then please apply.A Little More About KwaleeFounded in 2011 by David Darling CBE, a key architect of the UK games industry who previously co-founded and led Codemasters, our team also includes legends such as Andrew Graham (creator of Micro Machines series) and Jason Falcus (programmer of classics including NBA Jam) alongside a growing and diverse team of global gaming experts.Everyone contributes creatively to Kwalee‚Äôs success, with all employees eligible to pitch their own game ideas on Creative Wednesdays, and we‚Äôre proud to have built our success on this inclusive principle.We have an amazing team of experts collaborating daily between our studios in Leamington Spa, Lisbon, Bangalore and Beijing, or on a remote basis from Turkey, Brazil, Cyprus, the Philippines and many more places around the world. We‚Äôve recently acquired our first external studio, TicTales, which is based in France.¬†We have a truly global team making games for a global audience, and it‚Äôs paying off: - Kwalee has been voted the Best Large Studio and Best Leadership Team at the TIGA Awards (Independent Game Developers‚Äô Association) and our games have been downloaded in every country on earth - including Antarctica!

title: Game Economy Designer
job_description: Job Title - Game Economy DesignerReports Into - Head of Casual gamesLocation - Remote/AnywhereA Little Bit About Kwalee‚Ä¶.Kwalee is one of the world‚Äôs leading multiplatform game developers and publishers, with well over 900 million downloads worldwide for mobile hits such as Draw It, Teacher Simulator, Let‚Äôs Be Cops 3D, Airport Security and Makeover Studio 3D. (Design and make your own games every Wednesday)Great work-life balance with flexible working hoursQuarterly team building days - work hard, play hard!Monthly employee awardsAre You Up To The Challenge?As a Game Economy Designer, you will be responsible for finding the optimal balance in our games of them being Free to Play but Beneficial to Spend, helping to make sure our game economy is healthy and doesn‚Äôt get out of hand over time.Your Team MatesAs a team of economists, our team knows how to simulate a healthy, vibrant economy. Through their understanding of consumer psychology and behavioural science, they help strike a balance between fun and challenge for all our Kwalee games.What Does The Job Actually Involve?Working closely with designers and the analytics team to develop the right inputs and measurements for evaluating a game's economic patterns.Creating models for various interpretations of the game economy and forecasting player behaviours to find the right global maxima approach.Collaborate with the Art Leads to find the right information hierarchy and UI conventions to get information across to the user in a tone and style appropriate to each game.Working with the analytics department to understand the results of your work and the impact it has on player behaviour.From paper to playable you will be able to visualise the desired UX, both in UX tools or in Unity.Providing feedback based on your expertise on a wide range of games.Your Hard SkillsA minimum of 3 years experience in an economy design or balancing role within gaming.Can create models in industry standard tools to model player behaviours and the resultant economic impacts of those.Can devise the parameters and measurements for effective AB testing of game economy variations.Strong written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work creatively in a demanding team environment.Absolute passion for playing and making video games, especially mobile games.Strong creative ideas and imagination, able to entertain players with challenges, humour, surprises and fun.Positive attitude, self-driven and able to work alone or as part of a team.Your Soft SkillsKwalee has grown fast in recent years but we‚Äôre very much a family of colleagues. title: Senior Game Data Analyst
job_description: As a Senior Game Data Analyst, your responsibility is to find actionable insights from data to helpguide the development of free to play mobile games. By performing quantitative analysis of playerbehavior, you will identify problems and propose solutions to improve key performance indicatorsof the game such as retention, conversion, and monetization. This includes working with the gameteams to identify changes that drive user engagement.As an ideal candidate for this position, your skillset is broader than analyzing how users arebehaving in our existing games. You are also able to make informed predictions of how users willbehave during a game‚Äôs early stages of development and provide proactive recommendations tohelp shape the game‚Äôs underlying economy. You should be able to deconstruct a game‚Äôs core loop,systems, and player motivations.During all phases of a project, you will actively monitor performance and make recommendations toimprove the success of the game. You will be involved during both the production and liveoperations phases of the project.Duties & Responsibilities:‚óè Analyzing player behaviour to support improvement of the game‚Äôs key performanceindicators such as retention, conversion, timeplayed and lifetime value‚óè Playing, deconstructing, and understanding our games and then formulating your ownquestions, developing hypotheses, finding answers through data, then presenting yourresults‚óè Working closely with the game teams to effectively communicate the findings andpropose in-game improvements‚óè Track & share results of AB tests that can measure the impact of new features oralterations to existing gameplay.‚óè Regularly update executive level stakeholders on game KPIs & any other analytics relatedinitiatives‚óè Creating & maintaining dashboards at multiple levels of detail to meet the needs ofdifferent stakeholders‚óè Tracking and monitoring KPIs and investigating the underlying causes of any changes‚óè Tracking and monitoring key economy-related metrics such as sinks, sources, currencyvalue, and inflation‚óè Working with game teams to review in-game economies, systems, and features to lay thefoundation for healthy KPIs and overall product success‚óè Developing and maintaining tools and dashboards for the User Acquisition team to trackROAS and measure performance of campaigns‚óè Use historical data to predict ROAS breakeven of new campaigns & communicatefindings with a variety of stakeholders including User Acquisition & FinanceRequirements:‚óè Degree in a quantitative field, social sciences, game design or business management‚óè Minimum 4 years experience as a data analyst and preferably with free-to-play mobilegames.‚óè Must enjoy playing video games with familiarity in the mobile space‚óè Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability‚óè Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to communicate technicalconcepts to non-technical people‚óè Proficient in SQL‚óè Proficient in creating visualizations and dashboards with Tableau, Qlik, Looker or asimilar platform (Tableau experience preferred)‚óè Proficient in R and/or Python‚óè Basic understanding of statistics and/or econometricsWe offer you:¬†An opportunity to have massive impact. Our growing scope means you‚Äôll be able to have a large impact on the gaming industryA group of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers with which to collaborate.Remote environment (but if you live in Vancouver we have an office you can go to if you wish)Professional development support to help develop your skillsCompany Stock Options & RRSP matchingAt Hothead Games, we strive to maintain a healthy workplace during the Covid-19 pandemic - and beyond. The successful candidate must be comfortable working at home, and have functional and private space available for work hours. Compensation includes competitive salary, vacation, RRSP matching, company stock options and extended health coverage.WHY BEING INCLUSIVE IS IMPORTANT TO USAt Hothead Games, we are an Equal Opportunity employer and we value the diversity of the peoplewe hire and serve. We strive to build and grow our team that fosters variety in backgrounds,perspectives, experiences and skills. We embrace inclusiveness in our workplace, so we can utilizeeach person‚Äôs talents and strengths to make great games.If you're seeking an awesome new challenge in a fun and engaging studio, we invite you to apply andtalk about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career.

title: Office IT Intern
job_description: About FunPlusFunPlus is a world-class, independent game developer and publisher headquartered in Switzerland, with offices and operations in China, Japan, Singapore, Spain and the United States. Founded in 2010, FunPlus is an organization that fosters top creative talent and garners together ambitious teams, making up more than 2,000 team members worldwide.The company just announced the expansion of their Barcelona office into game development and is, thus, looking to build a team who will play an integral role in opening a new studio there and creating a world class mobile casual game that will wow the industry. FunPlus is avidly searching for top talent who are looking for an entrepreneurial environment backed by the resources of a proven successful gaming company. This is an incredible opportunity to get in on the frontlines of developing a new studio and a new game!With several hit games launched and ranked #1Global Publisher in Strategy Games (2019 & 2020), FunPlus is home to KingsGroup studio who develops hugely popular mobile strategy titles including State of Survival, King of Avalon and Guns of Glory. FunPlus has also positioned itself in the RPG puzzle genre with Call of Antia. In 2021 FunPlus acquired Imagendary Studios working on its first original AAA development.The company is also the founder of FPXÔºàFunPlus Phoenix), one of the world's most successful esports organizations, and the 2019 League of Legends World Champions. Please visitwww.funplus.com to find out more and follow us on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and Twitter for the latest news and career opportunities.Your MissionAs an Office IT intern at FunPlus Spain you will be assisting the Regional IT Support Specialist based in Switzerland to deliver all IT solutions mainly¬† to our Barcelona office but also having an eye on the IT needs of the Swiss office. Furthermore you will play an important role in the coordination of the IT activities related to the digital elements rollout for the Barcelona office (i.e. Windows/Mac, printers and video Zoom conferencing systems). As part of your day to day work you will help the users in Barcelona to have functional IT equipment and find solutions to any IT related issue that might arise.Your ResponsibilitiesProvide front-line technical support to on-site and remote employees by phone, messenger platforms and emails.Manage setup, breaks, relocation of workstations, printers and other hardware when requestedManage Windows/MacOS inventory, perform troubleshooting and reimagingWork closely with regional office managers Network and Database admins, App Developers and external vendorsTest and implement software and physical/virtual machinesOperate in Hybrid working environment with initial onsite support requiredYour ProfileYou just finished or are about to finish your Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Computer ScienceFluency in Spanish and English, Mandarin is a plusKnowledge in MS 365 and Google workspaceGood documentation skillsNice to have: knowledge in Atlassian tools. (e.g. Confluence and Jira) and Slack.Have good IT support knowledge, 3rd party applications and IT maintenance.Agile mindset and independant with strong project management abilityPerks of your new adventureThis is a remunerated internship position part time or full time - we are flexible and know that you need time to study!Flexible working hours - We know you have other quests and fun activities in your life, as long as you get your job done, flex away.Multicultural teams - With so many offices around the world, you will have opportunities to engage and learn from your global colleaguesDiverse team events - Barcelona has the reputation of fun, and this office is determined to keep up that reputation.International and expert leadership - You can¬¥t create legends without legendary leadership.Creative environment - This is entertainment after all folks!The possibility to learn and grow professionally into one of the most exciting industries!Join Us!FunPlus is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse environment. We respect all individuals and seek their inclusion in the workplace.

title: Mid to Senior Tools Engineer
job_description: This is an excellent opportunity for a passionate, and experienced Tools Engineer, to join the team behind Total War, Alien: Isolation and Halo Wars 2, to create thrilling game experiences on a new project being built in Unreal Engine 5 (UE5). This will be based at our studio in Horsham, in the heart of West Sussex. We‚Äôre building an agile team focused on continuous improvement. The ideal candidate will have a passion for learning, innovation and developing simple, powerful solutions and will bring a focus on delivering value to customers quickly. In this role you will iterate quickly not only on our technical solutions but also on our teams‚Äô own practices and patterns of work to continuously improve our ability to support the project and develop amazing experiences with UE5. Flexible working at Creative Assembly includes hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio. We recognise that there is no one-size-fits-all approach and empower our teams to define the working patterns which work best for them, which may mean different things for different teams and roles and at different times. This role is Hybrid and has an expectation of 1 day every 2 weeks in our Horsham studio. This role would consider fully remote working within country of employment. Further details can be discussed during the recruitment process.Key Responsibilities On a day-to-day basis, you willDevelop tools and solutions to support our developers & enable fast flow of work and fast feedback for their changes to our UE5 projectParticipate in our team‚Äôs process of ongoing continuous improvementWork closely with developers to help improve their processes and solve problems in active development on our UE5 projectWork closely with your team to further our team, project and studio values of continuous improvement, learning and rewarding, joyful workFoster sustainable development by maintaining the health and simplicity of our portfolio of solutionsPartner, share knowledge and assist colleagues in their personal developmentHave a tangible positive impact on the effectiveness of our team.Knowledge, Skill and Experience Essential Experience with and interest in working with Unreal EngineStrong experience developing in C++Strong technical programming skillsKnowledge of and active interest in Software Delivery Performance, modern working practices and development methodologies (ToC, Agile, DevOps, Lean, SoPK)Comfortable working in an innovative, experimental environment with an emphasis on rapid iterationPassion for games development and making software development enjoyable.Desirable Passion for improving the way we work and finding new craft-led studio as we push boundaries, creating deep and detailed experiences that last.¬†Our teams are diverse from across the world, from trainees to industry veterans who constantly challenge us and make sure we are striving for the best within our games and our studio life. We are united through our shared values of Quality, Focus, Teamwork, Respect and Trust and we win awards for our culture and our people-centric approach, having won a Best Place to Work Award for six consecutive years. for environment art creation and workflowExperience developing pipelines including Substance Designer, Substance Painter, or HoudiniAble to present (internally and externally) a clear vision of how title: Senior Producer
job_description: Welcome to Timbre!We are Timbre Games (part of the Sumo Digital Group), a new studio in Vancouver, Canada focused on making exciting, innovative game experiences. Timbre‚Äôs vision is to change the games industry through the original games we make, as well as how we make them. We‚Äôre building an inclusive, supportive culture that allows us to explore fresh, new (and sometimes weird) ideas. Through their stewardship of our Agile production, they create an empowered, highly accountable, and collaborative team culture. They are champions of the Agile process and mindset who confidently guide cross-discipline teams through iteration cycles, removing impediments to the teams‚Äô success. Embracing uncertainty and curiosity, Producers create the space for the team to try new ideas, understanding that iteration and experimentation are key to game development. The creative space we shape enables our development team to create an accessible, player-first experience, a key ingredient in Timbre‚Äôs development philosophy!¬†You'll be joining our first project in pre-production, being a key piece of the puzzle to take this game through to launch!As a Senior Producer at Timbre Games, you will: Be a key support to the project Lead Producer, allowing them to focus on project strategy and publisher relationshipsYou will partner with Product Stewards, working with multiple remote cross-discipline agile teams fostering collaboration through our agile title: Studio Technical Director
job_description: Welcome to Timbre!We are Timbre Games (part of the Sumo Digital Group), a new studio in Vancouver, Canada focused on making exciting, innovative game experiences. Timbre‚Äôs vision is to change the games industry through the original games we make, as well as how we make them. We‚Äôre building an inclusive, supportive culture that allows us to explore fresh, new (and sometimes weird) ideas. We‚Äôre searching for more visionary explorers to join our team of diverse voices, coming together to develop games that are accessible to a wide audience.If you‚Äôre thinking about your next adventure, send us your resume to talk to our team about how you can add your voice to the games we‚Äôre working on.Engineering at Timbre Games¬†An Engineer at Timbre games will focus on creative, innovative and technically sound work. Our engineering team is fully integrated with all areas of game development and collaborates both technically and creatively.¬†Our studio focuses on Unreal Engine 5, pushing everything we do towards technical excellence. We are lifelong learners, leaning on both internal expertise and external inspiration to continue our path of growth and development.  We have a keen eye for best practices and elegant code, and ensure knowledge sharing, and mentoring are a priority.The leader of this team will enable our group to pursue our vision of diverse and accessible AAA games, realized and explored by cross-discipline collaboration and open communication. Studio Technical Director at Timbre GamesYou are a key member of the executive leadership team and can create and lead a strategic technical vision for the studio, preparing us for the games we make today, and setting us up for the games we will make tomorrow. You will contribute to the ongoing vision of our studio and be involved in critical decisions as we continue to grow our studio and products.You will navigate complex technical challenges, partnering with the core development teams and external partners to achieve long-lasting solutions.You have a deep understanding and experience using Unreal Engine or similar as a core platform ‚Äì and can mentor, guide and expand our team members knowledge on this platform. Your experience in programming and management will be key, as you grow and inspire the engineering team to build their best work.You provide a good balance of teaching versus doing and are equally comfortable in an engineering environment as you are in an executive one.You are seen as a trusted leader, who listens actively, and who encourages the team through a coaching mindset to contribute freely and collaboratively to solutions and strategies.As Studio Technical Director at Timbre, you will:Create our Studio Technical Strategy and Roadmap across multiple projects, leading¬†core engineering infrastructure and project code strategy to deliver great products, tools, and systemsDevelop and grow an engineering team that can deliver high quality, is inclusive and diverse, and title: Game Director
job_description: Welcome to Timbre!We are Timbre Games (part of the Sumo Digital Group), a new studio in Vancouver, Canada focused on making exciting, innovative game experiences. Timbre‚Äôs vision is to change the games industry through the original games we make, as well as how we make them. title: Porting Programmer
job_description: As a Porting Programmer at PixelAnt Games your primary responsibility will be to work on porting games to major consoles (Xbox Series S|X, Sony PS5, Nintendo Switch), whilst developing new tools, working on optimisation, game certification, and more. You'll be responsible for delivering efficient and reliable code, planning the development process as well as designing, building and maintaining platform specific game features.As a Porting Programmer you will:- Write and be accountable for high quality source code- Work with designers to implement gameplay and user interface elements to the designers' specifications- Liaise with Quality Assurance to fix bugs- Ensure the game is compliant with manufacturer's guidelines for all the relevant platformsMust have skills:¬∑¬† Proficiency in C/C++, with proven commercial experience¬∑¬† Practical experience with 3D programming and mathematics¬∑¬† Working experience in game production¬∑¬† Excellent communication skills¬∑¬† Have worked on at least one released game and/or experience with at least one current generation engine (UE4/UE5, CryEngine, Source, Unity etc.)¬∑¬† Experience of source control systemsUseful to have:¬∑¬† At least 5 years of experience in the games industry.¬∑¬† Contributed to shipped titles on console games.¬∑¬† C#, JavaScript or Python programming experience.¬∑¬† Graphics systems (3D graphics, animation, camera control, lighting, materials and shaders) knowhow.¬∑¬† Experience of working to manufacturers' guidelines for the relevant platforms.¬∑¬† Knowledge of the requirements placed on gameplay code by a multiplayer networked game.¬∑¬† Networking experience (TCP/IP, UDP, both client-server and peer-to-peer).¬∑¬† Knowledge of console certification process.¬∑¬† Memory management experience.¬∑¬† Ability to co-ordinate work for a small team of programmers.¬∑¬† Produce milestone and platform submission builds.What We Offer:Possibility to work on one of 40+ titles (AA+ and AAA) that Sumo group is developingDeveloping games in a crunch-free environment with very experienced colleagues in an open and respectful cultureCompetitive SalaryFlexible forms of employmentFully transparent Annual Bonus Plan for everyone50% tax relief for¬†creative workEmployee Referral BonusLux Med Platinum healthcare family package (highest available & fully covered)Office working/partly remote/fully remoteFlexible working hoursClear Career Paths5 paid Learning Days a year for self-developmentAccess to 4,000 Udemy Courses and GDC VaultEnglish group classes and/or 121 meetings with the teacherTeam-driven initiatives (PAG Plays, team-building events, charity engagement)Development initiatives (Life Drawing, Game Jams)Mental health support activities¬†(Yoga Classes, Well-being webinars)The best working tools of your choosing- a powerful workstation or a top gaming laptopRelocation packageHome¬†-office perks (ergonomic gaming chairs, adjustable desk)...and much moreCan you spare us another 30 seconds?¬†Great, let's talk about ourselves quickly. We're ambitious game enthusiasts who are well prepared to both have fun and work hard. We aim high, but we do not lose ourselves in the pursuit of success and further achievements. We love to learn! And over the years in the industry, we have learned that the best games are created by qualified, rested, treated with respect game developers.Importantly, our work culture has been built on the basis of specific, true (and respected by us) values. The most important of these is "We never lie", so you can be sure that we have not overdone this announcement. We play by our own rules and we make games that we would like to play ourselves. We combine the game development world with best software delivery practices to make it more predictable and reliable. All this helps us to bring fun back to game development! Will you help us?Where do we stand on diversity?We hope to bring together a diverse team of people with various backgrounds and experiences, who will bring broader ideas, new perspectives, and different solutions to our table. Whoever you are, feel welcome and encouraged to apply.Apply for this job

title: Lead Game Designer
job_description: About Lab42¬†Lab42 is a best-in-class cross-platform game developer based in Leamington Spa, UK. Since our founding as a small indie studio, our headcount has grown into a team full of talented, experienced people supported by a veteran management team with backgrounds from SEGA, Codemasters and EA.As well as working on our own IP, we also offer co-development services to a growing list of clients, including Paradox, SEGA and Curve Digital. We work on some of the best titles around, such as Call of Duty, Crusader Kings, Yakuza, Star Wars Racer and much more, without losing touch with the anti-crunch and people-first values our studio was founded upon.As winners of the GI Biz Best Places to Work award for the past 3 years running, our studio benefits from a friendly, supportive and empowering team culture. We encourage professional growth, while maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Lab42 is made up of a diverse mix of fantastic people, and we embrace all the elements that make our team unique. We‚Äôre an inclusive studio and welcome applications from qualified applicants of any background, regardless of race, age, disability, gender identity or neurodiversity.The role ¬†We are looking for a passionate and experienced Lead Game Designer to join Lab42 - a Sumo Digital Studio. This is an exciting opportunity for a designer specialising in leading design, feature ownership and implementation.Within this role you will:Lead game design from inception through to game release; striving for quality and innovation while adhering to the core vision of the gameBe the champion of quality for multiple feature designs; executing the vision of the stakeholder teamRepresent Lab42 with third party publishing, marketing and press Review and adapt designs based on user testing and telemetry dataCreate and maintain detailed design documentationCollaborate across disciplines and external partners to facilitate developmentDefine and allocate tasks to the design team, including accurately assessing the time required to complete each taskMentor junior design team membersReport directly to the Lab42 Design DirectorWe need you to have:Excellent written and verbal communication skillsA proven track record of designing for high-profile gamesA flexible and innovative approach to design problem solving and new concept generationA likable and approachable personality with a desire to motivate those around youA passionate love of gaming and a strong understanding of modern gaming trends5+ years in game development with at least 1 year in a lead roleDemonstrable experience of working in engine, ideally with experience in Unreal EngineWhat we offer:.    Defined Annual Bonus Scheme.    ULEV car scheme .    Monthly allowance to spend on enhancing benefits¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ¬†.    Salary Sacrifice Pension.    Flexible Working¬†¬† .   21 days free-use holiday    + your birthday off    + 5 learning days including 1 volunteer day    + a duvet day    + Christmas shutdown from Christmas Eve to New Year    + Bank Holidays    + extra allowance accrued for longer service.    Free dental insurance¬†.    Life Assurance 4x Salary.    Income Protection of 75% for 5 years¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† .    Enhanced Mat/Paternity & Adoption pay.    Employee Assistance Programme:.    Help at Hand - Remote GP, Mental Health & Physio appointments.    Free financial & home buying support consultations.    Cycle to Work Scheme.    Payroll Giving Scheme.    Access to 4,000 Udemy Courses.    Career Development Pathway¬†¬† .    Wrap Parties..    Project Completion Awards.    Game/Creative Jams.    Big Family Events.    Studio social activities, e.g. running, board games, film, yoga, life drawing‚Ä¶.    Prism ‚Äì Sumo‚Äôs employee diversity focus group¬†.    Free fruit and drinks in our studios.    Employee Referral Bonus¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Why should you work at Lab42?‚ÄØ¬†Lab42 was founded upon a people-first, anti-crunch culture, and we‚Äôve stayed true to those values through all of our growth and success. Now part of the Sumo Digital family of studios, we enjoy all of the benefits and comradery of being part of a large games development organisation, without losing the friendly and flexible working environment that makes Lab42 a great place to work.As part of Lab42, you‚Äôll be able to work on both original IPs and some of the biggest and best games around ‚Äì without having to sleep at your desk! Instead, we encourage a harmonious work-life balance that allows you to spend time with family and friends, while still enjoying a career in an exciting industry.We believe in providing opportunities for internal career progression, and there is plenty of room to grow and fulfill your potential at Lab42. By prioritising the happiness and wellbeing of our staff, we have been joined by many industry veterans, and are proud to be a studio where people chose to stay, develop and grow through their Game Development careers.Apply for this job

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
job_description: Skydance offers a dynamic, inclusive, and ever-evolving culture where innovative ideas are welcomed, and growth fostered. The partnership between unique creativity and technological advancements are demonstrated within each pillar of the company. At the heart of it all is a commitment to boldly entertaining and relevant storytelling.¬†While all Animation studios look to hire people who are creative and hard-working, Skydance Animation is specifically looking for pioneers who seek to push the limits of what the world‚Äôs most collaborative art form can achieve, and to give those pioneers the space and the resources to build a new studio that‚Äôs doing something different.---The Senior DevOps at Skydance Animation is a member of the Information Technology team and will be responsible for globally supporting and expanding, production workflows/pipelines, cloud and on-premise infrastructure, automation of infrastructure delivery, and software development processes. The ideal candidate has an interest in and passion for applying modern DevOps technologies, tooling, best practices, architecting and implementing reliable infrastructure, and continuously and aggressively looking for opportunities to modernize and automate work. The IT team provides a wide range of services including Client Services, Systems Engineering, Media/AV Engineering, Networking, and Information Security. #AnimationResponsibilitiesWork with Pipeline, routines, repeatable tasks, and technical challenges that are candidates for automation, and then create and support the deployment of innovative DevOps solutions using Terraform, Ansible and PythonAzure/AWS/OCI provisioning, configuration management, storage management, network management, and virtualizationDevelop technical ‚Äúvision‚Äù for projects, translate targeted solutions into end-to end architectural designs, set proper priority and lead implementationsMaintain a strong understanding of studio workflows/pipeline and collaborate with Production Technology groups to provide proper systems services and automationPartner with Engineers and development teams to develop, maintain, and streamline build and release pipeline using automation to test to deploy releasesLead efforts with developers, engineers, and security teams to define and implement best in class CI/CD processMaintain source control branch strategies, build/release, branch merge process and documentationsWork with team to design, implement and maintain render farm including configuration, deployment, performance and capacity monitoring, forecasting, and cloud bursting capabilitiesPresenting of technology to leadership including options, cost-benefit breakdown, and integration plansMust proactively seek out trends, technologies, and information to keep overall studio current and aware of possible new solutions to studio challengesShare a 24√ó7 on call production support rotation with your team and respond to service incidents.Foster positive relationships with peers, supervision, stakeholders, 3rd Parties, and mentor less experienced team membersRequirements4+ years working as DevOps Engineer or SRE (or similar) with a strong understanding of and title: Senior Environment Artist
job_description: Who is SkyBox Labs?SkyBox Labs is a game development studio that works on some of the world‚Äôs most iconic games. Our projects include working as a co-developer on Halo Infinite, projects in the Minecraft Universe, supporting the development of Magic: The Gathering Arena, supporting development of Fallout 76, and developing unannounced titles including partner projects and internal IP. As one of Vancouver‚Äôs fastest-growing game studios, since our inception in 2011, SkyBox Labs has evolved from a group of 8 people developing independent projects to a team of over 200+ engineers, artists, designers, producers, and more. Interested? Let's talk about who we're hiring for:SkyBox Labs is excited to be adding a Senior Environment Artist to our Pitch team. This Environment Artist will be the first of its discipline on our growing team and will have the opportunity to make a lasting impact on the art in this game. Joining the team in an early phase of development, you will be a pivotal part of the creations and be a key collaborator in the process from early stages through to release and beyond. You will collaborate with designers and the creative team to develop high-quality assets and world layouts, and deliver new content. The ideal candidate for this role values communication and high collaboration. You know what goes into making a high-quality game - and you're ready to create new art content, polish, and fix art bugs.A snapshot of your role:Work with existing in-game and in-library assets and create new high quality 3D environment assetsWork with artists and designers to create an immersive and compelling world and environmentCollaborate with designers to improve world layoutsOptimize assets to ensure performance goals are metTake part in portfolio reviews and help hire for the Art teamProvide mentorship to team members as the team growsRecommend new techniques, tools and workflows to improve quality and efficiencySound like you? This is what we're looking for:At least 5 years‚Äô + experience in game development as a Senior Artist creating high quality environment assets for gamesExperience working on AAA titles and PC/console games is a preferredExperience working on world layouts, hard surfaces and props Proficient in Maya, Photoshop and ZBrush. 3Ds Max is a plus.Optimization experience¬†Solid technical skills with knowledge of game engines and how to export assetsAbility to work collaboratively within a multidisciplinary teamStrong written and verbal communication skills¬†Nice-to-haves:Proven leadership experience, with ability to receive and deliver effective feedbackA portfolio and/or reel demonstrating relevant art skills is required in order to be considered for this position#LI-HYBRID #LI-LL1And here is why we think you'll love working at SkyBox Labs:Our studio‚Äôs success can be attributed to our culture of empowerment, collaboration, and personal growth.¬†At SkyBox Labs, you can contribute to industry-leading titles, from legendary AAA franchises to independent IP, without compromising on culture. As a rapidly growing independent company, we maintain a ‚Äòsmall studio‚Äô feel with our flat structure, leading with authenticity, and fostering connection.We relentlessly support your growth and development. From team building through personal interest groups and clubs to studio-wide knowledge sharing through learning lunches, and more formalized programs like SkyBox U, we support our team every step of the way.¬†One major thing that we‚Äôre proud of is that we‚Äôve been able to grow to the studio that we are today while ultimately cultivating an environment of trust and mutual respect where you can thrive. We value our team members‚Äô diverse backgrounds, hobbies, skills, and interests and we celebrate them! This is demonstrated through our broad spectrum of social clubs: Join our soccer team, fitness group, or one of our many D&D groups - you can even start your own!Flexible Hybrid and Remote Work Models:With the goal to provide the best possible work environment for all, the majority of our team is working in a flexible hybrid work model from Vancouver and Victoria. The opportunity to work permanently remotely across Canada is also available for certain designated roles. SkyBox Labs is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace, dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Only candidates that reside in Canada or are willing to relocate will be considered for this role. Additionally, although we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.¬†¬†Learn more about us at¬†http://skyboxlabs.com/¬†Apply for this job

title: Player Support Manager
job_description: Our Rovio Marketing function is looking for a Player Support Manager. You play a key role in facilitating communication between game teams and our players. You will collaborate closely with different stakeholders and manage Player Support projects that align with our strategy. Within this role, a successful PS manager will act as the voice of our players, providing players with experiences that drive deeper engagement and higher retention, both through working directly with players and developers and as a champion of the craft across the studio.¬†The PS team is currently distributed over two sites: Finland and Sweden. We are working in hybrid mode, where we work some days from the office and some days from home. The frequency of how often you work from the office will depend on the nature of your tasks (e.g., meeting stakeholders in person) and your preference. In addition, there will also be travel required to collaborate within the team and manage stakeholders.Please submit both your CV as well as a cover letter. How you will spend your time:Define, execute and own the Player Support operations for multiple titles and/or projects; act as the go-to-person and representative of the craftWork closely with stakeholders across the craft and studio to align and plan around overall player experience, player communication and player sentiment around our portfolioManage circular communication of knowledge regarding bugs, UX and the product roadmap between developers and players / Player Support agents. Assist backlog prioritisation, especially related to game or feature design, based on user feedback and data analysisRepresent players within game teams or the studio to contribute to continuous improvement of both game and business KPIsBe the driving force that ensures Player Support best practices are incorporated across our portfolio; evaluate and benchmark current standards, while always looking to improveSupport your team members in crafting and executing strategies for player facing activities, but also act as a coach and mentor when necessaryEquip our outsourcing partners with knowledge and set them up for success, both in day-to-day operations and with a view to long-term sustained excellenceContinuously looks for synergies with other crafts across the studio and beyond, building a wholistic picture of our Player Support operations and where we position ourselves in the industryUnderstand industry trends in PX and how they relate to Rovio games so that we can anticipate and plan for future needs by bringing proactive improvements and solutions to relevant roadmapsLaunch initiatives from scratch when needed, understanding the bottlenecks and risks along the way and how to circumvent them. Join forces with other crafts and main stakeholders in the company when neededWho we think will do great in this role has:Ability to process, analyze and efficiently communicate complex ideas in relatable terms with different stakeholders¬†Fluent working with Player Support tools, methodologies, and processesUnderstands the fundamentals of marketing, community management, game design & production, analytics, business and project managementUnderstands the impact of player experience and Player Support operations on game and business KPIs¬†Project management experience (highly regarded!)Proven seniority within a Player Support role and experience in helping less senior Player Support talent grow professionallySkilled to work in multicultural environments, be empathic, culturally aware and has strong conflict management skillsA passion for player experience and Player Support, in particular,A proactive drive to improve the craft, our ways of working and yourselfExceptional verbal and written English skillsWe‚Äôd love if you have some of these:SQL knowledge to run queries¬†Understanding of SDKs and APIs¬†Knowledge of moderation tooling and best practicesExperience building Player Support KPI dashboards and reportingA passion for gamingPlease note that there is no one ‚Äúperfect‚Äù candidate and we don‚Äôt expect applicants to meet 100% of the qualifications. If this position resonates with you, we hope you will apply even if you don't believe you tick all the boxes. You may be the person we‚Äôre looking for!Recruitment process:First meeting: You will meet the TA Partner to get acquainted and learn more about Rovio and the specifics of the roleCall with a Hiring manager: We will dive deeper into your skills and background, and also discuss what motivates you Assignment related to Player Support scenariosFinal round: There will be two separate interviews so we can get a clear overview of your skills and how you would fit with our working culture. During one interview, you will be invited to meet a member of the game team. In the other interview, you will meet with senior stakeholders outside the Player Support and game team.About the Marketing Function¬†Mixing the world-class expertise of six different crafts ‚Äì Product Marketing, User Acquisition, User Experience Research, Market Intelligence, Marketing Video Production, and Player Experience, our team‚Äôs main mission is to fuel the growth of our games portfolio. Largely embedded within game teams and in close collaboration with a large variety of stakeholders, our role is to identify, anticipate and make sure to satisfy our target audiences‚Äô needs and wants. We do this across all touchpoints ‚Äì from early research on new concepts, to how we reach out to millions of players through our marketing campaigns, or to how we engage them through our social networks and other discussion platforms.#LI-Hybrid---We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.What to expect when you join usMeet the RoviansAbout RovioApply for this job

title: Head of Studio, Stockholm
job_description: Rovio's Stockholm Studio is the studio behind the hugely popular Angry Birds 2, the bigger, badder and birdier sequel to the global phenomenon Angry Birds. The studio is dedicated to making the Angry Birds 2 game experience ever more exciting for players, developing continual improvements, as well as running world class live ops every day.¬†In addition to Angry Birds 2, Stockholm studio is actively developing new titles with the Angry Birds brand as well as new original IPs. Our approach is to focus on highly accessible yet innovative cores paired with Rovio's light-hearted aesthetic. At the same time, we still aim to deliver a deep meta that can keep players engaged for decades. Our development is driven by our players as we push to become masters of our genre. We use data to provide insights into our players' needs, and we always strive for improvement through continual iteration. Our ambitious teams are full of passionate gamers who are eager to leave their mark.As the Head of Studio, you will be responsible for leading the game studio business both from a strategic and operational point of view. You will have the P&L responsibility and ensure the creation and execution of the studio strategy. title: Game Analyst
job_description: Being a Game Analyst in Rovio entails being a part of a big and data-experienced team. You‚Äôll get to work with massive amounts of high quality data together with some of the best game professionals in the industry. You will be joining one of our live games and focus on in-game analytics to get going but can be later transferred to a new game depending on the business need. Your work will have a high impact as player experience and game performance can be improved based on your recommendations.What your days will look like:You will be a part of a game team and support its operations by bringing objective and eye-opening findings to spark discussion and initiate improvements across various game areas, from level design to liveops events;You will conduct your own exploratory analysis, run frequent A/B tests and suggest your own analytics methods to bring new perspectives to the team;You might help level designers by creating new metrics to improve our core experience, build dashboards that are used every day by product managers to track live-ops performance or create easy to digest visualisations that help out game designers understand something new about player behaviour;¬†You will get tasked with building apps that help simulate game economy or¬† pipelines that make it easier to access complex data;You are eager to learn new things and support the knowledge sharing culture in the team. We have a particularly diverse data craft, so you‚Äôll have no problem finding interesting people to bounce around ideas with. Who we think will do great in this role has:You have good experience in SQL and some experience in R or Python;You know how to build dashboards, run and analyse A/B tests;You have a good understanding of aspects that can make games or apps more fun to use and always try to tie this to business results;You are at ease communicating your findings to audiences with diverse backgrounds and you are willing to bring to the table your own ideas and proposals to product managers and other stakeholders.Recruitment process:First meeting: you will meet our talent team. In this call we will get to know your previous experience a little better, get a better sense of your current situation, and give you a chance to learn more about the role and the company.Take home test: it will help us to understand the level of your technical skills (tech, stats, A/B testing)Meeting your future lead: we will ask you to play one of our games and then go through your ideas related to the game in the meeting. It will also be a chance for you to ask more questions about the role and get feedback on your test assignment.Final interview: it will be a combined interview where you will meet the game team and the Head of the Analytics for our Puzzle studio to discuss your fit into the broader context of the studio and an opportunity for you to learn more about our game teams. You might find the discussion revolving around product, business and team culture related topics.Data is at the heart of everything we do at Rovio. It enables us to continually improve our games and provide incredible experiences for the millions of users who play our games every day. All of this data is only valuable if it can be used to guide our day to day operations. It is the job of Rovio data craft to turn that raw data into actionable insights for Rovio‚Äôs games teams and other business units. The data craft aims to empower Rovio‚Äôs teams with insightful data, and also with relevant tools and models that support decision making.---We welcome applicants to use the name they want to be addressed by in the application form, regardless of whether it is their legal name.What to expect when you join usMeet the RoviansAbout RovioApply for this job

title: Full-stack Engineer
job_description: SummaryMona is looking for a full-stack developer to help build the open metaverse. The ideal candidate for this role has strong TypeScript/node.js knowledge and is comfortable working in a dynamic and creative environment. You'll be expected to work quickly and smartly to help determine the viability of ideas and technologies. You'll be able to take ownership of entire features and components of Mona while leading product design and code elements. You will need a keen ambition to explore a new world of uncharted possibilities. You will work directly with the CTO to define and solve incredibly challenging and interesting problems in the metaverse. If you're looking to make a difference in the world alongside a group of incredible humans, this is it.About MonaMona is the premier 3D-world building platform and social network for the metaverse ‚Äì built for creators, by creators. We encourage optimism, respect, accountability and transparency.What You'll DoWorking with the CTO to implement a new feature or make an improvement to an existing one.Building infrastructure that enables Mona to better serve 3d creators and help them build new worlds.Simplifying infrastructure to make it more reliable, effective, and upgradeable.Playing games, if you don't already. That's OK, we'll learn together.Sharing with your teammates, whether it's posting something awesome you just learned, or showing us adorable pictures of your pets.Changing your views on a subject after being presented with new data.Solving problems with code, without code, and sometimes by deleting code.Adjusting to the requirements of a rapidly growing team (in a healthy way).What We're Looking ForYou have 4+ years of full-stack application development experience.You share our vision that the metaverse must be open.Strong experience with Typescript/Node.js & any frontend framework.Some experience with Vue preferred.Familiarity with Express, MongoDB, Unity, Tailwind CSS, web3.js, and AWS a plus.Attention to detail, creativity and passion.Good intuition in making time vs. complexity tradeoffs.BS/BA degree preferred.BonusExperience working in or with distributed teams.Passionate understanding of the blockchain and NFTs.Apply for this job

title: Executive Producer - Unannounced AAA Project
job_description: At Kabam, we‚Äôre constantly raising the bar of excellence in free-to-play gaming. We hire for passion and diversity so that we can triumph in our collective skill. Our teams are made up of a fusion of personalities and interests bound together by a collaborative nature, fun-loving culture, and a drive to do what it takes to make great games. And this is where you come in‚Ä¶Our Vancouver studio is looking for an Executive Producer to spearhead our next big AAA game project at Kabam. This is an unannounced cross-platform title, working in close partnership with a major console on a wholly original IP. As an EP, you will build accountability, cohesiveness and support within your team so they can work effectively together and, in turn, enable each employee and the team to succeed. You will support and foster a growth mindset by engaging and encouraging others to continuously learn through training, mentorship, feedback, and coaching.You are an experienced product leader with direct experience producing all major game phases (e.g. concept, pre-production, production), including successful live production for AAA console games. You are a connector, linking senior leadership to employees through open communication to ensure all parties remain informed by appropriately cascading organization information and rolling up feedback from the team. You can stay at a high level and articulate a long-term strategy; at the same time, you can roll up your sleeves and do what it takes to support the team when the situation calls for it.¬†Don't live in Vancouver? Apply anyway! We support fully remote work setups for our employees.In this role, you can expect to:Sustain product vision and goals in alignment with the organization‚Äôs overall strategic directionDevelop, maintain, and be held accountable for the long-term product roadmap and its product goal achievementCollaborate directly with corporate partners to develop multi-year brand strategiesEvaluate development processes for success and iterate where both the team and product need to grow¬†Be a strong advocate for your team and their healthMentor the Production staff and serves as the primary advocate of our playersBuild excitement around products throughout the game team and the studioRemain current on competitor products, industry trends, and techniques in game designEvaluate "Product Health" in multiple product phases and is accountable for the overall strategy to maintain product healthRegularly participate in the staffing, recruitment, onboarding, and performance review processes throughout the yearFosters a respectful work environment by encouraging collaboration and appreciation of diversity at all levels of the organizationCultivate a safe environment for the group that allows for disagreement over ideas, conflict, and expeditious conflict resolution and sets the tone for positive team culture and contributes to the great culture at KabamTo be successful in this role, your background includes:10+ years in gaming (preferably in console), with 5+ years in a production leadership role managing a large teamExperience as an Executive Producer or equivalent shipping a AAA console title with more than 1 million units sold, seeing through the full game development cycle, from concept to releaseExperience in crafting the direction for a product and the results to showcase itStrong understanding of technologies associated with game development and production (capabilities and limitations)Experience in working with data telemetry to craft and validate hypotheses and understand problemsA track record of strong leadership, leading by example and being comfortable with ambiguityExperience dealing with both the ups and downs of an early unreleased product as well as running a live productKeeping the momentum of success going when things are good and experience in dealing with live issues when they randomly occurExceptional communications skills, both verbal and written, concisely and professionally with all levels of the organizationSolid business acumen paired with the ability to understand complex issues and synthesize the information into digestible pieces to share with the teamAbility to forge strong relationships within the team, across different disciplines and departments within the organizationSuperb organizational, analytical and critical thinking skillsTo take it up a notch, you will also have:Experience developing an original IP game from concept to shipExperience developing AAA console games in the Action, Adventure, or Fighting genresExperience running a game team with upwards of 100+ team membersExperience partnering with external developers or co-dev studios is a plusExcellent understanding of the function and relationship between the different departments of game developmentOur success is due to the hard work of our people. We share our success with our people through flexible benefits and reward programs, sweet swag, snacks, and more. Here‚Äôs a look at some of the support we provide our people:We know that one size doesn‚Äôt fit all - every team has the flexibility to find the right balance between in-studio, remote, and hybrid in-studio/remote.We offer extended health coverage effective day one, with no waiting period, including a flexible health spending account and/or personal spending account! Any leftover amounts from the health/personal spending account can also be automatically added to a group TFSA.¬†Telus Health Virtual Care that provides you a way to remotely interact with healthcare providers, available 24/7 to get prescription refills or referrals from the comfort of your home.We provide an employee assistance program to ensure our people‚Äôs mental and emotional well-being.Everyone retires eventually, and we help our people save for their futures with a contribution matching program for their RRSP.We offer paid parental leave, flexible paid time off (no worrying about how much time has been earned), as well as paid time off for volunteering.We encourage development through educational support, training sessions, skill development, knowledge sharing, and more!We encourage our team to help us hire the best talent through our referral program, where they can earn up to $5,000 for a successful referral hire.Excited by this opportunity? title: Associate Researcher, UX/Consumer Insights
job_description: Los Angeles‚Äô premier mobile games studio, Jam City is seeking an associate researcher, UX/consumer insights to join its team right here in the heart of the entertainment industry. A unique opportunity to join an award-winning gaming company, this is a fantastic opportunity to be part of games research and provide valuable player insights to influence the growth and development of a portfolio of over 10+ mobile games. Jam City is the creator of leading games like: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery, Disney Frozen Adventures, Disney Emoji Blitz, and Cookie Jam.¬†At Jam City we have a fundamental belief that deep player understanding is key to innovation, increased player enjoyment, and marketplace growth. Reporting directly to the Director of Consumer Insights & User Research, this individual will assist with a number of research activities to help understand the ‚Äúwhys‚Äù that drive player behavior and decision-making. You will work closely with the Director of Research supporting a number of in-house qualitative and quantitative research projects from inception through presentation of results and recommendations, with the goal of running research projects independently by the end of the first year.¬†Our ideal candidate loves mobile games and is familiar with traditional research methods, as well as new approaches and original thinking. RESPONSIBILITIES Support senior researchers with quantitative and qualitative research initiatives across our portfolio of mobile gamesSet up and manage our remote testing platformsLead recruiting initiatives for playtestingHelp program and QA surveys prior to launchModerate interviews and focus groupsAssist with the design and execution of research projects using a number of methods - including but not limited to surveys, playtesting, interviews, concept testing, usability testing, longitudinal studies, and player journey mappingAssist with data cleaning, report crafting, and the presentation/distribution of findings and results with stakeholdersBy the end of the first year, lead end-to-end basic qualitative and quantitative research projects independentlySupport and lead projects for our insight community of VIP players to gain agile and ongoing player feedback with our highly engaged playersHelp maintain our internal database of playtesters for in-house and remote playtestingPromote research best practices and evidence-based decision-making throughout Jam City game teamsTake initiative to stay current with industry trends and best practices in the mobile games industry and in the games user research industryQUALIFICATIONSMust love mobile games, particularly casual genres including Match-3, bubble shooter, and narrative; some interest in mid-core genres including RPG puzzles, strategy RPGs, and geolocation based gamesOne or more years experience in UX or consumer insights research, preferably in the gaming spaceExpertise and training in research design, understanding of a wide range of qualitative and quantitative methodologies (e.g. surveys, playtesting, competitive analyses, usability studies, expert review, questionnaire development and analysis, etc.)Ability to effectively create screening criteria, recruit research participants, build rapport with a wide range of players, and moderate playtesting sessionsExcellent written and oral communication skillsSelf-starter with passion, energy, enthusiasm to drive results and affect meaningful changeStrong attention to detail, written and oral communications skillsA team player, who thrives on working collaboratively, inspiring others and bringing out the best in the wider teamFlexibility in a fast-paced, undefined environmentStrong knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly ExcelNICE TO HAVEExperience with survey tools such as Qualtrics or AlchemerFamiliarity with mobile game mechanics is a plusSAS, R, SPSS, Tableau and/or other analytics software packages a plusPrevious experience working with data science and analytics teams a plusExperience creating and maintain recruiting databases for playtestingExperience with remote testing softwareIn compliance with local law, we are disclosing the compensation¬†for¬†this¬†role.¬†¬†The range listed is just one component of Jam City's total compensation package for employees, which may also include¬†annual bonuses, short- and long-term incentives, and program-specific awards.¬†The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. ¬†Starting pay for the successful applicant will depend on a variety of job-related factors, which may include education, training, experience, certifications, location, business needs, or market demands.¬†This range is based on a full-time position.¬†This range may be modified in the future. In addition, Jam City provides a variety of benefits to employees, including¬†but not limited to medical, dental, vision, parental leave, paid time off, a 401(k) plan, life, disability, and accident insurance.¬†¬†Pay Range: $27.40 ‚Äî $47.60¬†an hour.CHECK OUT LIFE AS A JAM CITIZEN:- Company news and events on our LinkedIn- Company Blog- Employee Feedback on our Comparably page- Find videos on our teams and games on our YoutubeOUR COMMITMENT TO EQUITY, DIVERSITY, & INCLUSIONWe believe in creating games that unite people across the world and that showcase our commitment to providing an environment that is both inclusive and diverse for our players and employees. We strive to create a workforce that is reflective of our global player community as we know that we are stronger and better when we play together. To help promote an inclusive culture, we celebrate the visible and invisible diversity of our Jam Citizens through initiatives including Employee Resource Groups, cultural events, trainings, speaker series, and more.¬†Jam City is an equal opportunity employer. We enthusiastically accept our responsibility to make employment decisions without regard to race, age, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, ancestry, religion, ethnicity, marital, or domestic partnerships status, disability, genetic information (including the refusal to submit to genetic testing), predisposing genetic characteristics, military status, veteran status, domestic violence victim status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expressions, or any other classification protected by federal, state, and local laws. Our management is committed to following this policy with respect to hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, layoff, termination, recruiting, pay, and other forms of compensation, training, and general treatment during employment.ABOUT JAM CITYJam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment company providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience. Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, and CTO Aber Whitcomb, former CTO of MySpace, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and award-winning games. Together, its games have generated over $3B in lifetime bookings and over 1.3B cumulative game installs. In addition to conceiving and developing the popular¬†Cookie Jam¬†and¬†Panda Pop¬†franchises, the company is a partner for some of the biggest global IP holders, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands from Universal Games and Digital Platforms, Disney and Warner Bros. Games. The company‚Äôs popular RPG game¬†Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery¬†was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch and¬†Jurassic World Alive¬†continues to be one of the top AR games in the market. Jam City currently has studios and talent located in Los Angeles (HQ), Burbank, Cedar Falls, Las Vegas, San Diego, San Francisco and, internationally, in Berlin, Bogot√°, Buenos Aires, Montr√©al and Toronto. For more information, please visit¬†www.jamcity.com.Apply for this job

title: Senior Cyber Security Manager
job_description: Job Purpose: This position is part of the Jagex Cyber Security Team (CST). It is responsible for supporting the Director of Cyber Security to promote information security program, improve security posture, and reduce relevant security risks within JAGEX. This role requires managerial and technical-related skills and sets to support our security function through its various service offerings.¬†Reporting to the Director of Cyber Security, the role will work closely with Cyber Security Team, IT engineering teams, and the outsourced partners to establish and maintain the service level of provided security services.¬†The Senior Cyber Security Manager is accountable for all security monitoring and assessment tools, security engineers and analysts. You will also provide information as part of a due diligence processes on products and 3rd party companies.¬† You will advise on technical security such as application security vulnerabilities, network security issues, and security architectures.¬† You will manage security programs and update security policies as needed.¬† We are looking for security leaders that possess a servant leadership type approach.¬†The role will need to develop and document security test plans, guidelines, and procedures. Devise methods to automate testing activities and streamline security testing processes. Read and analyze global security policies and adjust internal requirements accordingly. Develop an understanding of subject systems and applications and custom tailor their security testing plans.Key Duties Include: Leadership: ¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Build and maintain strong stakeholder relationships across the Studio.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Partner with stakeholders to create efficient risk management strategies in their areas to ensure the best possible game experience            or business objective can be achieved.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Managing the internal daily operational security activities.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Following career development plans of team members.Security Program:¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Assist with the security program improvements that will mature our security capabilities across the organization.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Providing summarized visibility of our cyber risks via automated reporting and dashboards while empowering the responsible parties.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Assist in evaluating and developing relevant Security policies and guidance.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Help to design and create role-based security training programs.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Create internal security bulletins.¬†Security Capability:¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Identify areas for improvement around a cyber security framework and governance, such as Identifying, Protecting, Detecting, Responding, and Recovering.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Responsible for ensuring secure application development is embedded across the organization by advising on how to best protect our custom-developed systems and games from malicious activity such as botting, account takeover, breaches, and security threats that limit the availability of our games.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Responsible for reviewing technology architecture from a security perspective.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† The technical ability to give feedback on the quality of the deliverable implemented by the security team and the ability to coach the teams effectively.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Researching, evaluating, and developing relevant security tools and methods.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Review and make security recommendations on application-level documentation like, requirements specifications, system architecture, design documentation, test plans, security plans, system hardening, CIS Benchmarks, etc.¬†Security Monitoring & Reporting:¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Creating Vulnerability Management Process and integrating relevant (infrastructure, application security) tools.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Creating and automating the vulnerability reporting process.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Monitoring, reviewing, and reporting KPI‚Äôs of security processes.Essential Skills: Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Engineering or a related technical discipline or the equivalent combination of education or experience,Minimum ten years of proven experience in the Information Security and Risk Management field with at least five years of experience in team management,Demonstrable experience in the delivery of Penetration Testing, Vulnerability Management, Security Operations, Risk Management, and Security Metrics,Strong understanding and hands-on experience with application and infrastructure vulnerabilities, automated/manual testing, auditing, and remediation techniques,Strong Understanding of OWASP projects like Top 10, ASVS, SAMM, and DSOMM,Curious, analytical mindset and the ability to solve complex problems,Good communication skills with the ability to interpret and deliver technical information to a variety of audiences,Proactive and self-driven personality with openness to continuous learning.Desirable Skills: Knowledge in Application Architecture Review, Threat modelling concepts.Experience with standard security tools such as Nmap, OWASP ZAP, Burp Suite, Wireshark, etc.Experience in establishing internal services with web vulnerability assessment tools such as Appscan, Acunetix, Invicti (netsparker), Fortify, Checkmarx, Burp Suite Enterprise, etc.Experience in establishing internal services with network/infrastructure vulnerability assessment tools such as Nessus, Nexpose, Qualys, Rapid 7, etc.Company Overview:A leader in creating deep and engaging experiences on PC and mobile, Jagex was founded in 2001 and is today one of the UK‚Äôs biggest and most respected video game developers and publishers.Famed for its flagship MMOs RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, Jagex has welcomed more than 260million player accounts to its world and created a $1bn lifetime franchise revenue. Today the RuneScape franchise exists beyond running games in live operations; our titles are living games that connect and inspire millions of players, with content and experiences both inside and outside of inexhaustible game worlds. Both RuneScape and Old School RuneScape, on PC and mobile, offer ever-evolving, highly-active worlds and our community-focussed development ethos empowers players to have a real say in how each game is shaped.
