title: Product Designer
job_description: Your Mission:The Product team at Improbable Defence is responsible for the design of valuable and desirable products and an underlying synthetic environment platform that users need, and that align closely with business goals, enabling our customers to save money and save lives.¬†We are building simulation-enhanced decision support tools for planners, policy designers, and decision-makers, so that they can use synthetic environments to evaluate, analyse, and respond to the challenges they face. There are various elements to this. Firstly, users can experience and interact with their environment using a geospatial dashboard for improved situational awareness, drawing conclusions and forming structured plans.¬†Secondly, the tool is an interface to the simulation engine. Users can run complex models, many times, at scale. A critical part of the value we deliver for clients is letting them use complex data generated by models, which results in better analytics. Our task is to design and build solutions for visualising this information both geospatially and temporally. The data visualisation work is done in close collaboration with scientific modellers in the division.Areas of Impact:Understand and apply the design process end to end, from discovery to delivery, as part of an agile Product team.Understand user research (choice of methodology to application) and product development, follow the lead from L3 Product Designers and UX ResearchersGather and translate business/client insight into design concepts to test and validate design directions and decisions.Produce low and high-fidelity sketches/prototypes/final UI.Develop trustful and collaborative relationships with colleagues, our customers (clients), and end users.Develop knowledge of the defence industry and our users to make informed design decisions.Work closely with Product Managers, Owners, and engineering and model engineering teams to define and prioritise features.Collaborate with engineers to implement designs of the highest quality.Contribute to the component system and be an owner of your design.Be an integral part of the Experience Design team.Critical Professional Skills:Ability to produce production-level visual and interaction design.Understanding of modern product design approaches and foundational interaction design principles and patterns.Good prototyping skills at different fidelities.Strong communication skills and a collaborative working style.Ability to produce high-fidelity presentations for our internal and external clients/partners as well as video producing/editing skills.Interest in gaining knowledge and experience in Product Design, and growing within the Experience Design teamCritical Knowledge/ Experience:Experience working in an agile team, and advocating good practice, in end-to-end product design processes from discovery to deliveryExperience in engaging and influencing customers and stakeholders to achieve optimal, user-centred outcomes.¬†Able to translate complex technical subject matter to user requirements and solutions.Experience in shipping digital products.Understanding in research activities and the synthesis of insight to inform design decisions.Experience with data visualisation and/or geographic information system (GIS).AbilitiesHas working knowledge and experience in their own disciplineContinues to build knowledge of the organization, processes and customersPerforms a range of mainly straightforward assignments and has become well-practiced at the soft skills associated with professional work (time management; communication; prioritisation; delivery)Uses prescribed guidelines or title: Lead Frontend Programmer
job_description: ABOUT GUNZILLA GAMES Founded in 2020, Gunzilla Games is a fresh, independent AAA developer working on its‚ÄØBattle Royale 2.0 Off The Grid in three metropolitan locations: Frankfurt, Germany (HQ); Los Angeles, USA; and Kyiv, Ukraine. The company is helmed by serial entrepreneur CEO, Vlad Korolev and CSO Alexander Zoll. Gunzilla is built on the desire to innovate and push the limits of the industry.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ Gunzilla‚Äôs formidable team of talent comes from a variety of industry-leading studios and publishers (Ubisoft, Electronic Arts (EA), THQ etc) as well as Oscar-nominated screenwriter, director and producer Neill Blomkamp, Chief Visionary Officer, and the author of the Altered Carbon series, that has been adapted into a popular Netflix show, Richard K. Morgan, Script Writer. Gunzilla Leadership team includes well-known industry professionals like Timur Davidenko, Chief Technology Officer¬†(Far Cry, Warface, and Crysis), Scott Probin, Studio Director (EA Sports‚Äô NHL series, the Need for Speed franchise, Populous 2, Powermonger, Space Hulk),¬†Oleksiy Plaksin, Lead Art Director,¬†(Moto GP and RIDE, Warface and Act of Aggression, Sniper: Ghost Warrior),¬†Dmitriy Markov, Technical Director¬†(Metro: Exodus, Arktika.1), Volodymyr Savin, Audio Director¬†(Cut the Rope, Metro Exodus, HBO Chernobyl series).OUR VALUES Players First & Foremost. We aim to create titles that players love and get lost in, so our games are developed with them in mind from the start. We Believe in Our People. We believe in building strong teams of self-motivated individuals empowered to work at their best in a supportive environment; when we‚Äôre strong together, we thrive together. Commitment to Engagement & Quality. We are deeply passionate about what we do, ensuring we produce next-generation experiences of the highest calibre. Make Bold Moves & Innovate. We strive to make bold moves and push technology to its limits; there are no wrong steps if the outcome redefines the boundaries. Open & Honest. We believe in building trust through transparency and honest communication. We‚Äôre proud of who we are, what we stand for, and what we‚Äôre building.ABOUT THE JOBGunzilla Games are looking for a Lead Frontend Programmer to lead our talented Frontend Programming team working on OTG (Off The Grid), an all-new AAA Battle Royale 2.0 third-person shooter, due for release on PlayStation¬Æ5, Xbox¬Æ Series X|S and PCRESPONSIBILITIESLead and mentor a distributed team of experienced frontend programmersGame UI development (HTML5, TypeScript, CSS)Game UI profiling and optimizationCooperation with our UI/UX designersREQUIREMENTSAt least 1 years‚Äô experience of leading a Team LeadExcellent communication skills, with the ability to clearly provide technical feedback and documentationStrong Typescript, JavaScript, HTML, CSS knowledge (4+ years)Data structures & algorithms understandingExperience with modern frontend frameworks (e.g. React)React with functional components knowledgeCSS animations experienceProficiency in vanilla JS (DOM manipulations, developing features such as custom scroll from scratch etc.)Experience with build systems (e.g. Webpack)Performance optimizationGUNZILLA OFFERSFlexible Working & Work from HomeHealth InsuranceRevenue Based Bonuses English / German Courses25 Annual Paid Vacation & Sick Days Public TransportationRelocation & Accommodation SupportOffice Perks & Gym MembershipCOME AS YOU ARE Videogames are for everyone, so everyone should have the opportunity to create them. We‚Äôre looking for a huge variety of unique life experiences to help shape the worlds we‚Äôre developing, so promise your application will be given the same consideration as everyone else‚Äôs, regardless of your background. Let‚Äôs make video game history together!¬†OUR RECRUITMENT PROCESSHere‚Äôs what you can expect when applying at Gunzilla.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Simply fill in the registration form and send us your CV & Portfolio, if applicable¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† If your selected, you‚Äôll be contacted by our recruitment team for a Zoom call.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† After this the next steps would be Hiring manager and Team Zoom interviews, or you‚Äôll be invited to meet us at our recruiting studio.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Some roles require a competency test, which the recruitment team will support you on.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Following your interview, we‚Äôll contact you either way.¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† If the interview went well but we feel you aren‚Äôt suited to the specific role, we‚Äôll retain your details (with your permission) for future consideration.Apply for this job

We have achieved serial successes across a wide variety of titles including Elite Dangerous, Planet Coaster, Jurassic World Evolution, Planet Zoo and F1 Manager. Go-To-Market plansDevelop strong relationships with Game Directors, Executive Producers, internal and external department heads and other key stakeholders to successfully publish our games to a global audienceAct as the key point of contact for all aspects of brand marketing within your portfolio of titles and be a leading expert within the studio on community/player sentiment Responsible for managing marketing budgets for titles in your careRegularly report campaigns, results and risks to executive and senior leadershipWork with the Director of Brand Marketing and other Heads of Brand Marketing to help shape and drive goals, targets, and processes for the wider Brand Marketing teamLead, mentor, develop and empower a talented cross-discipline marketing team for your portfolio of titlesAbout youExperienced senior manager with a marketing, product, brand or communications background with proven track record of overseeing and delivering global marketing campaigns and launching international projects / products.What we can offer youWe offer the chance to work with talented and passionate people, developing and publishing sophisticated and enduring games in a creative and collaborative environment. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, which includes a success-based annual bonus, share option schemes, pension, life assurance, private family healthcare, flexitime working hours, enhanced maternity/paternity package, in-house subsidised catering, support with relocation, a Cycle to Work scheme and free bike servicing, and social events.We welcome and encourage applications from qualified candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.Apply for this job

sculpting, retopology, UV mapping, texture baking, texture creation, setting up and exporting to game.¬†Awareness of the importance of mesh topology, to ensure that character models deform well when animated.¬†Experience with PBR and real-time engines.¬†Understanding of best working practices in terms of LOD creation and optimisation.¬†Excellent communications skills are essential.¬†Desirable¬†¬†An Art degree or relevant game art course is highly desirable.¬†Flair for interpreting concept art, turning character sketches into 3D models that accurately capture the spirit of the concept.¬†Frontier creates games in a number of genres, so we encourage an adaptable attitude to working across a breadth of art styles, from high-detail realism to cartoon stylisation.¬†What we can offer youWe offer the chance to work with talented and passionate people, developing and publishing sophisticated and enduring games in a creative and collaborative environment. We love what we do, and we work hard to provide outstanding experiences for our player communities. Frontier rewards this passion and determination by sharing in the company‚Äôs success and by supporting our teams to keep doing what they love.Well-being is a big focus at Frontier and we are continually evolving how we can support our staff. We encourage a healthy work/life balance and host a range of well-being activities, initiatives and sessions to support both mental and physical health. We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, which includes a success-based annual bonus, share option schemes, pension, life assurance, private family healthcare, flexitime working hours, enhanced maternity/paternity package, in-house subsidised catering, support with relocation, a Cycle to Work scheme and free bike servicing, and social events.We welcome and encourage applications from qualified candidates regardless of sex, race, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marriage or civil partnership, pregnancy or maternity, religion or belief.Apply for this job

title: Network Programmer
job_description: Come play with us!At Dynasty Studios we offer a highly creative and ambitious workspace, with flexible working hours and opportunities for career growth. As our future employee, you will be joining a flat-structured environment with a casual dress code and be surrounded by open and talented colleagues in a social space that offers after-work social gatherings and events for every taste. Here at Dynasty Studios, we value every employee and their individual and unique contributions in the making of our highly engaging games.DESCRIPTIONWe are looking for an enthusiastic individual to join our studio as our new Network Programmer and help us build real-time networked systems. We hope to find someone who will be eager to work with designers and programmers to implement key game features from conception to live deployment. You will own and implement technical delivery of aspects of our networked solutions.We are looking for candidates at all seniority levelsRESPONSIBILITIESSupport gameplay programmers to make sure all implemented features work well in a multiplayer gameThe candidate will automate the deployment of the game server and implement tools to automate the game deployment processPrepare the game architecture so we can release constant content and event updates to the game¬†Working closely together with the other departments to implement the needed game requirementsActively participating in the design and production of the gameWrite secure, robust, and maintainable codeKnowledge of the Unreal ecosystem is appreciatedQUALIFICATIONSProficient in C++¬†Good communication skills¬†Team player¬†Proactive and with initiativeExcellent problem-solving, debugging, and optimization skills¬†Knowledgeable in design patterns and programming paradigms¬†Experience in developing multiplayer games¬†Experience solving networking issues¬†Foundational knowledge of network protocols, replication, prediction, and anti-cheating, and other networking technologiesExcellent communication skills and fluent or business level English - written and spokenExperience of dedicated game server development and deployment on cloudPERSONALAbility to understand and meet company goalsConfident in taking initiative, being innovative, and performing consistentlyBeing self-motivated with a high standard of delivering top quality resultsThrive in an informal, creative environment of highly motivated peopleStrong interpersonal skills and a sense of humourHaving a knack for thinking ahead to ensure continuous workplace improvementBONUS SKILLSWould be a Generalist within networking¬†¬†Would have a background as a Network ArchitectABOUT DYNASTY STUDIOSAt Dynasty Studios we create next-generation games. With our established team of veteran game developers, our team at Dynasty has several projects in the pipeline designed with the goal of uniting the blockchain and gaming communities. We strive to lead the mass adoption of blockchain technology through never before seen gameplay experiences. Our upcoming franchise of high-quality games will operate within a shared universe of playable assets and in-game economies that will open up new dimensions of gameplay through true digital ownership and player-driven experiences.Diversity is in Dynasty‚Äôs DNA and we hire talent regardless of race, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, or any other class or characteristic.Apply for this job

title: Lead Game Designer
job_description: Our client offers the most advanced virtual reality experience in the world. Inside their VR rooms they take you on thrilling adventures and transform you into new characters. Since they launched in Hong Kong in 2017, they‚Äôre now live in 20+ locations and 4 countries around the world and they are quickly expanding.They are now looking for experienced  Lead Game Designer. This is a full time position based in Hong Kong (remote start is possible).As a Lead Game Designer you‚Äôll be responsible for using your strong design background, superb creative taste, and incredible attention to detail to ensure each moment of our VR experiences is of the highest quality. This role gives you many avenues with which to express your creativity and skills. With our Client  you will have the chance to innovate, invent new VR gameplay mechanics, write compelling narratives, and build memorable worlds that their guests will talk about for days and days after their visit.Game Design ‚Äì You‚Äôll work closely with the Creative Director to plan out each moment of their VR Experiences and lend your design skills to solving difficult design problems. You‚Äôll invent fun and highly intuitive gameplay mechanics which their  guests can learn quickly and enjoy. You will use your expertly-tuned design sensibilities to adjust balance and pacing of each experience as needed. At the end of the day, you know what ‚Äògood‚Äô looks like, and you‚Äôll strive to ensure each experience meets your own high professional standards.Narrative & Writing ‚Äì You will use your creativity to develop interesting characters and narratives for their  VR experiences. You‚Äôll have a chance to innovate in the narrative space and develop the best ways to tell stories within VR. You will use your writing skills to create memorable and interesting dialogue which is not overly verbose or self-indulgent.Level Design ‚Äì You will also use your background in level design to create exciting and compelling level designs for each location within our experiences. You will use tools to implement your whitebox designs into each game. You will work to thoroughly test and iterate upon your whitebox designs before they go into the art production pipeline. Finally, you‚Äôll work with the environment art team during each step of the process and collaborate to ensure each location is visually engaging and thrilling for gameplay.REQUIREMENTS:Versatile Design Background ‚Äì You have multiple shipped titles which you were a Senior or Lead Designer on, including at least one VR title which is either a high-quality indie VR game or a AAA VR game. You have at least 5+ years of experience in designing games. During your career your responsibilities should have included a variety of level design, game design, mission design, and writing responsibilities.Communication ‚Äì You are a superb communicator and understand how to keep stakeholders informed when decisions affect other departments. You are extremely clear when communicating your ideas and designs to fellow team members so that everyone understands the design intent and the tasks they need to do to achieve a great result. Finally, you are also good at pitching your ideas and are very open to constructive criticism and feedback.Prototyping ‚Äì You work well with programmers and artists in order to create strong prototypes that prove design ideas so that features can enter production with confidence.Documentation ‚Äì You can create strong design documentation, including both detailed written documentation and compelling visual documentation (depending on your audience).Analytical Skills ‚Äì You have a strong understanding of how to interpret player data and make informed design decisions about how to improve projects post-release. You have experience balancing games.Technically Proficient ‚Äì You‚Äôve used numerous proprietary and third-party tools during your career including: Unity, Unreal Editor, or equivalent. You are comfortable with visual scripting tools and ideally you can script using C#.Combat Design Experience ‚Äì You have been the primary combat designer for at least one title in your experience.You play screen-based games and VR games... A lot. ‚Äì You constantly keep yourself up to date by playing some of the world‚Äôs best screen-based and VR games. As you play games, you constantly evaluate them and think about why certain design decisions were made and how tweaking these decisions could affect the user experience.BONUS FOR:You have a strong personal interest in VR technology. You understand trends in VR and monitor developments of VR hardware and accessories. title: Worldbuilding Game Designer
job_description:
At Wizards of the Coast, we connect people around the world through play and imagination. From our genre defining games like Magic: The Gathering¬Æ and Dungeons & Dragons¬Æ to our growing multiverse, we continue to innovate and build new ways to foster friendship and connection. That‚Äôs where you come in!
Are you a Worldbuilding Game Designer who loves the intersection of mechanics and flavor? Can you write art briefs and build worlds, while keeping your head in both the Fun and the Future of gaming?
What You'll Do:
On any given day in the Magic TCG Studio, you could:

Write a high volume of art briefs.
Provide appropriate feedback to art directors about illustrations, including mechanical relevance continuity concerns for character and lore.
Generate unique and compelling narrative card content (e.g. flavor text).
Coordinate with designers, narrative leads, and Product Architecture to ensure goals for card set are represented.
Participate in Game Design brainstorms.
Participate in worldbuilding and playtesting to foster collaborative communication between groups and make sure card set is aligned with each team‚Äôs needs.

What You'll Bring:
We are looking a curious, adaptable, and creative new team member to bring their robust worldbuilding, collaborative communication, and game design skills to Magic!
Magic produces multiple worlds, hundreds of characters, and thousands of cards per year, and we are a high-talent, welcoming team seeking someone with:

2+ years experience writing prolific art briefs.
Excellent communication and organization skills.
An orientation towards both ownership and flexibility in the game design process.
A deep love for and understanding of the world design process within a game design environment.
A bias toward action and eagerness to iterate on ideas.
A passion for feedback and data to better inform their work.
Strong valuation of inclusive storytelling.
Some knowledge of the TCG/CCG design space.

job_description:
At Wizards of the Coast, we connect people around the world through play and imagination. From our genre defining games like Magic: The Gathering¬Æ and Dungeons & Dragons¬Æ to our growing multiverse, we continue to innovate and build new ways to foster friendship and connection. Are you a producer / project manager who loves working with creatives? Does the idea of working with some of the most fan-worthy IPs in the world excite you?
The Magic Creative team is a fun-loving and inclusive group who deeply believe in ensuring that the creative expressions of our cards (art, text, and overall point-of-view) are exciting and engaging for our fans!
Game Producers for the creative team for Magic ensure that our art and writing resources have everything they need to make outstanding products while staying on time, within budget, and at the excellent quality our team is known for.
This position serves at the intersection where creative work, fast paced schedules, cross-functional relationships, and digital tools come together. This producer will be guiding a newly formed team passionate about bringing top pop culture IPs into our outstanding game.

Build Smartsheet templates, track project schedules, and follow up with individuals within and outside of your team to ensure timely delivery.
Coordinate external partner check-ins, help construct IP evaluations, and ensure Creative Designers and Art Directors are set up to craft extraordinary expressions of some of the most beloved IPs in fandom.

Get things done! Generate action items, drive conversations to conclusions, and keep track of decisions made.

3+ Years‚Äô experience working as a Producer, Project Manager, or similar game project management position.

Project management orientation: Ability to demonstrate an outstanding balance between a flexible/forward-thinking mentality and a strong orientation towards process and problem solving.
Excellent documentation ability: Strong skills in articulating ‚Äî in plain speak ‚Äî complex concepts.

title: Operations Specialist (Duel Masters) (Japanese Bilingual Required)
job_description:
At Wizards of the Coast, we connect people around the world through play and imagination. From our genre-defining games like Magic: The Gathering¬Æ and Dungeons & Dragons¬Æ to our growing multiverse, we continue to innovate and build new ways to foster friendship and connection. We are looking for a Japanese bilingual Operations Specialist to join our Duel Masters Studio to help us with various aspects of projects related to the brand that is exclusively developed for the Japanese market. This role will function as a liaison between our Japanese partners and the internal teams by coordinating deliveries of products and promotional items, updating product specs, setting up prices, and crafting and supervising the marketing budget. Duel Masters is co-owned with Japanese media companies, and this role connects with multiple contacts in Japan on the daily basis via emails and conference calls.
This person will have strong skills in multi tasking, communication, and customer service. This role needs to build positive relationships with both internal and external partners, understanding and advocating the needs of all the parties involved with the projects.
What You'll Do:

Set up products in the system after collecting vital information from multiple stakeholders.
Communicate product specs and prices to the Japanese distributor, and process orders.
Coordinate deliveries with the internal production and logistic teams and the vendors in Japan.
Facilitate to solve any issues raised by the distributor regarding deliveries and QC.
Build plans and schedule for promotional items and track the annual marketing budget.
Acquire information needed to create packaging from the distributor.
Mediate payment processes between the company and the partners in Japan.

What You'll Bring:

2+ years of experience in the Japanese culture and workforce.
Strong verbal and written communication in Japanese and English.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, and Power Point).
Multi-tasking and time-management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks.
Understanding of general finance and budgeting.
Ability to build consensus and relationships among the partners and members of other departments.
Able to manage multiple documents with attention to details.
Result driven approach.

Familiarity with consumer products.

title: Lead Character Artist (Skeleton Key)
job_description:
At Wizards of the Coast, we connect people around the world through play and imagination. From our genre defining games like Magic: The Gathering¬Æ and Dungeons & Dragons¬Æ to our growing multiverse, we continue to innovate and build new ways to foster friendship and connection. That‚Äôs where you come in!
Skeleton Key is a new game development studio and division of Wizards of the Coast. We are a group of industry veterans who are guided by the belief that empowering our teams and providing the proper time, tools, and support we can foster a creative culture where everyone can do their best work.
Our new studio will be located in Austin, TX, and we are looking for a passionate and dedicated Lead Character Artist to join us. We are considering on-site and hybrid working options as well as full-time remote candidates.
Reporting to the Art Director, you will play a critical role on the project by crafting iconic characters and creatures as we move from concept to pre-production. You'll also help us establish the quality, style, and pipelines for character art as a subject area within the studio.
What You'll Do:

Sculpt high-resolution AAA quality characters, build clean game topology, UV's and textures for character assets.
Foster a collaborative relationship with others to build appealing characters, creatures, character skins, and other AAA content.
Support character concept and design teams.
Work with other art teams, and game direction to establish visual style and production pipelines/processes for crafting character models.
Collaborate across crafts and fields to help guide the Character Art team through pre-production visual development tests and conceptualization, as well as production execution.
Work closely with the Tech Art team to maintain guidelines for model deliveries that allow for effective deformation and expression, as well as optimization.
Assist and partner with the Art Director to drive and maintain high visual quality of character models
Be an active mentor, leader and role model for the art team.

What You'll Bring:

5+ years of experience, with at least 2 years as a Character Artist in a leadership role.
A portfolio that demonstrates a breadth of both technical and artistic execution of Character Art.
Communication skills and knowledge to both effectively give and receive creative and artistic critique.
Excellent understanding of anatomical proportions, silhouette and a strong sense of compositional design and balance.
Experience using real-time engines such as Unreal or Unity.
Knowledge of art assets optimization for games.
Expertise in both hard surface and organic high poly techniques.
Outstanding knowledge of PBR texture/material workflows.
Experience with Substance Painter.
Understand rigging and skinning.
Passion for making and playing game.
Enthusiastic, positive, team-oriented; must have the ability to interact and collaborate with all departments and teams.
Self-sufficient and self-motivated, can perform duties with little oversight.

Build global media plans across core advertising channels (search, social, display, and programmatic) based on goals set by each product.

Track efficiency of campaigns and implement data-informed optimizations to improve product key performance indicators such as Customer Acquisition Cost, Return on Ad Spend, and Retention.
Onboard and test new media channels to expand our advertising footprint to reach new and existing players.
Support multiple products and brands campaign initiatives simultaneously.
Provide expertise on marketing technologies which include ad attribution, process automation, and advanced analytics.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across the organization including designers, product engineers, data analysts, and product marketers.
Identify standard methodologies and techniques across the industry for PC and mobile gaming.
Mentor media buying peers and demonstrate thought leadership in the media buying space.

What You'll Bring:

5+ years of hands-on media buying experience across major ad platforms (Google, Facebook, Twitter, Amazon AMS, Reddit, and Google DV360).
4-year college degree or equivalent experience.
Managed a multi-million-dollar advertising budget.
Experience using marketing analytics platforms on mobile and desktop.
In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience handling cross-platform buying across Google, Facebook, Amazon (AMS), Twitter, Reddit and other industry-leading ad networks.
Knowledge and experience measuring CPI, CPA, CPC, LTV, CAC, CPM, oCPM, ROAS, Retention, and ACOS.
Experience utilizing multiple advertising mediums such as statics, videos, and playables formats.
Develop strategies and media plans, as well as quantify the reach, impact and efficiency metrics of each advertising campaign.
Drive constant campaign improvements through the implementation of multivariate testing and optimization.
Strong technical knowledge of Excel and working with Tableau or equivalent.
Comfortable working in a quickly-moving and highly dynamic environment.
Understanding of privacy laws handling PII and following GDPR and CCPA guidelines.
Experience working with global brands.
Passion for both games and the business of games.
Empathy for gamers and the global gaming community.
Known for building collaborative relationships with key internal partners as well as external influencers, business partners, and leaders with vision.

Nice To Have:

Certifications in Google Ads, Facebook Ads, and Amazon (AMS) within the last 12 months.

title: Technical Artist
job_description:
About the Team
The Art Team at Wildlife is growing. With an audience that numbers in the millions, our games have the power to impact countless lives. Our games connect people with interesting characters, vibrant worlds, and unforgettable experiences.¬†
That's no small task, but we have a powerful secret weapon: our people. The Wildlife team is a collection of world-class talent, a team focused on synergy, collaboration, and growing strong together.
About the Role
Our Tech Art team creates solutions to make our game development process efficient, futureproof and scalable. Our aim is to empower great artists in allowing them to focus in the creative zones in creating amazing assets, test and integrate them into the game. This is the key in making high quality game assets effectively.
Our team is looking for a highly motivated person who is passionate about games & animation and how to make artists' lives easier based around technical proficiency, problem solving approaches, a lot of curiosity and deep collaboration.
Who you are:

Engine Expertise: You have experience working with Unity and/or other game engines, have customized tools for efficient implementation and testing of assets. You also understand the impact of standardized convention and folder structures in crafting an effective pipeline.
Organized: You are organized, especially when it comes to game development. You meticulously define naming conventions and folder structures, so that everything goes as planned. You strive for the most efficient way of doing things.
Team Player: You are a self-motivated team player who proactively seeks feedback and shares knowledge. You are good at interacting with a wide range of people, across backgrounds and specialities.


Documentation: You are not only good in structuring and organizing content, but also in documenting everything and making it very accessible for everyone. You are a great communicator of changes made, tools and processes.


Growth Oriented: You are always on top of the latest tools and techniques to help shape our pipelines. Constantly on the lookout for the best solutions for implementing assets into the engine or large systems to allow for scalability.

What you'll do:

Coding: You will be supporting asset production by creating technical solutions/tools to make the artist's life easier. You will also collaborate with our engineering team on large scale and complex solutions related to asset efficiency.
Pipeline: You will define and evangelize game development structures and processes for characters, environments, vfx and UI elements. You'll make all our processes accessible for both internal teams and external partners. You'll help create large systems in the engine to allow scalable and fast asset integration.
Collaboration: You will be part of multiple teams, with distinct goals and parts to play in each of them. Inside the Tech Art team, you are helping the whole structure grow and find the best solutions to improve our pipeline. Inside the different game teams, you are a facilitator and an ambassador of Tech Art, and partnering with Art Directors to bring visual concepts to life inside the engine.
Problem Solving: You will work alongside Graphics Engineers, Technical Directors and Art Directors to define and manage technical specification for all game assets, including debugging and performance analysis. You'll also give technical support to artists, solving a wide range of different problems and anticipating those that might occur in the future.
Mentoring: As a senior member of the team, you will help mentor other Technical Artists especially in their engine knowledge, pipeline design and problem solving. You will also help spread the knowledge to the Game Art department and engineers on how our tools and solution work, making our pipeline a part of their day-to-day activities.

What you'll need:

Experience working as a Senior Tech Artist in games/ interactive medium.
Experience developing editor tools in Unity engine with C#.
Experience with 3D software, Maya specifically.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.
A resume and an online portfolio showcasing your work.

Pluses:

You have experience in authoring and optimizing assets such as character, animation, prop, vfx, material and shader in Unity.
You have experience in Maya, working in Python and PySide.
Ability to speak art and code.

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build the best gaming company, where everyone thrives.¬†
Please note that an art test may be required during the evaluation process.
About Wildlife
Wildlife Studios is an independent mobile game studio started in 2011 and headquartered in S√£o Paulo, Brazil. The company is growing, and we‚Äôre on a mission to build our creative capability.
At Wildlife we‚Äôre committed to being a company where the best talent can do their best work. Our goal is to create great games, worlds players escape to, and characters they can‚Äôt live without. This is our aspiration, and we know it‚Äôs no small task. Our secret weapon is our people, and the company is built to support them. We‚Äôre looking for world class talent inspired to be a part of this journey.¬†
We believe video games will be the source of the world's most beloved entertainment franchises. We hope to accelerate this transition by making iconic games that will be remembered and shared for generations.
We are looking for talented and passionate people to join us on this mission at several locations around the world such as S√£o Paulo (Brazil), Irvine (United States), and San Francisco (United States).

About Wildlife

At Wildlife we‚Äôre committed to being a company where the best talent can do their best work. Our goal is to create great games, worlds players escape to, and characters they can‚Äôt live without. This is our aspiration, and we know it‚Äôs no small task. Our secret weapon is our people, and the company is built to support them. We‚Äôre looking for world class talent inspired to be a part of this journey.¬†
We believe video games will be the source of the world's most beloved entertainment franchises. We hope to accelerate this transition by making iconic games that will be remembered and shared for generations.

title: Senior Cloud Security Engineer
job_description:
An engineer in our team works with a global scale infrastructure and has a great impact on millions of players. To guarantee the best experience possible, we count several Kubernetes clusters spread in four AWS regions and connected to each other. We are in the cutting edge of open-source infrastructure¬†technology, we adopted Kubernetes in production little after the project was launched and today we use technologies such as eBPF and Cilium in our network stack.¬†
The security team focuses on reducing Wildlife Studios' risk exposure by implementing information¬†security best practices, leveraging automation, and helping developers deliver value.¬†
The security team works together with internal partners from development and infrastructure areas in¬†order to have a multiplying impact, make security part of the SDLC and infrastructure architecture¬†designs.¬†
About the role¬†
Wildlife Studios is searching for a Security Engineer to join our security team. We seek an engineer with programming, cloud, network and security systems knowledge. Since we are always looking for new tools and technologies that better solve our problems, we value professionals that like to learn new things, are autonomous and proactive to bring and implement their ideas.¬†
We'll need you to understand our systems, identify potential vulnerabilities in the production environment, propose, design and implement solutions that will lower the overall risk.¬†
More about you¬†

 Automation is key to scaling. We look for engineers that have a history of proposing, designing¬†

and executing automation projects in order to get rid of any manual and repetitive tasks.¬†

 Long-term focus. Improving the security of our infrastructure requires us to build strong foundations and think about the long term impact of our actions.¬†


 Bleeding edge. You are curious and like to study new technologies, test new solutions and measure the impact brought by changes. We want to ensure we are using the best stack possible¬†

What you‚Äôll do¬†

 Implement open source tools to increase the security of our AWS accounts and Kubernetes clusters.
Develop Lambda functions and other more complex tools to automate processes in our infrastructure
Define monitoring and observability patterns for security events.
Identify vulnerabilities in existing infrastructure, propose and implement improvements.
Integrate security into infrastructure build processes by creating security tools to assert that our
Terraform infrastructure as code configurations follow security best practices.¬†

What others in this role have done¬†

 Implement Netflix's Bless to secure SSH access to our EC2 instances¬†
 Implement shelvery to send backups to a disaster recovery AWS account¬†
 Enable MFA for all our IAM users¬†
 Enable, configure and automate AWS GuardDuty for all AWS accounts and regions¬†

What you'll need¬†

 At least 2 years working on Cloud Security or Infrastructure Security projects¬†
 Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent experience.¬†
 Linux knowledge. You should be able to discuss in detail what happens under the hood (SO, kernel, network).
At least two years experience managing AWS deployments.
At least two years experience managing Kubernetes clusters.
Solid knowledge in at least one programming language. We work mostly with Python and Go.¬†

Plus¬†

 Experience with large scale production systems and technologies.¬†
 Experience with infrastructure as code tools (eg: Ansible, Terraform, etc).¬†
 Experience with CI/CD pipelines (eg: Jenkins, Travis, etc).¬†

We welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build the best gaming¬†company, where everyone thrives.¬†
About Wildlife¬†
Wildlife is one of the leading mobile game developers and publishers in the world. We have released more than 60 titles, reaching billions of people around the globe. Today, we have offices in Brazil, Argentina, Ireland, and the United States. Here, we create games that will excite, intrigue, and engage our players for years to come!¬†
Equal Opportunity & Affirmative Action¬†
Wildlife is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. title: QA Automation Engineer
job_description:
Job overview¬†
Wargaming is growing the Platform team and is looking for talented¬†QA Automation Engineer¬†who will enthusiastically dive into new interesting projects.
Platform is a set of web-services which provides a functionality for operating games and players accounts. The main Platform capabilities are

game delivery
players‚Äô registration and authentication
payments
communication with players
interaction between games with each other and different services.

What will you do?

Perform testing procedures (maintain and update test documentation, create test scenarios, perform functional testing, etc.).
Expand and maintain all kind of tests available in a project (e.g., e2e UI automation, API automation, performance etc.).
Cooperate and communicate with other teams and departments within Wargaming.
Work closely with a development team during Sprint.
Participate in releases.

What are we looking for?

2+ years‚Äô experience in web-application testing.
Understanding of the software development cycle and the role of testing within it.
Knowledge of testing methodology (functional, integration, automation, performance) .
General understanding of server-client architecture and network.
Experience working with¬†database.
Experience working with bug trackers and case management systems.
Experience working with¬†Git/SVN.
Basic knowledge of UNIX/Linux.
B1 level of English.

What additional skills will help you stand out?

Basic knowledge of Python or experience developing test scripts with any programming languages (using xUnit, Selenium/WebDriver).
Experience working with Continuous Integration systems (TeamCity/Jenkins/Bamboo).
Experience working¬†on high-load projects and/or with tool for running performance tests (Jmeter).
Experience working with REST API, knowledge of XML/JSON.


About Wargaming¬†
Wargaming is an award-winning online game developer and publisher headquartered in Nicosia, Cyprus. Operating since 1998, Wargaming has become one of the leaders in the gaming industry with 15 offices worldwide, including studios in Chicago, Prague, Shanghai, Tokyo, and Vilnius. Our diverse and multicultural team works together to deliver a top-class experience to millions of players who enjoy Wargaming's titles across all major gaming platforms. Our flagship products include free-to-play hits World of Tanks, World of Warships and World of Tanks Blitz.

title: Sr. Software Engineer - Video
job_description:
About Us
Twitch is the world‚Äôs biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It‚Äôs where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.¬†
We‚Äôre about community, inside and out. You‚Äôll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We‚Äôre on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we‚Äôre up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we‚Äôre solving on our Blog.
About the Role
Twitch operates the largest dedicated live video CDN in the world, delivering over 25Tbps to more than 5MM concurrent viewers. In addition to serving Twitch traffic our CDN is offered as an AWS service, Amazon Interactive Video Service, enabling the creation of a live video streaming platform with only a few lines of code.
The Video Distribution team manages the software that operates that CDN, which includes everything from custom edge software that delivers video on thousands of hosts worldwide, to the graphing algorithms that manage our worldwide caching hierarchy, and to the complex and introspective algorithms that decide what server a user is assigned when they start playback.
Working with the Video Distribution team, you will use your low-level network protocol development experience to dive deep into next-generation media protocols and optimize the efficiency of Twitch video delivery at the edge. We've already built the lowest latency high-scale HLS distribution system on the planet. You will help us build the next generation of sub-second and real-time product offerings.
As a Senior Software Engineer you will report to the manager of the Video Distribution Edge and Backbone team.
You can be located in San Francisco, CA; Irvine, CA; Seattle, WA; New York, NY; Salt Lake City, UT; or Vancouver, BC. You can also be remote within Canada or the USA.
You Will:

Design, implement, and deploy live video CDN edge delivery features using modern protocols like QUIC, WebRTC, and HLS.
Squeeze every last iota of performance out of Twitch's edge compute by writing performant kernel and network code and investigating further optimizations like TCP offload.
Validate performance improvements and prevent regression by defining and implementing repeatable automated performance tests.
Work with client video teams to contribute to the next generation of Twitch by improving edge efficiency, lowering latency, and improving time to video.

You Have:

You have implemented QUIC or HTTP/3 at scale across a large bare metal fleet
Hands-on experience with video protocols like HLS or LL-HLS.
Hands-on experience with WebRTC.
8+ years combined of C++, C, or Rust programming experience related to Linux kernel or network protocols.
Hands-on experience with Go
Experience with TCP/IP or UDP performance tuning and congestion control algorithms (e.g. BBR, GSO)

Perks

Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
401(k)
Maternity & Parental Leave
Flexible PTO
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)¬†

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.¬†
The base pay range for this position in Colorado, Connecticut, Washington and New Jersey is $195,840 - $239,360 yr and in New York City is $215,370 - $263,320 yr. Pay is based on market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. A sign-on payment and restricted stock units may be provided as part of the compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered. You should apply through Twitch's internal or external careers site.¬†
Workers in New York City who perform in-person work or work with the public in the course of business must show proof they have been fully vaccinated against COVID or request and receive approval for a reasonable accommodation, including medical or religious accommodation.
Twitch values your privacy. Please consult our Candidate Privacy Notice, for information about how we collect, use, and disclose personal information of our candidates.

title: IP Operations Analyst  (Contract)
job_description:
About Us
Twitch is the world‚Äôs biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It‚Äôs where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.¬†
We‚Äôre about community, inside and out. You‚Äôll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We‚Äôre on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we‚Äôre up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we‚Äôre solving on our Blog.
About the Position
IP Operations is part of Twitch Legal and is an enforcement team responsible for helping Twitch navigate global safe harbor laws, curbing unauthorized intellectual property uses with the appropriate policy and operational measures, and guiding rights holders and creators through our policies that are designed to meet those aims.
The IP Operations Analyst‚Äôs primary responsibilities are reviewing and responding to legal requests and inquiries from rights holders and creators. To do so you will be analyzing, problem solving, communicating dynamic and unique fact patterns, and maintaining the team‚Äôs domain expertise.
This is a 100% remote position based (APAC/EMEA).
You Will:

Intake and process continuously inbound copyright related requests and inquiries from external parties, including review, analysis in accordance with our policies and guidelines, and using internal service tools for resolution.
Collaborate and problem-solve with cross functional partners throughout Twitch.
Develop domain expertise on the Twitch service ecosystem of user-generated content and emergent behavior of creators, rights holders, and other external stakeholders.
Contribute to programmatic initiatives in compliance, proactive measures, stakeholder management, and team infrastructure as needed. Participate in improving procedures, tooling, and strategies as a subject matter expert.

You Have:

Attention to detail and the ability to conduct and communicate analysis around ambiguous fact patterns that require interpretation.
The ability to collaborate efficiently on time-sensitive issues.
A commitment to continuous improvement in solving new and existing challenges.
The ability to independently problem solve efficiently and proactively.

Bonus Points

Experience in copyright or user-generated content enforcement.

Location(s): Remote (EMEA) and Remote ( APAC)
Contract Length: 9 months
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at Twitch. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Content Finance
job_description:
About Us
Twitch is the world‚Äôs biggest live streaming service, with global communities built around gaming, entertainment, music, sports, cooking, and more. It‚Äôs where millions of people come together to chat, interact, and make their own entertainment.¬†
We‚Äôre about community, inside and out. You‚Äôll find coworkers who are eager to team up, collaborate, and smash (or elegantly solve) problems together. We‚Äôre on a quest to empower live communities, so if this sounds good to you, see what we‚Äôre up to on LinkedIn and Twitter, get interviewing tips on Instagram, and discover projects we‚Äôre solving on our Blog.
About the Role
The Content Financial Planning and Analysis team leads Twitch's content acquisition deal modeling and analysis. We ensure accurate reporting, budgeting, and strategic planning for the content on Twitch. The team analyzes new content investments for individual streamers, Esports, and non-gaming categories to support content deal execution. As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will forecast and track our monthly budget spend and commitments, use data analysis to increase visibility into Twitch's content investments, uphold financial discipline in our content acquisitions, and partner with teams to continuously improve the process. You will report to the Finance Senior Director of Content FP&A.
You Will:

Report monthly spending, and forecast future commitments against Content Licensing, OPEX, and Headcount budgets.
Report the profit and loss metrics for the Content portfolio.
Use multiple data sources to build aforementioned reports (e.g. NetSuite, Salesforce, Tableau, and SQL).
Report results in Monthly Business Reviews (MBRs).
Provide clear analyses on trends and causes of variances. Translate those findings into recommendations that align with Twitch's monthly, quarterly, and annual goals.
Support quarter, annual, and ad-hoc planning cycles using corporate goals, historical actual data, and future commitment data.
Build processes to report new business metrics as they arise.
Continuously improve monthly reporting process to make it faster, more accurate, and provide new information.

You Have:

Bachelor's degree in Finance, Math, Economics, or Engineering
Typically 4+ years in FP&A, finance, or accounting
Advanced Excel & Google Sheets (can maintain complex spreadsheets) modeling and data analysis skills
Familiarity with contract payment terms
Highest regard for accuracy and completeness
High degree of comfort with a P&L

Bonus Points

Experience with Tableau, NetSuite, SQL, SAP, Salesforce or other analytics tools
Experience with large numbers of charges, contracts, and accounts

Perks

Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability Insurance
401(k)
Maternity & Parental Leave
Flexible PTO
Amazon Employee Discount
Monthly Contribution & Discounts for Wellness Related Activities & Programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.)

title: Manager, Development Operations (DevOps)
job_description:
Get to know The Pok√©mon Company International
¬†
The Pok√©mon Company International, a subsidiary of The Pok√©mon Company in Japan, manages the property outside of Asia and is responsible for brand management, licensing, marketing, the Pok√©mon Trading Card Game, the animated TV series, home entertainment, and the official Pok√©mon website. Pok√©mon was launched in Japan in 1996 and today is one of the most popular children's entertainment properties in the world.
¬†
Learn more online at Pokemon.com and on Facebook (facebook.com/pokemon), YouTube (youtube.com/pokemon), Twitter (twitter.com/pokemon), and Instagram (instagram.com/pokemon).
¬†
Get to know the role

Job Title: Manager, Development Operations
Job Summary: This role will manage a team of engineers focused on designing and implementing cloud-based solutions to advance our platforms and services that are core components in delivering amazing experiences for Pok√©mon fans around the world!
FLSA Classification (US Only): Exempt
People Manager: Yes

¬†
What you‚Äôll do 

Recruit, develop, and retain staff while building a culture of collaboration, data-driven decisions, and continuous learning.
Create personalized development plans for members of your team to enable opportunities for growth and new capabilities.
Develop relationships with our peer teams to ensure alignment on priorities and effective collaboration on projects.
Partner with our technical leads to solve complicated problems, identify and reinforce technical direction, and establish clear priorities.
Lead internal projects and initiatives while providing insight into project status and roadmaps.
Support your team by handling escalations, unblocking impediments, and managing the teams sprints and backlog.
Manage your teams on-call rotation and ensure our high standards for the operability of our services is met.

¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†
What you‚Äôll bring 

Six+ (6+) years of relevant professional experience, plus one (1) year of management experience.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience required.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities, both as a leader of teams and as a leader of projects - dynamic, strategic and resourceful.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite.
Experience with AWS services.
Experience with CI/CD pipeline tools and technology such as Perforce, Bitbucket, Terraform, Docker, Chef, Jenkins, and Artifactory.
Experience working in an agile/scrum environment and the ability to lead the teams backlog grooming, planning, and retrospectives.
Thorough understanding of the DevOps concepts and culture, with a focus on leveraging software engineering tools, methodologies and concepts.
Functional knowledge and experience including but not limited to: Development practices, Information Security principles, Vendor Management, Executive Communications, and Data Analytics.

¬†
How you‚Äôll be successful

Passion for Pok√©mon: Develops an understanding of the Pok√©mon brand, the impact it has on our people, culture, business, fans, and communities, and applying that knowledge and passion to everything you do.
Challenging the Expected: Approaches challenges with curiosity and creativity, embracing the possibility of failure as an opportunity to learn something new, develop innovative ideas, solve complex problems and identify unique opportunities. ¬†
Integrity and Respect: Demonstrates integrity and respect by leading with empathy, listening to others, seeking out different perspectives, and taking personal responsibility for decisions, actions, and results.
Dedicated to Quality: Takes ownership to maintain and promote high standards, looks for new ways to learn and improve, and embraces a growth mindset to seek and apply feedback from others in an effort to continuously improve.¬†
Building Relationships: Develops and strengthens relationships, adopting a ‚Äúteam first‚Äù mentality and working collaboratively to solve problems and meet shared goals. ¬†
Delighting Customers: Listens and understands the interests and needs of our customers and stakeholders, making them feel heard and important, and embracing these learnings to continue delivering a unique Pok√©mon experience.

¬†
What to expect 

An employee first culture
Company events that celebrate the spirit of Pok√©mon
Competitive cash-based compensation programs
Base salary range: $151,000.00 - $227,000.00. This range is applicable for the labor market where the role is intended to be hired. It is common for TPCi to start employees below the midpoint of the range. Final base salary is directly related to each candidates' qualifications and experience uniquely.
100% employer-paid healthcare premiums for you
Generous paid family leave
Employer-paid life insurance
Employer-paid long and short-term income protection insurance
US Employees: 401k Employer Matching
UK/IRE Employees: Pension Employer Contributions
Fitness reimbursement
Commuter benefit
LinkedIn learning
Comprehensive relocation package
Hybrid work environment

¬†
The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this role. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required. Employees may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed. For roles in the United Kingdom, candidates will need the right to work. In some cases, and for some roles, the Company may be able to arrange a visa. For roles in Ireland, this role requires candidates to have the right to live and work in the Republic of Ireland. However, we welcome applications from all nationalities and may consider supporting an employment permit application, in appropriate and suitable cases.

What you‚Äôll do

Product Development:

Ensure timely product approvals in line with licensee needs, anticipate roadblocks, and proactively take measures to address them by working closely with Seattle-based teams.

title: Lead Technical Artist
job_description:
Welcome to Striking Distance Studios!
Driven by people. Inspired by challenges. Relentless to deliver creative excellence.
At the intersection of art, design and technology lies Striking Distance Studios. Led by Dead Space and Call of Duty franchise veteran Glen Schofield, we are a AAA development studio within the San Ramon Hills of the San Francisco Bay Area. With the release of our first title, The Callisto Protocol, we are excited to continue to grow our team.
Here at Striking Distance Studios it is amazing people, an immersive experience and a passion for excellence that drives us each day. We are looking for people who push themselves creatively and learn with every new challenge. We give you the setting and the opportunity to do work you are proud of. We‚Äôre looking for the best to come join us and become part of a world-class team.
To us excellence is not a skill, but an attitude!
About this position:
The Lead Technical Artist role is responsible for a wide range of areas from tool and workflow design and implementation, to optimization analysis, to shader authoring to visual prototyping. A Jack-of-all-trades, the Lead Technical Artist deploys a wide range of technical skills along with a strong understanding of cutting edge AAA content creation techniques in order to empower content creators to unleash their creativity without being encumbered by technological constraints.
Responsibilities:

Lead complex tool\pipeline initiatives and drive them to completion
Help define and communicate budgets and audit game\content performance
Advise content teams to ensure that assets are authored correctly
Mentor and develop Jr. team members
Design and implement internal and external pipelines requiring multi-discipline collaboration.
Collaborate with artists and engineers to design and create new art workflows and tools
Support artists and troubleshoot pipeline issues as they arise

¬†
Qualifications:

5+ years in game development
Shipped at least one game with Unreal or demonstrated expert knowledge in TA or similar role
Shipped one game in a PBR art pipeline in TA or similar role
Strong knowledge of AAA 3D art production
Strong knowledge of Maya, Substance, Photoshop
Experience developing artist tools in DCC applications (Max, Maya, UE)
Strong knowledge of shader creation via node graph, HLSL or GLSL
Intermediate skill with Python, C# or C++
Familiarity with game performance evaluation tools
Excellent collaboration and communication skills
Strong problem solving and trouble-shooting skills
Experience with Houdini a plus
Experience leading a team a plus

In California, the standard base pay range for this role is $170,000-$200,000 annually. This base pay range is for California and is not applicable to locations outside of CA. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.¬†
Due to recent scams, our recruiters will only reach out to you via @sds.com, @krafton.com or @pubg.com. If you received an email and are unsure you can always email recruiting@sds.com

title: Audio Director
job_description:
Welcome to Striking Distance Studios! 
Driven by people. Inspired by challenges. Relentless to deliver creative excellence.

Led by Dead Space and Call of Duty franchise veteran Glen Schofield, we are a AAA development studio within the San Ramon Hills of the San Francisco Bay Area. Responsibilities:

Collaborate with product leaders to identify and set audio objectives, goals, and timelines.
Develop and execute product audio vision and strategy, ensuring the delivery of all content for sound designers.
Establish and communicate audio goals including how they align with product goals to direct reports, product leadership and others.
Advocate for the audio discipline ensuring discipline and direct reports have all the necessary resources required to achieve the product goals.
Manage a team of sound designers for performance and growth
Run weekly work-in-progress reviews, audio playtests, feedback sessions and more to promote feedback towards achieving the quality bar.
Record, edit, and design sound effects, features, systems, and other areas using industry standard methods and tools.

Creation of documention for audio pipeline and mix
Ownership of final mixing of game audio
Ability to partner with Audio lead and Audio Engineering to map out tools/ process/ pipeline
Management of external audio vendors
Close partnership with production for tasking and management of scheduling

Qualifications:

A minimum of 7 years‚Äô experience as game sound director
Minimum 2 Shipped Titles With Unreal Engine
Drive for results and create a team toward execution and player value delivery.
People management, mentorship and leadership skills.
Expertise in the holistic game audio process (Sound Design, Voice Over, Music Implementation, Technology, Player Experience, etc.).
Expertise In Mixing Game Audio In 7.1 Surround And Dolby Atmos
Expertise In Pro Tools
Knowledge of sound design creation tools (Nuendo, Reaper, Izotope, Waves, Native Instruments, etc) & techniques.
Knowledge of voice over processing tools and techniques and sound design, voice over and music implementation methods.
Knowledge of audio middleware (Wwise, Fmod, Miles, etc.).
Knowledge of programming or scripting languages (Lua, Python, etc.) and engine platform (Git. Unity, etc.)
Knowledge of technical sound design integration within Unreal Engine

title: Senior Producer
job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Producer to help shape our teams existing standard of excellence. Working alongside the Heads and Directors of each department, you will help in managing the game‚Äôs product development cycle including scope, budget, pre-production, production, approval, and QA.
What the role involves:

Collaborate with the Core Team to build a high-functioning team.
Build excellent relationships of trust with the project‚Äôs development team and external stakeholders.
Define some of the project‚Äôs milestones and reporting dashboard. Monitor related KPIs
Facilitate team communication, ensure timely dissemination of information to team and company overall.
Promote, contribute to, and participate in a culture of diversity, equity and inclusion.
Create roadmaps and schedules that provide the team with clear visibility and line-of-sight on achieving future project milestones.
Manage time efficiently by task prioritization, resource coordination, risk assessment and proactive problem solving.
In collaboration with Directors, validate that the deliverables reach the expected level of quality in terms of execution.
Celebrate the successes of others and maintaining high team morale.

¬†
Qualifications:

Experience shipping AAA games in a producer role.
Experience working on a full game development lifecycle (from pre-production to release).
Excellent understanding of art, design, and engineering pipelines.
Excellent leadership and communication skills (spoken and written) and experience working in an international environment.
Previous experience building, tracking, and maintaining complex roadmaps and schedules.
Good knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Familiar with Agile and other project management methodologies.

¬†
Good to have:

Hands-on development experience in any development area ‚Äì art, design, engineering, etc‚Ä¶
Understanding of the open-world AAA game genre.

¬†
About us:¬†
Aiming to create best-in-class experiences that last forever in players' memories, a team of Game Industry veterans is building a new AAA Open World game studio in Barcelona, backed by a quality-first market-leading publisher and developer. If you are an experienced team player who loves game creation, values autonomy within a multi-national team, and would welcome the challenge of building new IPs and career-defining games - get in touch!¬†
Your life at Smilegate Barcelona (and perks)

Ticket Restaurant: approx. 180 ‚Ç¨ per month (2.160‚Ç¨/year).
23 vacation days per year + Winter Break (24/12-02/01)
Private Health insurance, including dental coverage.
Hybrid Work with Flexible Working Hours & Flexible Friday.
Develop your career working on a super exciting project with a talented team
Fully stocked studio kitchen (Nescafe coffee, organic fruits, snacks, and beverages).
Incredible office in Barcelona in the heart of 22@ (games room, shower, auditorium, canteen, gym, etc.) 15 min to the beach and 1 min to Glories Mall.
Team Building Events.
Cafeteria Plan Year allowance for Wellness and IT Equipment.

We value diversity and as an equal opportunity employer we encourage applications from all suitable applicants. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Content Policy Coordinator
job_description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.
A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Rockstar Games is seeking a passionate Content Policy Coordinator to join our team. We are looking for an individual that has a keen eye for detail to assist with deep dive research into people, locations and events, and organizing Rockstar‚Äôs digital assets. This is a full-time position based out of Rockstar's unique NYC studio in Noho, Manhattan.
WHAT WE DO

The Rockstar Content Policy team helps manage in-game content by collecting and organizing background information to review questions about the content in our games.
We handle research requests, partnering with stakeholders to ensure alignment with the company vision and content policy to enhance the Rockstar Games experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Assist the Content Policy Director with tasks involved with the content policy review process.
Update tracking systems used for content policy review.
Assist the Director with some research and communication with departments internally.
Support the scoping, prioritizing and execution of various projects.
Help maintain content policies and processes.
Schedule and attend meetings for content policy review.
Assist in flagging issues and prioritizing work.

QUALIFICATIONS

Interest and passion to learn about content policy.
Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
Fluent mastery of the English language.
Love and deep knowledge of Rockstar‚Äôs games titles.
Information stewardship, technology skills, creative & organizational skills.

SKILLS

Extremely organized and with strong project management / tracking skills.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Can work under pressure and tight deadlines.
Ability to work independently and track/report progress to supervisor.
Ability to prioritize in a fast-paced setting.
Detail oriented ‚Äì proven eye for detail.

PLUSES
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

Education/background in psychology, theology, law, religion, public relations, history.
Agile and flexible, able to deliver exceptional results amid changing business conditions.
Academic degree or training in philosophy and / or ethics.

HOW TO APPLY

title: Lighting Tools Programmer (Mid / Senior)
job_description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.
A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Rockstar is on the lookout for a talented Lighting Tools Programmers who possesses a passion for Tools development and improving workflows, specifically in the field of in engine lighting systems.

We adapt the game engine into an editor for artists, designers and other content creators to work within.
We build desktop applications and service infrastructure to create workflows that span from modelling and animation packages through to the game engine.

Excellent communication and teamwork skills.

title: Compliance QA Tester - Sony (Night Shift)
job_description:
At Rockstar Games, we create the games we would want to play ourselves.
A career at Rockstar is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding, large-scale projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a friendly, inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Rockstar Lincoln is on the lookout for a talented PlayStation compliance tester who possesses a passion for compliance and the video game industry. This is a full-time permanent position based onsite at Rockstar‚Äôs unique game studio in Lincoln, UK.
WHAT WE DO

Testing various genres of games, learning and analysing all elements of the title‚Äôs functionality ‚Äì including gameplay, UI, hardware interaction and messaging.
Checking title functionality against various manufacturer-specified guidelines, finding and reporting scenarios where these guidelines are not closely adhered to.
Working closely with the development and production teams in identifying and prioritising issues for progression through the project life cycle

RESPONSIBILITIES

Checking title functionality against compliance test cases and - where required - performing focused sweeps, ensuring platform technical requirements are adhered to and raising issues where they are not.
Finding and reproducing errors or problems in game.
Accurate, detailed and complete reporting and subsequent revision of those errors or problems.
Understand and facilitate correct and relevant movement of information, including escalating serious issues and passing requests to leads for external communication / action.
Provide guidance and support on compliance requirements to other areas and teams as needed.
Keeping up to date with the latest compliance documentation for your assigned platform(s) and applying this knowledge to your tests.
Stay abreast of communications and fix progression on important compliance issues on the assigned platform(s).
Provide assistance and support on compliance issues for other assigned platforms as needed.

QUALIFICATIONS

6 months experience in PlayStation compliance testing.
Strong knowledge and interpretation of compliance documentation and technical requirements, applying this accurately and consistently throughout all tasks and checks.
A full and complete understanding of the native systems and features of one or more PlayStation platforms, such as PlayStation 4/5.

SKILLS

The ability to work well under pressure and to strict deadlines.
Self-motivation and a proactive attitude.
The ability to absorb, retain and apply important technical knowledge.
Excellent attention to detail.
The ability to multitask, including setting up and operation of multiple consoles / workstations.
Able to work effectively, both individually and as part of a team.
Good observation, alertness to knock-on scenarios and an ability to think "outside the box".

PLUSES
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

Experience with compliance testing on more than one platform.
Degree level educated.
Comfortable delivering workshops, presentations and training.
Experience with a variety of database software.
Knowledge of and experience with Microsoft Office suite.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

This role is for a position on Night Shift (6:30 pm ‚Äì 3:00 am).
