title: On-Set Continuity Operator
job_description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.
A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Rockstar Games is currently looking for an On-Set Continuity Operator to join the Production Department and support our Performance Capture team. The Continuity Operator provides quality assurance and production support across all of our projects.¬†
WHAT WE DO

The Performance Capture team at Rockstar is responsible for storyboarding, directing, and capturing all live actor data for use in Cinematics and in-game animations.
As a global Performance Capture team at Rockstar, we collaborate with animators, directors, and artists from around the world, working to the highest standards to produce the substantial range of character animations required for our ground-breaking AAA games.
We work with cutting-edge technology to both inform and capture our actors‚Äô movement, facial and audio data to create photo realistic content in our games.
We fabricate sets, customize hardware, create props, and utilize every tool possible to achieve the highest standards for our shoots.
We capture the core data that serves as the backbone for story and in-game character animations across all of Rockstar‚Äôs titles.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Maintain complex tracking databases of various production categories and supporting documentation.
Responsible for mocap data collection and entry into our proprietary database on all motion capture shoots.
Maintain, organize and distribute scripts to animators, producers and performers as needed.
Check scripts line by line for style, continuity and clarity.
Support producers during voiceover recording processes as needed.
Act as an administrator who works with animators, producers and directors throughout the production process.

QUALIFICATIONS

Must be well organized, and have excellent communication and administrative skills.
Keen eye for detail and be able to meticulously track shot details with a low margin of error.
Strong technical, creative, and editorial skills.
Ability to work fast while still being ultraprecise and rigorous about quality control.
Self-starter who is comfortable working both very independently and very collaboratively.
Must be someone who is passionate, conscientious, calm under pressure, and works with fastidious care.
Understanding that the entertainment industry is not a 9-5 job. Recordings and on-set shoots run late and can include weekends.
Very strong proficiency in MS Excel and Word required. Must be able to edit simple formulas in a spreadsheet.

PLUSES
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

Familiarity with video games and production.

Rockstar is on the lookout for a talented Software Engineering Support candidate to join our Social Club team. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar‚Äôs unique game development studio in the heart of Edinburgh.¬†
WHAT WE DO

The Rockstar Games Social Club is a technology platform that powers Rockstar‚Äôs online titles and our ability to deliver world-class player experiences.
We create and maintain high-impact features for Grand Theft Auto Online, Red Dead Online, the Rockstar Games Launcher, and the Social Club website, as well as the core Social Club player accounts ecosystem, and related social and messaging channels.
We also align technology and tools with our digital distribution platform to create solutions that enhance our games and empower various teams within Rockstar ‚Äì including development, marketing, security, and customer support ‚Äì to engage with our players.

The Social Club Software Engineering team comprises Full Stack, Front End, Web Services, Build & Release and Test Automation Engineers. Successful candidates for this role will be embedded within a software engineering Scrum team, supporting a diverse range of needs. Responsibilities may include:

Understand, troubleshoot, reproduce reported issues, and escalate priority issues appropriately within your team.
Create and refine test plans for team deliverables, which may include a wide range of online services, applications, and game features.
Test and provide feedback on your team's deliverables early in the development cycle.
Utilize test automation frameworks.
Write accurate and descriptive bug reports with clear reproduction steps.
Triage and report on issues arising from monitoring systems. Work with teams and departments to provide and verify a resolution.

A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. Rockstar Games is on the lookout for talented Build and Release Engineer to join our online services PC development team in Leeds. Come join a passionate and dedicated team of individuals focused on growing our online platform and providing industry-leading game experiences to our players.
The Rockstar Games Social Club is a technology platform that powers Rockstar‚Äôs online titles and our ability to deliver world-class player experiences. On PC, the gateway to these titles is the Rockstar Games Launcher.
WHAT WE DO

title: Vehicle Artist (All Levels)
job_description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.
A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. You would be welcomed to a dedicated and inclusive environment where you can learn, and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.
Rockstar India is on the lookout for talented Senior, Mid-level and Associate Vehicle Artists who have a passion for creating an incredible and varied range of vehicle artwork. This is a full-time permanent position based out of Rockstar‚Äôs unique game development studio in Bangalore.
WHAT WE DO

The Vehicle Art team design, build and texture all modes of transport within our game worlds. If you can drive, ride, sail or fly in it, we will have created it.
Our vehicles are not just modes of transport but an extension of a player‚Äôs personality and desires, their tastes and aesthetics ‚Äì not only customizable and configurable, but with an inherent history for both the type of vehicle and the game-world brand it represents. From brand-new to worn and weathered, we want each vehicle to be a ‚Äòcharacter‚Äô in its own right.
We research in-depth and maintain understanding of all modes of transport ‚Äì how they function and are constructed, and the cultural attachment people and the world at large have to them.
We work with other internal departments in design, code and animation to make sure our vehicles work functionally with their expectations and needs.
We work alongside other art departments to ensure our assets hit the highest visual standards and remain consistent with the entire game world visuals.

RESPONSIBILITIES

You will work in a specialised vehicle department within a larger team that is very passionate about making industry leading games.
We value individual design skills; including concept and creation of assets that are not carbon copies of existing vehicles - but still retain an essence and design feel of their specific real-world references and associated individual styling cues.
You will gather research, design and model vehicle artwork in 3D, and follow our proven workflows to create functional parts both interior and exterior for them.
You will work to create textures and shaders to faithfully describe accurate real-world material types, representing paint finishes, metals, wood, fabric and hides.
Work with our engine tools to export and test your assets to the game, where you will test and maintain both the individual quality control and expected function of the asset.

QUALIFICATIONS

A comprehensive modelling and texturing portfolio showing a varied range of 3D vehicle art completed to a very high standard is required to apply.

SKILLS

Extensive experience using 3DStudio Max for modelling, and Adobe Photoshop for texturing.
A full understanding of all current generation production workflows, as they pertain to vehicle art asset production.
A keen understanding and appreciation of structure and construction/silhouette in respect of modelling ‚Äì resolution of assets relative to world scale and exceptional mesh topology skills.
A detail obsessed eye for creating and manipulating texture maps for shader passes¬†- diffuse, normal, spec, weathering etc. - and excellent understanding of the value of maximising UV space.
A critical awareness of the expense/cost of a game asset relative to the target engine/rendering requirements ‚Äì poly counts and texture sizes.
A great team-player: Self-motivated with good communication skills.
Able to accurately follow common goals and time-driven set tasks whilst working under own initiative. Effective time management skills to deliver the brief to deadlines without sacrificing quality.
Skilled at feeding back on task progress to Leads and line managers.
Ability to collaborate effectively with other team disciplines (code, design, animation, tools).

PLUSES
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

One or more years relevant development experience in-studio or in vehicle modding scene.
Have shipped current generation console titles as a vehicle artist.
Knowledge and understanding of a PBR based shader workflow.
Experience with Quixel software suite or similar for shader development.
Strong traditional art foundations: including but not limited to observational drawing, photography and technical illustration.
Willingness to test and practically use new workflow tools, both internal and 3rd party.
Strive to implement new techniques that increase art quality and efficiency across disciplines.
Deep understanding and love of car culture.

title: Senior Data Scientist, Game Security
job_description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.
A career at Rockstar Games is about being part of a team working on some of the most creatively rewarding and ambitious projects to be found in any entertainment medium. RESPONSIBILITIES

Design, develop and deliver machine learning enabled solutions to address critical business questions.
Conduct proactive in-depth analysis and predictive modeling to uncover hidden opportunities.
Identify key metrics and KPIs that have a high impact on the Security team‚Äôs operations.
Identify, help design, and help collect data with direct impact on the team‚Äôs operations and business goals.
Partner with data analysts, data engineers, data scientists, and stakeholders to better understand requirements, finding bottlenecks, resolutions.
Collaborates with the Analytics Tech lead to establish best practices for repeated application.
Help mentor and develop the skillsets of the junior team members within your team or department.
Work within a team of data analysts and engineers.

QUALIFICATIONS

7+ years in data science or similar role in the forensics, technology, or marketing fields required.
5+ years of experience in machine learning/ statistical languages and systems such as Python, Matlab, R.
Passion for Rockstar Games and our titles.

SKILLS

Extensive knowledge of machine learning techniques such as k-NN, Naive Bayes, SVM, Decision Forests, Data Mining, Clustering, and Classification.
Experience in pushing models to production and iterating on models in production.
Proficiency in statistics such as distributions, predictive modeling, data validation, statistical testing, regression.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field, with a strong quantitative background.
Ability to develop and maintain good relations and communicate with people at all hierarchical levels.
Strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to reconcile technical and business perspectives.
Autonomy and entrepreneurship.
Strong team spirit.

PLUSES
Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

4+ years using SQL (or a SQL-like language) required, other programming experience highly preferred.
Experience with Hadoop and pySpark an asset.
Graduate degree (MBA, MSc or Master‚Äôs, PHD), an asset.
Game industry experience strongly desired.

title: Full-Stack Developer
job_description:
Who we are¬†
The metaverse is not a single app. It's a network of millions of virtual worlds people visit to play games, socialize and collaborate. Today, most of those worlds are closed and disconnected walled gardens. Ready Player Me is a cross-game avatar platform for the builders, creators and residents of the metaverse. We're on a mission to break down the virtual walls to build a more open and connected metaverse.
For developers, we offer a plug-and-play avatar system they can integrate into their games and virtual worlds in days. For metaverse residents, we're a portable virtual identity they can use across thousands of virtual worlds.
We started 2021 with 24 companies using our avatar system, by now it's more than 5000. We've created avatars for more than 5 million people since launching Ready Player Me.
Present and future
We are backed by top investors like¬†Andreessen Horowitz (a16z), Plural, David Baszucki, co-founder of Roblox, Justin Kan, co-founder of Twitch, Sebastian Knutsson & Riccardo Zacconi, King Games co-founders, Konvoy Ventures, Endeavor and Samsung Next among many others.
Our team has built avatar systems for companies like Tencent, Huawei, HTC, and Verizon since 2014. We are working with well-known brands like Warner Bros, Dior, New Balance, and RTFKT. We‚Äôre adding partner brands all the time!
By joining us, you‚Äôll become a part of the most experienced avatar team in the world. We‚Äôve built industry-leading avatar systems since 2014 and we‚Äôre only getting started. Come join us on our journey and play a key role in building an open and interoperable Metaverse!
About you:¬†
We are looking for a passionate and skilled¬†Full-Stack Developer¬†to join our growing team! You will work with the development teams to improve and set measurable objectives for high service availability, code quality, security, and observability. Through automation you will enhance development processes.
Your daily adventures will include:

Working alongside designers and engineers to build the frontend and backend functionalities of Ready Player Me.
Delivering well designed, test covered features and new products.
Executing maintenance of existing codebases and building/ maintaining infrastructure.
Building performant REST APIs powering 3D avatar and content creation and monetisation for game and virtual experience developers.

What you bring:

3+ years of experience working with JavaScript, TypeScript, React, or similar technologies.
Experience working with databases (MongoDB, relational databases).
Experience building RESTful APIs.
Experience in using SOLID Principles and Design Patterns in programming.
Product-mindedness and¬†a sense of design, what feels and looks good, and are excited about building delightful user experiences.

As a bonus, it would be awesome if you:

Have experience with 3D rendering ‚Äì Three.js or other web-based 3D engines and have worked with BE frameworks (preferably with Nest.js and Express.js).
Have experience with containerization tools.
Have worked with microservices.
Have experience with testing (unit/ functional/ integration/ e2e).
Worked in a Startup or Scaleup before.
Love to play games.

Why you‚Äôll love it here:
üåè Work as a remote-first team anywhere in the world or in our Tallinn or Berlin hubs. We currently already have people in 16 countries.
üìö Personal development - exciting challenges mean a big impact. To reach the next level, we offer a personal learning budget.
üí§ Unlimited days off - we work hard, but it‚Äôs important for us to make sure people take time out to recharge.
üèñÔ∏è Holiday budget - we need your energy, so make the most of it!
‚úàÔ∏è Biannual company retreats and team gatherings in our hubs; our Summer Days are legendary.
üïü Flexible working hours - Results are more important than hours on the clock: we trust you to maintain your work-life balance.
üìà Competitive salary with equity options
What‚Äôs life like at Ready Player Me?
At Ready Player Me, expect to make an impact and be a part of an ambitious, passionate, collaborative and caring team. We're here to do the best work of our lives, and build a world, both here and in the Metaverse, that we can be proud of. Our eNPS is 82! Our focus is on working together to build outstanding experiences for our users, at the forefront of change and innovation, as the Metaverse expands. We are a trusted partner, and we continuously strive to learn together. We always seek to be smarter tomorrow than we are today. Also check out our values.
Didn't find what you're looking for? Write us careers@wolf3d.io

title: Senior Technical Environment Artist
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Senior Technical Environment Artist
Remote, Canada
PlayStation Studios Visual Arts provides the highest quality artistic support to first-party Sony game teams as well as other teams developing titles for the PS5. We offer dozens of services including asset scanning, actor scanning, body motion capture, facial motion capture, motion edit, animation, facial tracking and solving, and lighting. As a service group we have the privilege of working with multiple game developers on a variety of titles. The Technical Art team works directly with clients to replicate and maintain their work environments in the studio and guarantee the quality of the final delivery.
We are looking for a Senior Technical Environment Artist to join our San Diego, California development team. The role requires experience and understanding of visual effects pipelines, experience with Autodesk Maya software, and python programming skills. Technical artists at PSVA are responsible for setting up and maintaining the technical pipeline on all projects, writing tools for artists for a variety of software packages and needs, troubleshooting all technical issues that arise, and ensuring the quality of the final product. Technical artist work with both our art teams and our engineering team and help provide communication and cohesion between these two groups.
Responsibilities:

Understanding and maintaining project workflows, primarily Maya art and animation, and game engine integration pipelines.
Learning and supporting varying client working environments, assets, and tools.
Writing, maintaining, and customizing internal tools for production team.
Troubleshooting problems in pipeline and for individuals on as-needed basis.
Creating and maintaining technical documentation.
Share work for feedback and offer productive opinions while assisting all team members.
Keep communication steady with other leads on the project to provide consistency
Lead by example and communicate with supervisors, management and overall teams.
Audit game performance by analyzing GPU CPU and Memory metrics per frame-time goals

Desired Experience:

BS degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Graphic Art, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
At least 8+ years in some branch of visual effects (film, game dev, tv, etc.).
1+ year in a leadership role.
Strong leadership, mentoring and teaching abilities.
Excellent knowledge of Maya and Python and experience developing python tools for Maya.
Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to problem solve creatively.
PyQt/PySide experience.
Ability to work in a team and communicate well.
Ability to mentor junior technical artists.
Experience with game proprietary engines, or off the shelf engines such as Unreal, or Unity.
Experience with environment art modeling and a strong understanding of topology
Strong understanding of PBR material response using BRDF shading model
Experience with material application process and UV mapping for consistent texel density
Experience with runtime and baked lighting pipelines
Experience navigating complex scene hierarchy and ability to identify locations of assets based on file paths and nested inheritance

Nice to Have:

General knowledge of Maya rigging.
Experience with other programming languages, especially C++.
Experience developing or maintaining system environments.
Experiencing developing or maintaining project pipeline tools.
Experience with perforce and/or git.
Experience with project management and tracking software (such as Shotgun and Jira).
Experience working with real-time particle systems, water rendering, and post processing.
Knowledge of Houdini pipelines and their integration with other applications via Houdini Engine
Experience with real-time dynamics and physics driven by Havok or similar physics engines
Experience with Linux based operating systems

Mastery of standard art packages such as Maya, Photoshop, Zbrush and Substance Designer.
Strong understanding of scale, proportion, human anatomy and surface properties.
Good communication, organizational, time management and interpersonal skills
Possess strong time management and prioritization skills.
Experience working with a game engine and implementing 3D work into engine.

Experience working on AAA titles as a character artist
Marvelous Design,ari, Agisoft, Substance, Mudbox

job_description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation Studios Visual Arts and PlayStation Studios Malaysia are both passionate teams within the PlayStation family, made up of game and film industry professionals from all over the world.
Always at the cutting edge of technology, the teams work with studios like Naughty Dog, Insomniac, Santa Monica Studios, Guerrilla Games, Bend Studios, SuckerPunch, San Diego Studio, Japan Studios, and more PlayStation first-party teams, providing world-class content development and services to these studios.¬†
Currently working on PlayStation‚Äôs well-known and well-loved franchises, our Animation team in PlayStation Studios Malaysia is looking for talented, highly-motivated and creative Senior Animators to breathe life into the next chapter of in-game and cinematic storytelling.
Why work when you can play? This is life at PlayStation!
Responsibilities:

Comprehend and execute direction from Animation Manager/ Supervisor.
Establish quality standards by creating compelling character performances, utilizing motion capture and keyframe animation technics.
¬†Help to maintain the quality standards by establishing guidelines and documenting requirements for the look and quality bar of the animation.
Coach/ Mentor junior members in the animator team in maintaining/ exceeding the required level of productivity for creation of computer-generated in-game/ cinematic animation, which may include the following: -

Creating game animation elements and implementing them in a game engine.
Work within the toolset and workflow for keyframe and/or motion capture production.
Create in-game and pre-rendered animation according to the direction of the client and project.
Create body and facial animation for human characters, along with animation for creatures, vehicles, props, and other assets to be integrated into in-game engines and/or cinematic sequences.

Communicate updates and creative goals while also offering up potential, effective solutions to challenges.
Understand, interpret and adopt feedback from supervisors and/ or clients alike to improve production outcome/ performance.
Balance high expectations of production outcome/ performance with production schedules and milestone requirements.
Collaborate with the technical art and engineering team to help establish, iterate, and refine the animation tools, pipeline and systems requirements.
Work closely with the Design and Production teams to plan, prioritize, and assign tasks to animation team members.
Contribute to a creative, collaborative and fun working atmosphere amongst the team.

Requirements:

Expert and hands-on knowledge of Maya for animation, both aesthetically and technically.
Deep understanding of character animation and movements, both aesthetically and realistically.
Keen understanding of animation production pipelines for character animation, motion capture animation, and technical animation.
Ability to create high quality, story-driven performance animation.
Ability to communicate effectively and articulate eloquently, especially in offering productive opinions while evaluating the work of junior members in the team.
A strong team member, able to collaborate with a wide range of peers, leads, supervisors, producers, and management in an open working environment.
Flexible in taking changes in direction while working within the defined procedures.

Pluses:

Understanding of MotionBuilder.
Strong pre-production skills including, but not limited to, thumbnailing, storyboarding, and animatics.

title: Game Data Analyst
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.
Department overview:
In Game Analytics, we work with some of the best game studios in the world -- responsible for developing some of the most recognisable and ambitious console games and franchises on PlayStation, including Uncharted, The Last of Us, Horizon, God of War, and Gran Turismo.We provide end-to-end analytics services for PlayStation Studios and use data to help them make their amazing games even better. We seek dedicated people to join us in pushing the boundaries of game analytics for PlayStation.¬†
What you‚Äôll be doing:
Working in our cross-disciplinary team to help game studios use data efficiently to improve games. You‚Äôll work with decision-makers to understand their goals, find opportunities, and guide decisions about features and games across the company. Join us, and help define and build the future of analytics for PlayStation games.
What we are looking for:

Adept at working with people and customer behaviour data to make decisions and improve products.
Fluent in SQL on analytics data warehouses ‚Äì We use Redshift, but experience with similar ones like Vertica, Netezza, or Postgres are fine.
A validated background in Looker or a similar analytics visualisation tool like Tableau or MicroStrategy.
You can apply data-backed analyses to produce insights that help improve game design.
Superb communication and can get your point across to game designers, producers, programmers, and executives.
A strong interest in a variety of new console games.
Strategic and business-savvy. You know that people don‚Äôt always know what they want, or ask for the right. things. You can help them resolve they need, and then make it happen.
A pro with statistics, probability, and quantitative analysis methods.
You‚Äôre committed to quality as a top priority.
Experience within AAA games.¬†
A track record of trying and learning new things.
Bonus points for experience in Python, iPython notebooks, R, or machine learning.

Benefits: 

Discretionary bonus opportunity
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
25 days holiday per year
On Site Gym
Subsidised Caf√©
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage

title: Senior Technical Shader Artist
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.


***This position has the flexibility to be fully remote***
Senior Technical Shader Artist

Sony Bend Studio, renowned creator of Days Gone, Uncharted: Golden Abyss, and Syphon Filter, is seeking outstanding talent to join our passionate and creative family in crafting our next high-profile AAA console title.
We are seeking a Senior Shader Artist who will contribute to the artistic vision and development of a AAA product with a specialized focus on creating photo real physically based shaders utilizing a combination of traditional fine art and technical art skills.¬†
Responsibilities:

Conceptualize and create a plan for building texture sets based on written design descriptions and concept art.¬† Responsible for combining disparate visual elements into a visually unified whole, across terrain, vistas, prop, architecture, and character shading.


Contribute to the development of the artistic techniques and processes utilized to define and achieve a product‚Äôs visual style and encourage artistic evolution within the studio.¬† This entails expanding methods to improve the production pipelines, tools, processes, and visual fidelity.
Independently undertakes research and information gathering prior to the commencement of a new task to ensure game design needs, reference materials, artistic direction, and technological considerations are effectively managed to meet the defined goals.
Actively advances skill set, abilities and then shares this knowledge by keeping aware of industry trends and techniques, evaluating competitive products, learning new software packages and traditional art methods.
Possess strong time management and prioritization skills.¬† This entails collaborating with the production group to manage responsibilities to ensure set goals will be met from a scope, schedule, and artistic perspective.
Push the envelope of what is possible within real time technical limitations.
Participation in creating shaders and shading validation tools as well as defining artistic and technical shading standards.
Research and develop innovative approaches to technical and creative challenges.

Requirements/Education:

Expert knowledge of physically based shading pipelines.
Preferred Experience with Unreal 4 or Unity and their respective shading pipelines.
Expert knowledge of UV tools and techniques.
Proficiency in creation of high-quality textures that match the artistic style of the defined art direction.
Proficiency in the use of 3D modeling software to texture models within the defined specs and guidelines.¬†
Strong reading and comprehension skills to have a complete understanding of complex process documents, design documents, and written assignments.¬† The ability to communicate complex processes effectively either individually with team members, or within group settings.¬† The ability to write short reports and process documents when needed in a clear and concise manner.
Strong time management skills, with the ability to break down tasks and assignments and prioritize them into workable pieces on a daily, weekly, and project length basis.¬† Works independently and conscientiously with minimal supervision.¬† Able to manage long-term projects, creating and following a comprehensive schedule for the creation of complex assets for game levels, and other game related assets.¬† Able to complete tasks and assignments quickly with limited need for revision rework.
Strong data management skills, with the ability to manage and track large amounts of data as they go through the art pipeline with attention to naming conventions, directory structures, and other processes.
Able to train, tutor, and mentor multiple artists, help assess their needs for growth and learning, able to document, report, and help review their work when needed.
Extensive portfolio with examples of current hands-on work, including shaders, textures, and texture mapped assets as well as fully rendered scenes.
2+ years of experience as a Shader/Materials Artist in the video game industry
One or two years of post-high school education or training

How would you like to influence the most successful gaming platform of all time, by testing and analyzing the very technology our PlayStation developers use to build our best selling games?
Sony Interactive Entertainment has an extraordinary opportunity in the R&D department! We are looking for a motivated and creative individual to help build tools and infrastructure for analyzing the quality of PlayStation¬Æ CPU compilers (and related technology).
As a Software Engineer in Test, you will directly contribute to PlayStation technology by ensuring that the tools required to build all of PlayStation's games are at the highest possible quality. This is also a learning opportunity to develop a keen understanding of compilers, and to engage with the larger LLVM community on patch submissions, code reviews, and design discussions. If this interests you, please apply!
Responsibilities: 

Crafting and improving the testing tools and frameworks used for ensuring high quality LLVM-based C/C++ compilers. You will be adding to and improving a Python-based test infrastructure and general ecosystem.
Supervising the state of our test infrastructure - including automated build and regression test results, and reporting problems.
Analyzing reported issues ‚Äì including issues reported from PlayStation licensees (typically PlayStation¬Æ5 game developers). This involves writing test-cases or test applications (written in C and C++) to verify the reporter‚Äôs original issue, and confirm proposed software fixes. Analyzing these issues may involve analyzing low-level CPU code generation, and debugging behavior.
Writing sample applications and/or scripts demonstrating the results from novel and groundbreaking CPU compiler / LLVM research (as targeted to gaming consoles, or for improving game developers‚Äô development experience).
Developing techniques for runtime benchmarking of real-time code.
Analyzing low-level runtime performance data captured from a game or application running on PlayStation¬Æ hardware, and writing succinct, understandable summaries of performance numbers and behavior observed (so team members understand performance trade-offs).
Researching new tools for building and analyzing PlayStation¬Æ software.

Tools and Technology used in this position include 

Visual Studio.
PlayStation¬Æ software development kits (SDKs).
Software automation and continuous integration tools such as Jenkins.
Source control (e.g. Git) for all systems, including Jenkins Groovy scripts (pipeline as code).
Python tools written using Python 3 features such as type hinting.
Software repositories such as Artifactory.
Containerization technology such as Docker and Kubernetes.
Distributed build systems such as SN-DBS.

Qualifications 

Proficient in Python programming. (Multiple academic or industry projects completed, 2+ years programming experience.)
2+ years of experience programming in C++; modern C++ experience (e.g. C++17).
Experience building, running, and debugging software in both Windows and Linux environments.
Desire to learn all about compilers and their associated toolchains.
Having a passion for automation with the ability to discuss the pros and cons of various automation approaches.

Nice-to-Have 

Experience with LLVM technology is a strong plus.
Prior experience with PlayStation¬Æ SDK development is helpful.
Writing unit and integration tests.
Groovy script coding experience (for Jenkins pipelines).
Knowledge of fuzz testing is a plus.
Windows container experience is another strong plus.
Familiarity with Unreal Engine or other game engine technology.
Familiarity with PlayStation products and games.

title: Senior DevOps Engineer (SAP Cloud Commerce)
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

Department overview:
PlayStation Direct is THE online store where PlayStation fans can purchase consoles, accessories, games and more, directly from PlayStation. Be part of the team driving rapid growth and solve the engineering and operational challenges of being a global eCommerce leader.
Team overview:
PlayStation Direct Engineering/Operation‚Äôs mission is to operate an always on and highly available e-commerce experience to be the best place to buy PlayStation products. Some of what we are responsible include the following:

Keeping our customers happy by evolving the application stack to improve high levels of operational availability. Achieve uninterrupted 247365 operations.
Enable our engineering teams by supplementing technical development and bug fixes, delivering an automated CI/CD pipeline, and embedding within SCRUM teams to ensure operational readiness is not an afterthought by injecting solutions for observability, releasability, maintainability, resiliency, and others.
Partner with our business teams to plan and drive high volume events such as PS5 console sales. Get the products into the hands of our customers while protecting against bots, scalpers, and other bad actors.

Role description:
You'll have a broad array of responsibilities that cut across both development and operations.
What you'll be doing:

Senior DevOps engineer, SAP Commerce Cloud will play a vital role in the development, design, testing, deployment, and operation of PlayStation Direct global ecommerce store.
Share new concepts, strategies or innovative approaches to development execution that will have significant impact on the project
Employ strong coding standards for efficiency, readability, and reuse of code
Key DevOps responsibilities
Conduct storefront operations with multi-functional team members conducting pre-order, sales, and other eCommerce events.
Build out and maintain a CI/CD pipeline with a mentality of automation from development out to production
Enable software developers ready their services and applications for production by focusing reliability, resiliency, scalability, observability, and security.
Provide rotational on-call support where you‚Äôll respond, investigate, and resolve production incidents.
Conduct, document, and present root cause analysis documents to share insights with the broader organization.
Identify areas for process automation and develop automated scripts and tools for regular operational activities.

What we‚Äôre looking for:
The ideal candidate will primary have SAP development experience. Having both AEM development and DevOps experience will be a differentiator.

Bachelor‚Äôs or master's degree in computer science or related technical field.
A minimum of five years of SAP Hybris related experience leading and delivering full life cycle implementations
Strong experience with API integration with other SAP products (e.g., CPI and S4) and payment processors
Over five years of experience developing business critical software using Enterprise Java/J2EE, Web Services, REST, JSON/XML, Servlet containers, JAXRS, Spring, and related technologies.
Experience with project automation technologies like: Jenkins, Automated unit testing, Maven, SonarQube, Jira and GitHub
Proven understanding of web technologies like Tomcat, Apache http, Content delivery networks (CDN, Akamai)
Identify and resolve performance and scalability issues
Working in Agile development practices and scrum model
Flexibility to work with geographically complementary team and familiar with the onsite/offshore working models.
Excellent communication skills and be able to clearly and concisely communicate both verbally and in writing with both technical team members and business process owners.

PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.
Integration Engineer - M365LondonContract Position
Department overview:
The M365 Engineer will be a member of the Enterprise Applications team supporting various Microsoft and mobile technologies. On-premises and Cloud.
Provide support within a complex hybrid environment and collaborating closely with multiple teams spread globally. This will include Active Directory and Azure AD experience with focus on the M365 suite of tools including Exchange Online, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, Viva and Power Platform.
This Engineer will work closely with the technical lead within EU and other global regions to facilitate delivery of the Microsoft stack of applications and resolve technical complexities. Steady state work will form a key area for the successful applicant with ad-hoc Project based work.
Time management is critical, as are effective, professional communication skills. This team member will work within a dedicated team of IT professionals at the Central London office (currently remote) with support for global regions.
What you‚Äôll be doing:

Support the Applications team on a day-to-day basis
Handle steady state support tickets, logged in ServiceNow, related to Exchange Online/Messaging, Teams, SharePoint Online and various standard M365 applications
Assist with the ongoing IT Apps services projects
Be a technical lead for M365 migration efforts, bringing newly acquired PlayStation Studios into our SIE M365 tenant
Proactively Identify problem areas and resolve where possible
Raise risks and issues to the Enterprise Apps Team Lead
Identify areas that can improve efficiency of delivery
Assist in messaging issues from various endpoints
M365 License Management
Collaborate closely with local and Global support teams including T3 Engineers/GISC
Provide technical run books and support/build documentation for support staff
Coordinate and validate work packages in technical deployments and projects

What we are looking for:

Working knowledge and understanding of M365, Azure AD, Intune, hybrid, and cloud
Experience of implementing and solving problems with M365 on-prem solutions
Experienced level knowledge of Exchange Online as well as messaging gateways and coexistence between on-prem and the cloud based M365 products
Performed M365 migrations, utilizing migration tools like ShareGate, AvePoint, Quest Migration Manager for Exchange, AD, etc.
Proficient in PowerShell for automation of administrative tasks
Graph API scripting experience
Power BI, Power Automate, and Power Apps governance and management
Understanding of SharePoint Online
Knowledge of Active Directory Connect, GPOs, OUs and DNS, SMTP & LDAP
Experience of Outlook client management ‚Äì configuration of user mail profiles, mounting PST files, plugins, troubleshooting, etc.
Comfortable calling out identified risks to the SIE project team and communicating problems to senior executives and third-party vendors
Experience with One Identity ARS Tools Suite would be advantageous
Knowledge of MS Server OS technologies, Virtualization/VMWare, and Cloud solutions
Experienced working in an Agile/Scrum methodology environment

title: Software Development Engineer in Test II
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

The Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is responsible for assuring the quality of internal and partner-facing applications using automation as well as manual black-box and gray-box testing techniques. Duties include designing and creating new test automation, troubleshooting and resolving test code, test environment and infrastructure issues, as well as working with test case management, issue tracking, source control, database, requirements management, reporting, and other tools.
In the course of performing this function, the SDET relies on their extensive background in software development, QA, system administration, script automation, frameworks, and associated organizational processes.
The SDET is a member of an Agile Engineering team and collaborates with System Infrastructure and other SIE teams.
Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and maintain automation scripts in Java using Selenium WebDriver, Cucumber, and JMeter.
Perform both ‚Äúblack box‚Äù and ‚Äúgray box‚Äù testing of SIE‚Äôs internal and partner-facing applications by analyzing applications and requirements then designing and performing test cases.
Integrate, support, use and maintain issue tracking systems such as Jira, source control tools such as Git as well as test case management systems such as qTest.
Promotes a cohesive engineering environment focused on striving for increased quality and team efficiency
Work with QA team members, software developers and system and database administrators to trouble-shoot test failures in the various test environments. This may include debugging issues using SQL queries, reviewing web server and application server logs, etc.
Log bugs as found, and follow up with engineering through the defect life cycle
Monitors metrics to measure application quality and performance

Qualifications:

Extensive experience testing web applications
Proven experience with automation scripting using Java, Selenium Webdriver, and Cucumber.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field/equivalent work experience.
Good grasp of OOP concepts, data structures, and algorithms
Solid understanding of programming and scripting in Java
Experience in building/maintaining test automation frameworks for web applications.
Experience in building/maintaining rest API test automation frameworks.
Experience with source control tools such as Git.
Experience with CICD process and tools such as Jenkins.
Ability to work constructively with developers, QA, Systems and Project managers towards a common goal.
Solid knowledge of Relational Database and SQL queries.
Good understanding of modern software engineering including web technologies, continuous integration, cloud computing, and automation development
Experience with Agile development methodologies such as Scrum.

Desired Skills:

Experience using tools such as JMeter and Postman.
Experience working with large-scale project repository of test cases and defects
Experience using JIRA as an Agile tool to support development and issue tracking
Experience using AWS / Cloud platforms and tools
Experience with Splunk, JSON, XML
Experience testing PS4, PS5, or any other console-based client devices

#LI-JM5
At SIE, we consider several factors when setting each role‚Äôs base pay range, including the competitive benchmarking data for the market and geographic location.Please note that the base pay range may vary in line with our hybrid working policy and individual base pay will be determined based on job-related factors which may include knowledge, skills, experience, and location.¬†In addition, this role is eligible for SIE‚Äôs top-tier benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, matching 401(k), paid time off, wellness program and coveted employee discounts for Sony products. This role also may be eligible for a bonus package. Click¬†here to learn more.The estimated base pay range for this role is listed below.$122,700‚Äî$184,100 USD

title: Senior Software Engineer
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Sr. Software Engineer
San Diego, CA
The Accounts Domain platform team is a seasoned team at SIE which interacts with various core systems server side, client side, and commerce related teams. Using state of the art technology, leveraging AWS native service, we create high transaction, low latency systems that live at the heart of every module in core platform engineering.
This is a fast paced, high-visibility engineering position with SIE‚Äôs core platform engineering organization helping to establish a linear scale, highly available, fault-tolerant, globally distributed accounts services platform.
This next generation fraud platform will support the global, fast growing SIE customer base, world class PlayStation consoles, hand-held devices and network entertainment services such as PlayStation Now. This key role will lead the technology transformation of the network services platform including existing and new services supporting the dramatic customer growth on the platform.
As a Senior Software Development Engineer in the team, you will design highly scalable systems, develop distributed services, collaborate with product managers, architects, engineers, operations team members across PlayStation and build solid payment platform solutions. We are a fast-paced environment, using lightweight SOA design patterns. We encourage innovation and expect developers to take a high level of ownership throughout the software life cycle.
Specific Job Responsibilities:

Develop java based micro services using Spring boot and AWS managed services
Develop AWS based systems using managed services such as:

AWS Lambda (Python and Java)
AWS Kinesis Firehose
AWS Kinesis Analytics
AWS S3
AWS Glue
AWS DynamoDB
AWS SNS
AWS SQS

Work with the scrum team directly to provide code reviews for other team members
Work with the scrum team directly to provide QA in specific projects such as:

Account Creation
Account Management
Parental Control settings
Child Privacy Settings
Age Verification

Work with other scrum teams to share knowledge
Support Accounts Domain systems in production
Work directly and indirectly with PlayStation's Core Commerce, Accounts & Identity and Global Fraud Management teams.

If you are a strong developer with experience and interest in distributed systems and databases, performance and scalability, we'd like to talk to you.
Basic Qualifications:

BS or Master‚Äôs Degree in Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience
7+ years of experience in developing business critical software using Enterprise Java/J2EE, Web Services, REST, JSON/XML, expert level of object oriented programming analysis and design
2+ years‚Äô experience developing with AWS native services such as EC2, S3, Kinesis, Glue, Lambda, SQS, SNS and DynamoDB
Experience developing applications on Unix/Linux platforms
Experience with servlet containers (e.g., Tomcat), JAXRS, Spring, and related technologies
Experience developing web services using JSON and XML
Proficient in the SDLC, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations
Demonstrated ability to take a project from scoping requirements to actual launch of project
Possess deep knowledge of computer science fundamentals such as object oriented design, data structures, algorithm design, problem solving, and complexity analysis.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with micro service architecture.
Experience in requirements engineering, describing software product features, and technical designs.
Experience with an e-commerce company or Payments software is a plus
Experience in deploying, operating, and managing services in AWS or other cloud environments.
Experience building highly performant, active-active, linearly scalable production services (Enterprise Java/J2EE, or C++, Web Services, REST, SQL/NoSQL data layers)

title: Senior Software Development Engineer in Test
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

The Senior Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) is responsible for assuring the quality of internal and partner-facing applications using automation as well as manual black-box and gray-box testing techniques. Duties include designing and creating new test automation, troubleshooting and resolving test code, test environment and infrastructure issues, as well as working with test case management, issue tracking, source control, database, requirements management, reporting, and other tools.
In the course of performing this function, the SDET relies on their extensive background in software development, QA, system administration, script automation, frameworks, and associated organizational processes.
The SDET is a member of an Agile Engineering team and collaborates with System Infrastructure and other SIE teams.
Responsibilities:

Develop, implement, and maintain automation scripts in Java using Selenium WebDriver, Cucumber, and JMeter.
Perform both ‚Äúblack box‚Äù and ‚Äúgray box‚Äù testing of SIE‚Äôs internal and partner-facing applications by analyzing applications and requirements then designing and performing test cases.
Integrate, support, use and maintain issue tracking systems such as Jira, source control tools such as Git as well as test case management systems such as qTest.
Promotes a cohesive engineering environment focused on striving for increased quality and team efficiency
Work with QA team members, software developers and system and database administrators to trouble-shoot test failures in the various test environments. This may include debugging issues using SQL queries, reviewing web server and application server logs, etc.
Log bugs as found, and follow up with engineering through the defect life cycle
Monitors metrics to measure application quality and performance

Qualifications:

Extensive experience testing web applications
Proven experience with automation scripting using Java, Selenium Webdriver, and Cucumber.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field/equivalent work experience.
Good grasp of OOP concepts, data structures, and algorithms
Solid understanding of programming and scripting in Java
Experience in building/maintaining test automation frameworks for web applications.
Experience in building/maintaining rest API test automation frameworks.
Experience with source control tools such as Git.
Experience with CICD process and tools such as Jenkins.
Ability to work constructively with developers, QA, Systems and Project managers towards a common goal.
Solid knowledge of Relational Database and SQL queries.
Good understanding of modern software engineering including web technologies, continuous integration, cloud computing, and automation development
Experience with Agile development methodologies such as Scrum.

Desired Skills:

Experience using tools such as JMeter and Postman.
Experience working with large-scale project repository of test cases and defects
Experience using JIRA as an Agile tool to support development and issue tracking
Experience using AWS / Cloud platforms and tools
Experience with Splunk, JSON, XML
Experience testing PS4, PS5, or any other console-based client devices

title: CRM Lead
job_description:
Why PlayStation?
PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.
PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.
The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

CRM Lead
San Mateo, CA
The Consumer Engagement team is part of the broader Global Media and Omnichannel Marketing function within PlayStation and is responsible for implementing multi-channel digital programs and campaigns developing a relevant dialogue with tens of millions of customers across the globe.
We are advocates for the player. Crafting unforgettable digital experiences that fulfill player curiosity, boost gameplay and drive revenue. We use data-driven insights to build one-to-one relationships and personalized journeys with players across web, email, mobile and on-console.
The CRM Lead is a highly visible and strategic role, responsible for owning the contact strategy for priority partner software titles. This creative and innovative leader will work closely with our Creative Studio, Data Science, Audience & Measurement and Marketing teams across the Americas, Europe, and Asia. Together, we are on a mission to redefine owned channel marketing and its relationship to company growth and player engagement.
Main responsibilities: 

Innovate and evolve existing multi-channel campaign and audience strategy for Live Service software titles and lifecycle journeys, spanning email, mobile and on-console direct messaging channels.
Collaborate and be a key player in driving ‚ÄòAudience First‚Äô strategy by implementing 1:1 personalization at scale across the channel mix.
Analyze campaigns and journeys to understand the performance of these activities and build on the results for the next iteration.
Initiate test and learn strategy to optimize the BAU comms efficiency; feeding all insights gained from the analysis back into a continuous process of testing and refinement.
Maintain deep knowledge of customer engagement landscape and evolutions, seek and understand emerging trends, technologies and innovation to provide ongoing learning for the marketing organization.

What we‚Äôre looking for: 

Educated to degree level in a related field such as Business, Marketing or Mathematics and a strong academic record.
5+ years of proven experience in an influential role in B2C marketing, customer lifecycle management, engagement marketing.
Experience building CRM program support for Live Service games is desirable.
Highly organized - able to handle a full workload and progress multiple ambitious projects simultaneously thanks to your skill and work ethic.
Passionate about the customer‚Äì you look at quantitative and qualitative consumer insights to make decisions and recommend improvements.
Strong communicator with the ability to influence and persuade upwards and outwards ‚Äì comfortable briefing Creatives, Analysts, Engineers, Legal and Senior Management.
Strong analytical and quantitative skills with a consistent track record in data-based decision making, and comfortable analyzing large data sets and analysis framework.
Innovative and constantly exploring new ways of doing things and challenging the status quo.
Sophisticated communicator with excellent influencing skills.
Experience in Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Journey Builder, and Interactive Studio or equivalent ESP.
Excellent interpersonal skills with expertise and integrity that will earn respect and trust with internal team members and external vendors.
Experienced in establishing relationships and operating compassionately across cultures. This includes collaborating openly and bringing together different perspectives to drive well-informed decisions.

Executive Assistant, LegalSan Mateo, CA (Collab)The Executive Assistant reports to the Vice President, Corporate, GDPR, M&A & Legal Operations, whose team supports Global Developer & Publisher Relations and Mergers & Acquisition, as well as handling Corporate Governance and Legal Operations functions. Working with Senior Executives in the Platform Experience Engineering Group‚Äì this role will focus on driving programs that ignite our talent, enrich our culture, and build leadership capability at all levels.

Global Account Manager
San Mateo, CA / Hybrid 
The Global Account Manager will work across Sony Interactive Entertainment (SIE) and partner teams to define and deliver agreed commercial and strategic objectives globally
The Account Manager will be an evangelist for PlayStation, with the knowledge and ability to promote all aspects of the business and platform, discovering new opportunities and driving the business forward. They will provide industry expertise and mentorship internally and externally, advising on commercial best practice and specific territory opportunities and nuances. The Manager will maintain a network of key internal and external contacts to ensure activities can be driven effectively.
The Manager will ensure a smooth process for the content pipeline, and be the first point of escalation for multiple teams internally and externally, with the ability to understand and find resolution for all issues that may impact the Partner‚Äôs business with SIE.
Responsibilities:

Lead the day to day business activity and overall health of the Partner, being the primary point of contact for business queries.
Identify and complete opportunities for the Partner to align with SIE central initiatives.

Where applicable, ensure that partnership contractual requirements are adhered to by SIE and the Partner.
Lead product release and lifecycle planning with internal departments and the Partner.
Extensive knowledge of Partner‚Äôs portfolio, strategy and forecasts.
Identify business opportunities across Partner‚Äôs portfolio and live services.
Develop KPIs / metrics and conduct performance analysis for key content and initiatives.
Communicate business, platform and policy updates to Partners.
Facilitate data analysis requests internally and externally.
Lead business / policy / platform escalations and waivers through operational and technical channels (Product Management Team, Finance, DevNet etc), and identify and resolve operational / process challenges that impact revenue and Partner relationship.
Work with the Partner and internal teams to deliver physical and digital best practice across the whole product lifecycle.
Identify and deliver content suitable for specific platform activity and campaigns.
Identify Partner content to drive a PlayStation message and point of difference.

Qualifications:

5+ years in external partner facing position (e.g. sales, account management, business partner relations).
Experience working with and selling to large, sophisticated global organizations with highly matrixed teams.
Communication, presentation and relationship management skills at all levels.
Strong Negotiation and facilitation skills.
Extensive games development and publishing experience, or comparable media / entertainment / technology industries.
Globally minded
Bachelor Degree

title: Senior Systems Designer
job_description:
We are looking for an experienced systems designer interested in driving and owning new feature development and maintaining existing features for Guild Wars 2. Do you love MMOs and the social experience of games? Are you passionate about designing and implementing systems that integrate with content to create holistic experiences? Do you have experience leading development of features from design to implementation? Are you familiar with the constraints and complexities of working on a live game? Do you enjoy driving standards and consensus around best practices? Are you the type of person that loves building consensus and creating a shared vision with a team? If any of this sound like you, we would love to hear from you!
Why Join the ArenaNet Design Team?
The Design team at ArenaNet are the ones responsible for envisioning and implementing the encounters, events, items, rewards, etc. that our players interact with in the game. We work collaboratively across multiple disciplines to create, iterate, and refine ideas and put them in the game. Our work requires empathy, patience, communication, the ability to understand a variety of players and playstyles, and attention to detail.
As a designer, you will utilize your love of games along with your innovation and creative problem-solving skills to define and craft experiences and features that affect our players over the lifetime of their relationship with the products that we (and you) develop.
We also believe that a healthy team is the first step to making fun, engaging games. And a healthy team is one of mutual respect, psychological safety, and diversity. We believe that new perspectives and voices help us to improve our game and find the best ideas.
TYPICAL TRAITS:

Experience designing and implementing features from concept to release on at least 1 shipped title in a systems designer role
A desire to work collaboratively with various teams and disciplines to bring ideas to life
Understanding of player motivations and game reward systems
Familiarity with maintaining live systems and games
Experience with scripting languages like Lua, JavaScript, Python or Blueprint
You have learned or imagined how to design systems that cultivate dramatic gameplay experiences.

NICE TO HAVES

Passion for Guild Wars or other MMO games
Experience working on multiplayer online games
Knowledge / Experience of UX needs and working with UX designers and artists

We are open to remote work in AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, ID, IL, MA, MD, NC, NV, NY OR, TX, UT and WA or onsite/hybrid/flex at our office in Bellevue, WA.Total compensation is salary plus¬†an annual bonus potential. Please note that the listed pay range is a general guideline only. We take into consideration the geography in which you live and your experience and qualifications when determining final salary. This role is also eligible for medical, dental, vision and life insurance, short and long term disability, 401(k), flexible and dependent care spending accounts, PTO, paid holidays and parental leave.Remote pay range$75,000‚Äî$125,000 USD

We are ArenaNet‚Äîwe‚Äôve created a studio that makes online worlds infused with innovation, hand-crafted excellence, and creative passion. title: Senior, Technical Demo Specialist
job_description:
Job Description
The Senior Technical Demo Specialist is responsible for presenting, supporting and troubleshooting demonstrations of Magic Leap‚Äôs hardware and software to external parties including investors, developers, partners and customers. These demonstrations will take place at trade shows, conferences and customer sites both domestically and internationally and at our Magic Leap Experience Centers.¬†
This is a highly visible role, responsible for educating various audiences on the latest Magic Leap technology. This role requires a strong technical background with the ability to effectively communicate and pitch the latest advancements in Augmented Reality.¬†
This role is remote and requires travel 50+%.
Responsibilities:

Demo hardware and software to external parties including investors, developers, partners and customers at conferences, customer sites and in our Magic Leap Experience Centers.¬†
Adapt presentations of the demo based on the audience to make the material relatable and easy to understand.
Have a comprehensive grasp of Magic Leap‚Äôs vision, key differentiators and value proposition and the ability to communicate it effectively
Work across multiple internal teams and external ISVs, building relationships and gathering input to drive alignment on product and software improvements.
Manage and stage devices for demos and events, including all software and hardware needed to ensure a smooth experience.
Provide troubleshooting of the demo hardware and software, resolving in-depth issues affecting the functionality of the demo.
QA and vet new releases of software and applications to develop troubleshooting guides and training materials.¬†
Perform application functionality and stability tests, and document the results of those tests.
Escalate issues appropriately to the relevant parties to ensure the highest quality demos for guests.

Qualifications:

4+ years of experience providing technical support across solutions-based, multi-layered tech organizations
Good communication skills, can speak positively to a technical or non-technical audience about complex or nuanced subject matter, in front of various sized audiences¬†
Demonstrable problem solving and troubleshooting skills
Ability to work effectively with multiple teams simultaneously is essential
Experience in AR is a plus
Technical sales experience is a plus
A strong IT background with certifications is a plus
Ability to travel on a regular basis to execute these core responsibilities (50+%)

¬†Education:

B.A. in marketing, communications (with a focus on tech highly desired)
B.S. in a STEM field with requisite communications experience
Or relevant experience 

Additional Information


All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines.

#LI-REMOTE

title: Lead, Software Engineer, Cloud Networking
job_description:
Job Description
Magic Leap, Inc. is seeking a Principal / Lead Software Engineer to focus on building Augmented Reality (AR) Cloud Backends to support Unity applications for shared AR experiences.¬† This position will offer you the chance to work closely with cross-platform software engineers to design, develop, debug and deploy many functional aspects of the systems used to enable shared, interactive 3D experiences across multiple players.¬† If you are a fast-learner with a positive attitude and a strong passion for working with new technology, come join the Solutions Design team in redefining the way people experience the world and each other through unique AR technologies.
Responsibilities

Lead a team of developers building AR cloud backends for Unity applications
Track and report on project status, plan architecture, and present product vision
Be a subject matter expert in cloud networking, with an ability to communicate ideas effectively to the team
Collaborate with cross-functional teams across the wider organization on areas of shared interest
Work on bug fixing and performance improvements
Contribute to team success through code and architectural reviews, as well as cross-departmental presentations

Qualifications

5+ years of software development experience with GoLang, C++ and C#¬†
3+ years of experience implementing networked, realtime applications
Docker, docker-compose, Terraform, Kubernetes, GCP experience required
Significant experience optimizing network traffic, message structures, bandwidth
Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and deployment
Experience with realtime/game server development and deployment
Exceptional ability to write efficient, clean, maintainable and portable code
Strong proven experience in implementing and deploying efficient server-side code
Interest in working across client/server to integrate our tools into user-facing applications

Nice to have

Knowledge of Photon Unity and Photon Realtime SDK¬†
Experience with development for Augmented Reality (AR), Virtual Reality (VR), or other forms of head mounted displays (HMDs) a plus

Education

Bachelor/Master's degree in Computer Science or relevant field, or equivalent experience

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to Equal Employment Opportunities guidelines

#LI-REMOTE
Our salary ranges are determined by role, level and location. In addition to salary, Magic Leap offers a discretionary bonus, equity, and a fully comprehensive benefits package for eligible employees.US Base Salary Range$162,000‚Äî$227,000 USD

ÌåêÍµê GREITS PANGYO

¬†
Í≥†Ïö©ÌòïÌÉú¬†

Ï†ïÍ∑úÏßÅ

¬†

Project Introduction
Next-generation life simulation game. 
We aim to implement realistic and immersive life simulations by actively utilizing UE5's next-generation technology.
¬†

Development Goal

Immersive life story players live, immersion beyond an experience.¬†



¬†

Key Characteristics

Live life as you would in real life, experiencing joys and sorrows. Sometimes, challenging choices present extraordinary experiences in life
There are no forced or coercive goals
Instead, experience and build your life at your own pace
True sandbox of life where you can choose your drama, story, work, and love whenever and however



¬†

Talent that fits us

Anyone who likes to receive feedback, even harsh ones
People who find solutions to problems with new tools and ideas
Those who excel in tasks that are difficult to automate
A person who comes up with solutions rather than pushing them over to others



¬†
Responsibilities

UI design that fits the game's art style and overall concept
UI design and motion graphics to enhance the immersion of the game
UX design based on usability
Validate UI interactions using prototyping tools
Creating In-Game UI Resources Using UE5 UMG

¬†
Requirements

Ability to create resources using Photoshop and Illustrator
Experience with Unreal Engine, UMG
Understanding of UX/UI design process
Stylish and trendy design sense
Ability to communicate one's thoughts logically and clearly to colleagues
Ability to communicate clearly with collaborating departments

¬†
Preferred Qualifications

An open-minded person who likes to test new concepts and ideas
A person who can do rapid prototyping to test and verify the ideas
Those who can identify and solve problems based on quantitative/qualitative data
Those who can create UI using the materials of Unreal Engine and UMG
Those who can compose the UI with video/motion graphic tools such as AfterEffect and Premiere Pro
Those who can create UI interactions with prototyping tools such as XD, Protopie, Framer, and Principle
Those who love the life simulation genre.

¬†
Office

Flexible. (Work from home / Relocation support can be arranged if needed)

¬†
Employment Type

Full-Time

¬†
Interview Process

Resume screening > Technical & Cultural Fit Interview > Job offer

¬†
Required Documents

Resume (any template), Career Description, Portfolio (mandatory)

¬†

Project Introduction
Next-generation life simulation game. 
We aim to implement realistic and immersive life simulations by actively utilizing UE5's next-generation technology.
¬†

Development Goal

Immersive life story players live, immersion beyond an experience.¬†



¬†

Key Characteristics

Live life as you would in real life, experiencing joys and sorrows. Sometimes, challenging choices present extraordinary experiences in life
There are no forced or coercive goals
Instead, experience and build your life at your own pace
True sandbox of life where you can choose your drama, story, work, and love whenever and however



¬†

Talent that fits us

Anyone who likes to receive feedback, even harsh ones
People who find solutions to problems with new tools and ideas
Those who excel in tasks that are difficult to automate
A person who comes up with solutions rather than pushing them over to others



¬†
Responsibilities

Development of high-quality rendering effects and materials using Unreal Engine 5
Suggest or provide guidelines to artists for performance optimization

¬†
Requirements

Ability to create a variety of materials and rendering techniques in Unreal Engine.¬†
Deep knowledge of how Unreal Engine's rendering process and how to optimize it
Able to communicate with an open mind and make rational decisions

¬†
Preferred Qualifications

Those who have experience in releasing a successful game
Those who love the life simulation genre

¬†
Office

Pangyo Office, Korea. GREITS PANGYO¬†

Employment Type

Full-Time

Resume screening > Phone Interview > 1st Interview (Technical Fit) > Final interview (Culture Fit) > Job offer

Resume (any template), Personal Statement, Career Description, Portfolio
