¬†

Project Introduction
Next-generation life simulation game. 
We aim to implement realistic and immersive life simulations by actively utilizing UE5's next-generation technology.
¬†

Development Goal

Immersive life story players live, immersion beyond an experience.¬†



¬†

Key Characteristics

Live life as you would in real life, experiencing joys and sorrows. Sometimes, challenging choices present extraordinary experiences in life
There are no forced or coercive goals
Instead, experience and build your life at your own pace
True sandbox of life where you can choose your drama, story, work, and love whenever and however



¬†

Talent that fits us

Anyone who likes to receive feedback, even harsh ones
People who find solutions to problems with new tools and ideas
Those who excel in tasks that are difficult to automate
A person who comes up with solutions rather than pushing them over to others



¬†
Responsibilities

Implementation of the basic system and contents of the life simulation game
Building a robust system with scalability in mind
Working with content features and tool creation for other teams ¬†
Development of a high-quality animation system

¬†
Requirements

Knowledge and experience with Unreal Engine
Profound C++ knowledge
A person who can define and solve problems with innovation and a proactive attitude
Able to communicate with an open mind and make rational decisions

¬†
Preferred Qualifications

Those who are familiar with Unreal Engine 5
Those who have experience in releasing a successful game
Those who love the life simulation genre

¬†
Office

Flexible. (Work from home / Relocation support can be arranged if needed)

¬†

Full-Time / Part-Time¬†

Resume screening > 1st Interview (Technical Fit) > Final interview (Culture Fit) > Job offer
Interviews and coding tests may be added if necessary, and details will be provided individually.

¬†

Project Introduction
Next-generation life simulation game. 
We aim to implement realistic and immersive life simulations by actively utilizing UE5's next-generation technology.
¬†

Development Goal

Immersive life story players live, immersion beyond an experience.¬†



¬†

Key Characteristics

Live life as you would in real life, experiencing joys and sorrows. Sometimes, challenging choices present extraordinary experiences in life
There are no forced or coercive goals
Instead, experience and build your life at your own pace
True sandbox of life where you can choose your drama, story, work, and love whenever and however



¬†

Talent that fits us

Anyone who likes to receive feedback, even harsh ones
People who find solutions to problems with new tools and ideas
Those who excel in tasks that are difficult to automate
A person who comes up with solutions rather than pushing them over to others



¬†
Responsibilities

Performance and memory optimization using the latest technologies in Unreal Engine 5
Developing game-specific rendering techniques
Building a foundation system for launch and deployment¬†

¬†
Requirements

Knowledge and experience with Unreal Engine
Profound C++ knowledge
A person who can define and solve problems with innovation and a proactive attitude
Able to communicate with an open mind and make rational decisions

¬†
Preferred Qualifications

Those who are familiar with Unreal Engine 5
Those who have experience in releasing a successful game
Those who love the life simulation genre

¬†
Office

Flexible. (Work from home / Relocation support can be arranged if needed)

¬†
Employment Type

Full-Time / Part-Time¬†

¬†

Resume screening > 1st Interview (Technical Fit) > Final interview (Culture Fit) > Job offer

¬†

Project Introduction
Next-generation life simulation game. 
We aim to implement realistic and immersive life simulations by actively utilizing UE5's next-generation technology.
¬†

Development Goal

Immersive life story players live, immersion beyond an experience.¬†



¬†

Key Characteristics

Live life as you would in real life, experiencing joys and sorrows. Sometimes, challenging choices present extraordinary experiences in life
There are no forced or coercive goals
Instead, experience and build your life at your own pace
True sandbox of life where you can choose your drama, story, work, and love whenever and however



¬†

Talent that fits us

Anyone who likes to receive feedback, even harsh ones
People who find solutions to problems with new tools and ideas
Those who excel in tasks that are difficult to automate
A person who comes up with solutions rather than pushing them over to others



¬†
Responsibilities

Implementation of the basic system and contents of the life simulation game
Building a robust system with scalability in mind
Working with content features and tool creation for other teams ¬†
Development of a high-quality animation system

¬†
Requirements

Knowledge and experience with Unreal Engine
Profound C++ knowledge
A person who can define and solve problems with innovation and a proactive attitude
Able to communicate with an open mind and make rational decisions

¬†
Preferred Qualifications

Those who are familiar with Unreal Engine 5
Those who have experience in releasing a successful game
Those who love the life simulation genre

¬†
Office

Flexible. (Work from home / Relocation support can be arranged if needed)

¬†
Employment Type

Full-Time / Part-Time¬†

¬†
Interview Process

Resume screening > 1st Interview (Technical Fit) > Final Interview (Culture Fit) > Job offer
Interviews and coding tests may be added if necessary, and details will be provided individually.

¬†
Required Documents

Resume (any template), Personal Statement, Career Description, Portfolio (if needed)

Talent is a driver behind Krafton‚Äôs continuous technology-based creation and unparalleled outcomes.

¬†

Î∂ÑÏÑùÏùÑ ÏúÑÌïú Îç∞Ïù¥ÌÑ∞ Í∞ÄÍ≥µ, Î≥ÄÌôò, Ï∂îÏ∂úÍπåÏßÄ Î∂ÑÏÑùÍ∞ÄÍ∞Ä ÏßÅÏ†ë ÏßÑÌñâÌï©ÎãàÎã§. ÏõêÌïòÎäî ÎèôÎ£å ÏÉÅÏúºÎ°úÎäî ÌåÄÎÇ¥ Î∂ÑÏúÑÍ∏∞Ïóê Ïûò Ïñ¥Ïö∏Î¶¨Îäî Î∂ÑÏù¥ÏóàÏúºÎ©¥ Ï¢ãÍ≤†ÏäµÎãàÎã§.

Manage and provide actionable insights into a number of areas, including customer segmentation, behavior-based modeling (propensity, churn, LTV, etc.), data strategy, and analytic approaches
Create and optimize database architecture for consumption in BI tools and deliver flexible and robust technical solutions to answer a multitude of cross functional business questions
Integrate with and improve existing machine learning pipelines on propensity scoring and LTV projection to granularize the understanding of user journey and customer value
Perform complex SQL queries on data warehouse and work with other data extraction, reporting, and analytic tools to develop executive level reporting
Conceptualize and lead major analysis around new map releases, monetization events, and any other additional content introduced to the game
Maintain and support the daily ETL processes including dimensional modeling, workflow design, and data cleansing
Work across multiple data sources (Web, in-game, CS) to develop a complete picture of gamer behavior

Ïù¥Îü∞ Í≤ΩÌóòÏùÑ Í∞ÄÏßÑ Î∂ÑÍ≥º Ìï®Íªò ÏÑ±Ïû•ÌïòÍ≥† Ïã∂ÏäµÎãàÎã§! (ÌïÑÏàòÏöîÍ±¥)

BA or BS in quantitative field (Economics, engineering, mathematics)
Knowledge of Python and Spark
Experience with large individual customer behavioral data sets (gaming, retail, financial services) and expertise in ETL methodology
Deep knowledge of defining database schemas, creating table structures, and managing table linkages to support backend BI and marketing data infrastructure
Effective delivery of analysis results with data Visualization skills such as tableau and MS PowerPoint
Excellent collaboration and communication skills with a proven track record of synthesizing and sharing data insights across all levels of the organization

¬†

Project Introduction
Next-generation life simulation game. 
We aim to implement realistic and immersive life simulations by actively utilizing UE5's next-generation technology.
¬†

Development Goal

Immersive life story players live, immersion beyond an experience.¬†



¬†

Key Characteristics

Live life as you would in real life, experiencing joys and sorrows. Sometimes, challenging choices present extraordinary experiences in life
There are no forced or coercive goals
Instead, experience and build your life at your own pace
True sandbox of life where you can choose your drama, story, work, and love whenever and however



¬†

Introducing Environment Team¬†

The 3D environment team's goal is to make the game's environment come to life in 3D



¬†

Talent that fits us

Anyone who likes to receive feedback, even harsh ones
People who find solutions to problems with new tools and ideas
Those who excel in tasks that are difficult to automate
A person who comes up with solutions rather than pushing them over to others



¬†
Responsibilities

Procedural (Houdini) 3D Environment - Procedural world building, modeling
Realistic environment production using Unreal Engine 5
Background resource optimization
Level asset creation and modularization

¬†
Requirements

Houdini procedural world-building development experience
Proficiency in 3DMX, Zbrush, Substance, Photoshop
Knowledgeable in Unreal Engine5 PBR and one who has a deep understanding of the material of an object and the ability to express it
Those who can work directly on the level with level design elements in mind
Those who have excellent production skills using existing data
Those who can communicate smoothly among team members and have a high understanding of the joint work process
Those who can handle work within the set working hours

¬†
Preferred Qualifications

Those who love the life simulation games
Those who can handle or plan various automation tools well

¬†
Office

Pangyo Office, Korea. GREITS PANGYO¬†

¬†
Employment Type

Full-Time

¬†
Interview Process

Resume screening > Phone Interview > Technical Fit Test > 1st Interview (Technical Fit) > Final interview (Culture Fit) > Job offer

¬†
Required Documents

Resume (any template), Personal Statement, Career Description, Portfolio

title: Tech Recruiter
job_description:
We're looking for a Technical Recruiter to join our in office team at Hypixel Studios, which collaborates remotely from around the world. Our members range from industry newcomers to experts with 25+ years of experience. Team members come from a diverse set of backgrounds, but share a common passion for building polished player-focused, community-powered games.
¬†
Join us on our mission to bring players together in an inviting, immersive world where they can make their mark. Hytale empowers creative expression across a spectrum of experiences including sandbox adventure, social play, minigames, and creativity using a suite of powerful and accessible tools.
¬†
As a Technical Recruiter, you will be the first point of contact for candidates and work to ensure they have a smooth interviewing experience. You will work with various stakeholders including hiring managers, the operations team and the broader Hytale team to deliver hiring updates, schedule interviews and gather requirements.
¬†
Who you are:

You are a recruiter or software developer looking for your next challenge in the games industry and you are curious on how we scout for great talent
You enjoy meeting new people and building relationships whilst always striving for a positive experience
You can pivot plan, and are comfortable with the ebb and flow of the games industry and changing recruitment needs
You are a continuous learner, passionate about keeping your skills up to date

¬†
Some of your role:

Work with the recruitment team to prioritise roles and form a strategy on hiring for tech related roles
Work closely with stakeholders to provide and request hiring updates to move candidates through the recruitment process with ease
Perform screening interviews as the first point of contact for candidates
Keep candidates informed of their status throughout the process, providing a transparent and enjoyable experience
Source for candidates using a range of relevant platforms based on the priority stack

¬†
Essential Traits:

Experience in the games, creative, or tech sector as either a recruiter or software developer seeking your next challenge
The ability to pick up new technologies and processes quickly, in a self sufficient manager
You like to take initiative, seeking knowledge and asking questions when you are uncertain
You keep up to date with industry trends and can be dynamic based on your findings
Proficient in both written and verbal communication with technical and non-technical individuals

¬†
Bonus Traits:

Interviewing experience in the tech or games industry
Experience with recruitment databases and their management
Experience sourcing for tech related roles

¬†
We can offer:

Salary from ¬£30,000 (inclusive of benefits)*
Annual Performance Bonus¬†
Quality of Life increases
Flexible working
Comprehensive relocation packages both nationally (Mon‚Äô Up) and internationally (Mon‚Äô Home)
Christmas Closure
Gym membership
Free parking
Dog friendly offices
Lunch provisions
A chance to work on a new game project with an extremely motivated team
Opportunities to learn and grow personally and professionally
A stable and secure work environment

* Full salary detail to be outlined at offer stage
We‚Äôre looking for applicants who are self-driven, put players first, and that have a history of making cool stuff. In return, we can offer an environment that values and supports individual creativity and passion and believes in fostering new talent. We recognize the value of diversity in every sense and actively encourage candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply.

title: Systems Engineer
job_description:
JOB TITLE: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Systems Engineer
LOCATION: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Brighton, UK
FUNCTION: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Engineering
REPORTS TO: ¬†¬† Lead Systems Engineer
CONTRACT: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Perm
¬†
What We Need:Hangar 13 is looking for an experienced Systems Engineer to help with developing our next generation of games using Unreal Engine 5.
¬†
What You Will Do:

Handle the lower-levels systems of Unreal like reflection and serialization, I/O, garbage collection, engine modules, etc
Help with technical designs for new features and/or changes in engine
Write code that fulfills the functional and technical requirements of the project
Collaborate with other engineering team members to devise optimal engineering solutions
Able to make modifications to Unreal Engine internal modules
Have knowledge of other platforms and be able to work outside PC development

¬†
Who We Think Will Be A Good Fit:

Experience developing for games; preferably Third Person titles
At least one shipped AAA game
Experience with multi-processor programming
Experience developing for game consoles
Experience working on core systems
Experience working on multi-platform software projects
Strong level of C++
Good 3D math skills
Ability to research, analyze and optimize code to meet performance requirements
Ability to learn and master new technologies and code
Ability to work independently and efficiently under reasonable deadlines
Open world games experience

Who We Are:
Hangar 13 is the internal 2K development studio behind the award-winning Mafia III. The studio is comprised of industry veterans drawn from a diverse range of studios, who have collectively shipped hundreds of titles across a wide variety of genres. Though we hail from all over the world, and our backgrounds are wildly different, one thing binds us all together ‚Äì the belief that ‚ÄúEvery Player‚Äôs Story is Unique.‚Äù
Hangar 13 is based in four locations: Novato (California), Brighton (UK), and Brno & Prague (Czech Republic).
We work collaboratively across our 4 locations to develop games as one global team. Each of our locations provides the opportunity to work on big-budget, AAA console in a diverse and inclusive environment!
Located just 45 minutes via train from London, Brighton is one of the UK‚Äôs most diverse and downright interesting cities. Sat right on the south coast of England, the city is home to a vibrant creative community and is known as an easy-going and tolerant place to live and work. Brighton is home to Victorian piers and palaces, brightly coloured stucco homes and a 5-mile long shingle beach which becomes a post-work social hub during the summer months.
Onsite amenities inside our state-of-the-art Brighton studio include a fully equipped kitchen, games room, gym (with showers) and our very own bar. We‚Äôre a 30 second walk from Brighton station.
¬†
Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com and hangar13games.com accounts.
¬†
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.
¬†
#Li-Onsite#LI-PK1

title: Sr Backend Software Engineer
job_description:
What We Need:Hangar 13 is looking for a Sr Backend Software Engineer to help design and develop backend features for AAA Games.
¬†
What You Will Do:

Collaborate with Designers and other developers to design Backend solutions to game requirements.¬†
Implement Backend systems to support the game.¬†
Collaborate with other developers to integrate the online backend features in the game client.¬†
Work with proprietary existing software technology and build new technology in order to fulfil the project‚Äôs technical requirements.¬†
Identify technical and developmental risks/obstacles and generate solutions to overcome identified risks.¬†

¬†
Who We Think Will Be A Good Fit:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related discipline¬†

Collaborate actively with teams across the globe

title: Senior DevOps Engineer
job_description:
Guerrilla, the Amsterdam-based developer of the critically acclaimed Horizon series is looking for a Senior DevOps Engineer to join its Infrastructure Team and level up the technology behind its games.
Our Infrastructure Team
We‚Äôre taking the Horizon franchise online and are building the technology for a multiplayer game! The Online Infrastructure team works closely with designers and developers in order to build a scalable, reliable and flexible platform to develop and run the game.
Join our team and become deeply immersed in all our Infrastructure efforts, including platform coding, developer experience, automation, deployment, security, networking, and performance tuning! Our goal is not only to build out infrastructure, but write systems around it that support our developers.
You will contribute to the development of our platforms according to the needs of our developers and the game, working side by side with artists, designers and game programmers in a creative and highly ambitious atmosphere.
Our Technology
For our game servers we‚Äôre using C++ and a custom UDP-based protocol. For other game related services we use industry-standard web technologies: Java, Tomcat and Spring. Our game communicates through REST and has a persistent HTTPS connection to receive notifications.
In order to build and run the game at scale, we‚Äôre using some industry standards to build our own solutions. We‚Äôre using AWS as our platform, and running all our binaries in Kubernetes using AWS EKS clusters. Around them, several AWS services including (but not limited to) S3, Elastic Load Balancers, and Kinesis Firehose provide features for persistent storage, connectivity, and data streaming.
We‚Äôre managing our environment‚Äôs infrastructure using Terraform and Terragrunt hosted in Git, alongside Jenkins pipelines both for CI/CD and automation jobs, looking to put GitOps principles into practice.
Observability is driven by Prometheus, Opensearch and Grafana.
What you will do

Architect and build development tools and infrastructure
Automate and improve development and release processes
Ensure systems are performant, safe and secure
Work with software engineers to optimize development processes

Who you are
We would like to hear from you if:

You have at least 4 years‚Äô experience administering and developing for Cloud Infrastructure (AWS knowledge is a plus)
You have solid experience developing with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform knowledge is a plus)
You have experience administering and developing for Container services (Kubernetes knowledge is a plus)
You have experience administering and deploying development CI/CD tools such as Git and Jenkins
You have good organizational and time management skills, and the ability to work on multiple projects at the same time
Your communication skills are excellent and you have a keen sense of customer service
You are a great problem-solver and troubleshooter
You have a good eye for detail, and value the need for strong documentation

Pluses

You have experience with Helm
You have knowledge of best practices and IT operations in an always-up, always-available service
You have experience managing large Infrastructure as Code repositories
You have experience with performance tuning Linux systems
You have experience with Python

Please note: This position is based in our studio in the heart of Amsterdam. Guerrilla offers relocation and immigration support.

title: Principal Writer (Online Project)
Game Writer (Online Project)
job_description:
~Mission, quest writing and narrative design~
Our writing team
Our writers are driven to push the boundaries of dramatic storytelling in open-world games. We want players to feel hooked by our quests and characters, to enjoy dialogue that crackles, and to savor our stories long after they put down the controller. To accomplish these goals, we collaborate closely with designers, artists, animators, actors and technicians throughout the studio, and beyond. ¬†
What you will do
As a Game Writer, your main tasks and responsibilities are to:

pitch compelling ideas for quests, factions, and backstories
write quest dialogue, ambient dialogue, story outlines, and faction documents
help develop narrative designs for quests, gameplay activities, and game features
support teams throughout the studio with their narrative needs while advocating for the game‚Äôs emotional arc

Who you are
We‚Äôd love to hear from you if you:

At least one shipped, narrative-heavy mobile or indie game, or at least one year at a AAA studio
Can deliver prompt revisions based on rapidly evolving feedback
Have a strong passion/affinity for open-world RPGs, MMORPGs and online games
Have had training in dramatic writing and story structure
Can share 3 writing samples (10 pages or less) demonstrating a clear understanding of dramatic conflict and skill with dialogue.

Please note: This position is not remote; it is based in our studio in the heart of Amsterdam. Guerrilla offers relocation and immigration support for qualified candidates.
Interested? 
If you think you‚Äôre up for the challenge, you can apply by hitting the ‚Äúapply now‚Äù button. Be sure to submit your CV, a cover/motivation letter and at least 3 writing samples (10 pages or less each).¬†
In your cover letter, please describe your background, how you became a writer, and briefly describe the proven methods you rely on to write great stories. We are also interested in learning about your reasons for applying at Guerrilla.
When selecting or composing your writing samples, please include samples that:

demonstrate you can write the kind of games we make
reflect the style, tone and particularly the modes of storytelling seen in our previous releases
evidence a clear understanding of subtext, dramatic conflict and skill with dialogue
include at least one script for a game cinematic/cutscene, preferably written in screenplay format
are in PDF format

title: Narrative Designer (Online Project)
XBox Graphics Engineer (UE4)
job_description:
Who We Are¬†
MAKE LIFE EPIC
Founded in 1996, Firaxis Games is a world-renowned game development studio with an unwavering mission to ‚Äúbuild games that stand the test of time‚Äù. The name Firaxis, a fusion of ‚Äúfiery‚Äù and ‚Äúaxis,‚Äù communicates the company‚Äôs dynamic development process that results in the creation of ground breaking titles with unparalleled gameplay delivered to gamers around the world. Under the creative direction of industry legend Sid Meier, Firaxis has released dozens of hit games on multiple platforms and is recognized as an industry leader in game development.
CORE VALUES:
GAMEPLAY FIRST
Let gameplay drive decision making
BE ACCOUNTABLE
Deliver great work for the studio, the team & yourself
PEOPLE FOCUSED
Maintain an environment where people are happy
EMBRACE ENTHUSIASM
Find opportunities to contribute and collaborate
WORK SMART
Put effort where it pays off the most
Firaxis Games is seeking a talented and inspired graphics programmer to join its team. title: Project Audio Director
job_description:
Firaxis Audio ‚Äì Project Audio Director ‚Äì Marvel‚Äôs Midnight Suns
Overview:
Firaxis Games is searching for an experienced, technically minded, project Audio Director to lead the audio vision of Marvel‚Äôs Midnight Suns. In this position, you will be responsible for the overall project audio direction, supporting technical innovation by defining efficient and performant audio pipelines while overseeing all aspects of the game‚Äôs audio development.
You will work closely with the Studio Audio Director and project leadership to ensure audio is represented at the highest levels and take ownership of the sonic identity across the title. You will contribute to the strategic leadership goals as it pertains to the audio team while being a champion for audio within the studio. Autonomous in your work, you are enthusiastic and motivated to push the boundaries of game audio and strive to elevate and achieve our studio‚Äôs creative vision through sound.
The ideal candidate has experience overseeing all aspects of a game‚Äôs audio development from pre-production to ship, and has a proven track record of conceptualizing and integrating innovative technical audio pipelines and systems to fulfill project goals. Effective at planning and developing realistic timelines to deliver results, combined with an unwavering desire to promote and support audio within a development team, you are a thoughtful and motivated leader willing to accept any challenge head on.
¬†
Responsibilities:

Define and uphold the project‚Äôs audio direction both on a creative and technical level, while ensuring world-class audio quality is met and the vision is effectively communicated
Oversee all aspects of the game‚Äôs audio development and implementation regarding sound assets, dialogue, music, and mix
Create and implement audio assets within the game and audio engine as needed
Conceptualize innovative audio features, concepts, and best practices to support providing exceptional audio design and implementation across the project
Outline efficient audio pipelines and infrastructures to support advanced audio implementation systems and toolsets (narrative voice pipelines, audio build-systems, etc.)
Work closely with project production to certify tasks, milestones, and deliverables are well defined and achievable as it pertains to audio
Define and advocate for game audio technology which best allows the team to create world class audio experiences for our players
Identify and improve legacy audio systems and pipelines to advance the audio quality of the title and improve audio production practices
Work in partnership with project leadership to ensure cross-discipline collaboration of a shared vision toward all aspects of the game‚Äôs production, development, and creative direction
Align with the Studio Audio Director to ensure the global studio audio vision is upheld and resources are allocated appropriately
Mentor audio team members and contribute to their personal growth and development within the team
Collaborate with marketing and other external partners to maintain the project‚Äôs audio vision across deliverables
Actively identify, troubleshoot, and debug project audio issues, establishing priority, throughout development
Actively participate in playtests and provide feedback to the team with actionable items
Build and maintain positive relationships with potential outsourcing teams on an ‚Äòas-needed‚Äô basis

Qualifications:

3+ Years experience working as an Audio Director within the games industry
8+ Years experience working in audio for AAA game titles
Proven leadership and mentoring experience working as a Lead or Director
At least 1 AAA / Major Title shipped in an Audio Director role
At least 3 AAA / Major Titles shipped as a member of an audio team
Highly proficient in AudioKinetc‚Äôs Wwise middleware software
Highly proficient in Unreal engine development with a focus on audio implementation
Experience shipping titles across multiple SKUs, incorporating performance optimizations as needed
Extensive knowledge of developing complex audio pipelines and integrations, such as narrative pipelines, audio build systems, audio features (HDR, Propagation Systems, Dynamic Reverb Systems, etc.)
Experience mixing game audio supporting various user defined end points (surround, Dolby Atmos, etc.)
Extensive knowledge of audio production standards and best practices within the games industry
Incredibly organized with effective communication and leadership skills
A passion for cultivating a fun, inclusive, and respectful working environment¬†

¬†
¬†




Who We Are
Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K‚Äôs portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms, include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Hangar 13, CatDaddy, Cloud Chamber, and HB Studios. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today‚Äôs most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment.
Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of our growing library of critically-acclaimed franchises such as NBA 2K, Battleborn, BioShock, Borderlands, The Darkness, Mafia, Sid Meier‚Äôs Civilization, WWE 2K, and XCOM.
At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We are dedicated to diversity and inclusion, and want our community of candidates to reflect this commitment. We encourage all qualified applicants to explore our global positions. 2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO).¬†
Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com accounts.

¬†

title: Senior Product Manager, Cloud Infrastructure
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
ONLINE INFRASTRUCTURE
What We Do
We enable Epic‚Äôs online services teams to build, deploy, and manage services that are used by more than half a billion players around the world. Our mission is to provide world class tools and platforms to improve the experience of our developers and make it easier, faster, and safer to build, operate, and scale their applications. We operate at massive scale as one of the largest cloud computing users in the world.
What You'll Do
As a member of our team, you will be the vision holder and roadmap owner for our cloud infrastructure platform, collaborating with production, development, and operations to drive better developer experience through deep engagement with our developer community, disciplined analysis, and iteration with measurable goals. 
In this role, you will

Define longer-term product direction across cloud infrastructure and platform engineering.
Own the roadmap for our infrastructure platform to balance internal customer needs with partner organization needs, platform vision, and Epic‚Äôs long term strategy to allow us to deliver incremental solutions that build toward the long-term vision for the platform.
Ultimately be responsible for driving a better experience for everyone in the company around infrastructure by helping to provide clearer onboarding, simpler paths to integration with developers CI/CD pipeline, and providing monitoring and logging capabilities
Partner broadly across our engineering teams to build feedback loops to understand their needs and ensure that our strategy and roadmap aligns to deliver the best possible developer experience.
Work side-by-side with our infrastructure and platform engineering teams.

What we're looking for

5+ years of experience in a mix of cloud infrastructure, platform engineering, and product management roles. 
Technical understanding of cloud infrastructure combined with a customer-focused mindset.
Good technical understanding of some of the following topics: Containers, Container Orchestration (Kubernetes), user access management, Cloud networking, Secret management, Continuous Integration and continuous development (CI/CD) capabilities, Logs and Monitoring services, Security and threat detection capabilities. It will be nice if the candidate has a general knowledge of AWS and its key services. 
Strong communication skills and ability to to work across all aspect of the business to solicit feedback and requirements.
Ability to work across different disciplines and teams to build a cohesive product vision for our infrastructure platform.
Comfortable dealing with ambiguity and using both qualitative and quantitative methods to define a prioritized roadmap.

This position is listed in multiple locations across North America and Europe including
Seattle, Washington
San Francisco, California
Cary, North Carolina
Los Angeles, California
Montreal, Canada
Europe (United Kingdom)
Pay Transparency Information
The expected annual base pay range(s) for this position are detailed below. Each base pay range is relevant only for individuals who are residents of or will be expected to work within the specified locale. Compensation varies based on a variety of factors, which include (but aren‚Äôt limited to) things such as skills and competencies, qualifications, knowledge, and experience. In addition to base pay, most employees are eligible to participate in Epic‚Äôs generous benefit plans and discretionary incentive programs (subject to the terms of those plans or programs).
¬†
California Base Pay Range$148,000‚Äî$246,700 USDWashington Base Pay Range$141,300‚Äî$231,900 USD
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
PRODUCT MANAGEMENT
What We Do
For us, product management means thinking about behaviors of users and systematically questioning assumptions to find reasons, gaps, options, and solutions in creating impact on gamers, developers and creators. We strive to understand why things work (or don‚Äôt work), and to implement those findings with a purpose and elegance.
As a Product Manager at Epic you will be a vision holder for your team, collaborating with production, development, design and operations to build new products and services, processes and growth plans all in continuous alignment with a vision and strategic roadmap. You are responsible for driving better experience through disciplined analytics and experimentation with measurable goals. You will champion the vision and purpose of ‚ÄòWHY‚Äô for existing products. This includes services, onboarding/activation/live operations, and optimization for all processes and governance.
Below are 4 key responsibilities that all successful Product Managers have at Epic¬†

Define - Business requirements for articulating vision, strategy, definition of success, KPI, risks, and operational plan for both existing and new products and services.
Own - Product managers at Epic are responsible for guiding the development team through idea generation and discovery, representing the voice of the user in design and development, defining the go-to-market strategy, and iterating to propel adoption and growth. They own the vision, strategy, and definition of success, and adoption, and are responsible for aligning product priorities to the broader Epic vision.
Collaborate - Partner with development teams, publishing, and operations to drive alignment and stack hands on the best outcome for our users and the business. Balance strategic execution against the vision and the roadmap with purposeful and effective communication, humble and proactive attitude and an open mind.
Execute - Own the outcome for the product. Set and measure meaningful benchmarks that define success. Conduct qualitative and quantitative research to understand user needs to understand where we need to iterate and to identify new opportunities to enhance existing products. Be a champion for working smarter and finding ways to optimize how we work together.

Like what you hear so far? Let‚Äôs now dive into what exactly we are looking for...
What You'll Do
Epic Games seeks a Product Manager to build and evolve the user-facing storefront experience on the Epic Games Store. This role will report directly to the Director of Product overseeing Epic Games Store and will partner with peers across the consumer facing team. This role will be an integral member of the Consumer Experience development team, which builds products and features that make acquiring products on the Epic Games Store smooth, easy, and enjoyable. We own the outcome of a great experience for users and marketing partners.
In this role, you will

Own the initial user journey upon entry into the Epic Games Store, including both Discover and Browse experiences, with a goal of guiding users to the products they are looking for¬†
Collaborate with stakeholders to identify inefficiencies in internal processes and build new tools to improve the ability to communicate important information to users
Take accountability for the adoption and success of features and product, both internally and externally
Own and champion key product health metrics as a part of driving prioritization decisions
Detail stories with use cases, dependencies, acceptance criteria and scope of features
Maintain a live backlog, balancing the needs of internal and external stakeholders
Work with dev leads to ensure alignment with roadmap, and make adjustments as necessary
Understand user behavior patterns & trends to identify emerging opportunities that can be turned into industry-changing features

What we're looking for

You are passionate about doing the right thing, not afraid to say NO, and know how to take calculated risks to create maximum impact
You are passionate about the products you manage and how they bring value to your customers and the business
You see product development as a team effort, and thrive in a highly collaborative, agile, continuous discovery and continuous delivery mentality
You are skilled at working effectively with your product team, developer team, internal stakeholders, and partner teams; all across multiple time zones and countries
You have strong problem-solving skills and a willingness to roll up your sleeves to get things done
You demonstrate a strong ability to research, summarize, and prioritize customer business requirements
You are an excellent communicator, presenter, collaborator, and leader
Minimum of 3 years of experience as a Product Manager
You have a proven track record of driving product growth
Comfortable with Tableau or other data reporting and analysis tools
Comfortable with TargetProcess, ProductPlan, or similar backlog management tools

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.
Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
Pay Transparency Information
The expected annual base pay range(s) for this position are detailed below. Each base pay range is relevant only for individuals who are residents of or will be expected to work within the specified locale. Compensation varies based on a variety of factors, which include (but aren‚Äôt limited to) things such as skills and competencies, qualifications, knowledge, and experience. In addition to base pay, most employees are eligible to participate in Epic‚Äôs generous benefit plans and discretionary incentive programs (subject to the terms of those plans or programs).
Washington Base Pay Range$107,300‚Äî$176,000 USD
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Support subscription products and define appropriate strategies for product improvements, business growth, and player engagement.¬†
Work closely with cross-functional partners to design, implement, and optimize subscription product offerings.¬†¬†
Define measurable feature and initiative goals as well as create detailed business and product requirements that are used to guide design and technical specifications.
Collaborate with marketing and other consumer team partners on go-to-market strategies and execution for major content activations.
Collaborate with key partners in Item Shop and other related teams to align on trade-off decisions that maximize the player experience and overall business performance.

What we're looking for

8+ years of Product Management experience across games and/or subscription products, live operations, virtual economy management, and feature/system design.

title: Product Management Director, Identity
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
ONLINE INFRASTRUCTURE
What We Do
We enable Epic‚Äôs online services teams to build, deploy, and manage services that are used by more than half a billion players around the world. Our mission is to provide world class tools and platforms to improve the experience of our developers and make it easier, faster, and safer to build, operate, and scale their applications. We operate at massive scale as one of the largest cloud computing users in the world.
What You'll Do
Product management is both challenging and rewarding. As part of the Epic Online Services Identity team you‚Äôll be focused on enabling our players to create a common identity that they can make their own. One identity that persists across many games and experiences. An identity that is safe, personalized, and flexible enough to work with anyone anywhere, free of current gaming boundaries. This important pursuit requires empathy for our players as well as an analytical approach towards their actions. To better understand their needs and requirements you will study and reflect those learnings to the engineering teams so that we can experiment with well-considered solutions.¬†
For us, product management means considering behaviors and systematically questioning assumptions. We strive to understand how things work (or don‚Äôt work), and to implement those findings with simplicity and elegance. If that resonates with you, then we'd love to talk.
In this role, you will

Ideate, design and spec new and existing features for the EOS Identity Experiences across various products and games (including 3rd party)
Drive and own the outcome on initiatives with minimal direction/supervision
Collaborate with design and development teams to ship new experiences
Establish KPIs for product analytics that influence future roadmaps
Engage with 3rd parties to shape product roadmaps
Establish, guide, and modify product documentation
Consider & collaborate, build and improve

What we're looking for

Someone who is organized, able to work independently & with tight timelines
Experience working in a cross functional environment with engineering, design, QA, production and business stakeholders
Excellent communication, documentation writing and presentation skills
Experience shipping game related products with platform features
5-7 years of product management experience with multiple product releases

This position is listed in multiple locations in the United States and Canada.¬†

Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. Experience using a CRM or ticketing system

title: Senior QA Analyst
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
QUALITY ASSURANCE
What We Do
Epic Games is looking to expand its internal Quality Assurance team. We are looking for serious QA professionals with wide ranging skills and experience who want to work embedded on a development team.¬† This position owns the testing process, risk management, and quality evaluation of a given feature, function or set of work, where you will be part of a rapidly iterating development team working closely with developers and production.¬† If you're excited about working in a fast-paced environment and are highly motivated to ensure the best possible user experience, then we'd like to speak with you!
What You‚Äôll Do
In this role you will work closely with developers, product owners, and QA analysts on the quest team to collect and meet necessary quality criteria. The Fortnite Quests team is responsible for creating an engaging experience through the implementation of quests across storyline, seasonal events, special IP collaborations, cosmetics and much more. The role will cover testing of quest implementation, their reward distribution, and giving qualitative feedback to help find the fun in Fortnite. This role will also focus on working directly with designers and production to identify and report risk for your assigned features, ensure adequate coverage, work with internal and external test teams to execute on your test plans, and deliver a great player experience.
To be set up for success, the person in this role should have experience with end-to-end feature ownership and risk assessment while being flexible in a fast-paced environment.
In this role, you will

Work with product owners, developers and QA management to define acceptance criteria, identify risks, and plan testing coverage for upcoming quests and quest features.
Build test approaches and test plans in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
Conduct standard functional and qualitative testing on quests and quest-related assets in game and in engine.
Plan and conduct defect exploration and verification of quests and quest assets, including UI and IP requirements.
Help investigate and troubleshoot through complex systems, including grey/whitebox
Analyze and troubleshoot reported defects, internal issues within the product, and escalate quality issues.
Able to generate analysis of outstanding defect load and recommend new areas of testing, as well areas to prioritize fixes.
Proactively manage incoming defects and work autonomously on highest value tasks, be it test writing or test execution.

What we‚Äôre looking for:

3+ YOE in testing
2+ years in Quality Assurance
Experience working embedded in SDLC
Proven expertise in creating end-to-end test plans of a feature, identifying gaps in test coverage and root cause analysis
Ability to prioritize and work independently, as well as in a team environment
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Game development experience, working with multiple platforms, cross-platform testing, and Unreal Engine experience.

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.¬†
Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

title: Publishing QA Manager
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
What You'll Do
We‚Äôre looking for a QA Manager to own the QA process within the Epic Games Publishing (EGP) team. This person will lead the testing process for all EGP projects, including owning the testing strategy, test plans, vendor management, and partner relationships between multiple studios of developers and QA testing groups. We‚Äôre looking for an IC who wants to dig into complex problems and find innovative solutions at scale.
In this role, you will

Work with multiple external partners to plan out product level testing strategies for titles in later stages of development.
Build positive working relationships with key stakeholders across multiple external studios and testing groups.
Develop pass/fail criteria for different stages of development and provide highly detailed reporting and feedback on testing progress on a regular basis.
Work collaboratively with partners to develop detailed test plans for complex features and train external teams on how to test features effectively.
Develop and maintain best practices for QA tools for issue tracking, community bug reporting, automation, etc.
Build, maintain and evaluate relationships with multiple QA vendors.
Continually update internal QA documentation and up-skill production team members.

What we're looking for

Capability to manage and lead multiple external QA vendors to drive an exceptional level of service for our partners.
Formal QA certification, such as ISTQB or equivalent experience.
Experience in games development.
Hands-on experience with 1st party certification processes.¬†
Experience building and remotely leading large teams of external testers and creating test plans for large scale projects.
Keen business acumen to maintain multiple budgetary requirements on titles.
A deep understanding of defect reporting, version control, and configuration management best practices, along with different testing phase best practices and objectives (functional, system integration, UAT, performance).

This position is listed in multiple locations across North America and Europe including:
Anywhere, United Kingdom
Cary, North Carolina

Production
What We Do
Whether it‚Äôs driving a vision from start to finish or collaborating with teams to inspire and deliver projects of Epic quality, Epic‚Äôs production teams take pride in consistently delivering world-class products and experiences.
What You'll Do
Programming at Epic can be described as a collection of initiatives and workstreams being coordinated across multiple organizations and businesses at the company level. The Program Team is responsible for autonomously leading cross-functional teams to achieve project goals and requirements, from execution to outcomes. They work with project teams and stakeholders to plan, execute, monitor, and deliver the program as well as manage its resources, budget, cost, time, quality, risks and other constraints. Successful outcomes are achieved through the ideal mix of people, tools and process.
In this role, you will

Manage the development and implementation process of a company‚Äôs products and services.
Coordinate departmental or cross-functional teams, focusing on delivery of new or upgraded existing programs.¬†
Monitor the program from initiation through delivery including planning and directing schedules and monitoring budgets and spending.¬†
Organize cross-functional activities, ensuring program is on schedule, within budget constraints and followed through to completion.
Have the ability to manage specific, ongoing programs that require continuous improvements and fine tuning over time.

What we're looking for

Experience working within a matrix-type organization or knowledge of how one works
The ability to lead cross-functional teams to achieve project goals and requirements with no direct authority
Experience leading project kickoffs that are not confined by any vertical or business
Understanding what drives the consensus on priorities and prioritization of the program
Knowing how to effectively create and drive unification of communications, rituals, processes and roadmaps
Examples of execution and delivery on programs that supported and aligned with a company‚Äôs all up goals

What You'll Do
Epic Games is looking for an eDiscovery Associate Producer, to help plan, track, and communicate the various technical and legal tasks that our Forensics team takes on. Working with various project management & forensics tools and technologies, the candidate will help with the daily management of our Forensic processes and pipelines.
In this role, you will

Support Forensics in the creation, prioritization, and implementation of internal project initiatives.
Create, improve and maintain workspaces, databases, and documentation for all projects and tasks.¬†
Apply project management methodology and industry knowledge to all eDiscovery tasks, and be responsible for the coordination and progress tracking of all tasks.
Periodically provide project updates to key stakeholders in a timely fashion.
Collaborate with other teams to ensure discovery /investigations initiatives are tracked/actioned appropriately.
Ensure standard operating procedures for eDiscovery and litigation support initiatives are consistently applied.
Assist with various technical tasks when necessary to meet case deadlines / demands.

What we're looking for

2+ years project management experience with a specific concentration on legal support.
Understanding of the EDRM, E-Discovery concepts and associated technologies
Understanding and experience with forensic collection processes and analysis of data
Highly IT literate, and familiarity with using Windows/Unix command line tools.
Solid experience using standard productivity tools such as MS Office, Google Workspace, and ticketing systems such as JIRA, and Service Now.
Solid interpersonal and relationship building skills. Great communicator, with an ability to produce project documentation & status reports on-demand.
Experience problem solving, tracking priorities, and multitasking within a fast-paced agile environment.
Strong project and time management skills, with an ability to prioritize, solve problems, support multiple concurrent projects, and meet deadlines.
Experience with managing internal audits is desirable.

title: eDiscovery Producer
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
InfoSec
What We Do
Keep Epic‚Äôs networks, hardware, and people safe from security risks. Install security measures and operate software to protect systems and information infrastructure, including firewalls and encryption programs. Document issues as they arise and assess & report any impact caused.
What You'll Do
Epic Games is looking for an eDiscovery Associate Producer, to help plan, track, and communicate the various technical and legal tasks that our Forensics team takes on. Working with various project management & forensics tools and technologies, the candidate will help with the daily management of our Forensic processes and pipelines.
In this role, you will

Support Forensics in the creation, prioritization, and implementation of internal project initiatives.
Create, improve and maintain workspaces, databases, and documentation for all projects and tasks.¬†
Apply project management methodology and industry knowledge to all eDiscovery tasks, and be responsible for the coordination and progress tracking of all tasks.
Periodically provide project updates to key stakeholders in a timely fashion.
Collaborate with other teams to ensure discovery /investigations initiatives are tracked/actioned appropriately.
Ensure standard operating procedures for eDiscovery and litigation support initiatives are consistently applied.
Assist with various technical tasks when necessary to meet case deadlines / demands.

What we're looking for

2+ years project management experience with a specific concentration on legal support.
Understanding of the EDRM, E-Discovery concepts and associated technologies
Understanding and experience with forensic collection processes and analysis of data
Highly IT literate, and familiarity with using Windows/Unix command line tools.
Solid experience using standard productivity tools such as MS Office, Google Workspace, and ticketing systems such as JIRA, and Service Now.
Solid interpersonal and relationship building skills. Great communicator, with an ability to produce project documentation & status reports on-demand.
Experience problem solving, tracking priorities, and multitasking within a fast-paced agile environment.
Strong project and time management skills, with an ability to prioritize, solve problems, support multiple concurrent projects, and meet deadlines.
Experience with managing internal audits is desirable.

Working with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders, you will define social strategies, create and optimize campaigns and be responsible for identifying and advising on the ever growing social media landscape.
In this role, you will

Define and execute a clear strategy for all Unreal Engine social channels, establishing key themes, campaigns and messaging that is consistent with Unreal Engine‚Äôs go to market strategy and overarching brand

Owning, establishing, and driving creative social first initiatives related to Unreal Engine across all social media platforms
Optimizing existing Unreal Engine social media channels and establishing best practices, as well as identifying and launching new platforms and trends
Assisting and collaborating with creative services to develop innovative and authentic social media content, ensuring buy-in from internal stakeholders with timely execution
Managing relationships with social media platforms, external influencer partners and agencies
Participating in defining social budgets, strategy and executing paid social activations

Travel may be required
What we're looking for

3-5 years of experience in social media management
Ability to work full time in US EST time zone
Excellent understanding of social media marketing and proven ability to execute campaigns across marketing initiatives, including experience with multiple social media platforms
Outstanding written and verbal communication skills with an attention to detail
Data driven mindset, including ability to translate campaign results into actionable insights and optimizations (working with our analyst to develop key KPIs and reporting)
A keen understanding and awareness of industry trends and emerging platforms

title: Policy Lead, Trust & Safety
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
TRUST & SAFETY
What we do
The Epic Trust and Safety team provides a safer experience for Epic users. We work across multiple products and services to improve technology and craft transparent policies so our players and users can have positive experiences on our platforms.
What you‚Äôll do
As the Policy Lead for Trust & Safety at Epic, you will be a vision holder for your team, collaborating with production, development, design, and operations to build a global moderation team, develop standards and policy, implement processes and scalability plans in continuous alignment with a vision and strategic roadmap. You are responsible for driving the protection of the ecosystem through disciplined analytics and experimentation with measurable goals in all processes. You will enforce the vision and the policy for the existing community, contents, operation for all content moderation processes and governance.
In This Role You Will

Own - The content moderation internal and external policies, the operationalizing of said policies at the agent level. The Epic content moderation will cover all products and services of Epic
Collaborate - With stakeholders such as business, developers, community managers and operations to ensure continuous alignment balanced with strategic execution against the vision and the roadmap with purposeful and effective communication both formal and informal, with an open mind to listen carefully and decide the most important aspects of content moderation
Execute - Become a business owner for the results of the content moderation. Against KPIs, conduct overlapping, multivariate experiments, to better understand behavior patterns/trends, and iterate to enhance all areas of content moderation policy and its implementation in both services and processes. And identify new opportunities to enhance existing organizations, services, processes and policies

What We're Looking For

Experience as a content moderation director driving globally distributed team of internal resources as well as external resources especially in building
Drive improvements and optimization in teams, services, tools, processes and policies
10+ years of relevant work experience, in game industry or entertainment industries
Excellent communication and relationship building skills
Mentally strong and having a great emotional intelligence
Driven to build a great team
Passionate about doing the right thing, not afraid to say NO and knowing how to take calculated risks to create maximum impact

¬†
EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE

¬†

job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. TRUST & SAFETY
What we do
The Epic Trust and Safety team provides a safer experience for Epic users. We work across multiple products and services to improve technology and craft transparent policies so our players and users can have positive experiences on our platforms.
What you‚Äôll do
As the Policy Lead for Trust & Safety at Epic, you will be a vision holder for your team, collaborating with production, development, design, and operations to build a global moderation team, develop standards and policy, implement processes and scalability plans in continuous alignment with a vision and strategic roadmap. You are responsible for driving the protection of the ecosystem through disciplined analytics and experimentation with measurable goals in all processes. You will enforce the vision and the policy for the existing community, contents, operation for all content moderation processes and governance.
In This Role You Will

Own - The content moderation internal and external policies, the operationalizing of said policies at the agent level. The Epic content moderation will cover all products and services of Epic
Collaborate - With stakeholders such as business, developers, community managers and operations to ensure continuous alignment balanced with strategic execution against the vision and the roadmap with purposeful and effective communication both formal and informal, with an open mind to listen carefully and decide the most important aspects of content moderation
Execute - Become a business owner for the results of the content moderation. Against KPIs, conduct overlapping, multivariate experiments, to better understand behavior patterns/trends, and iterate to enhance all areas of content moderation policy and its implementation in both services and processes. And identify new opportunities to enhance existing organizations, services, processes and policies

What We're Looking For

Experience as a content moderation director driving globally distributed team of internal resources as well as external resources especially in building
Drive improvements and optimization in teams, services, tools, processes and policies
10+ years of relevant work experience, in game industry or entertainment industries
Excellent communication and relationship building skills
Mentally strong and having a great emotional intelligence
Driven to build a great team
Passionate about doing the right thing, not afraid to say NO and knowing how to take calculated risks to create maximum impact

¬†

title: GL Accountant
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
¬†
FINANCE AND ACCOUNTING
¬†
What We Do
Our Finance and Accounting teams build the financial infrastructure to scale our growing company. We combine analytical and strategic thinking to develop a sound financial future for our global brand. We work closely with teams across the company, international subsidiaries, as well as with external partners to ensure a world-class finance organization.¬† Our team contains experts from fields like tax, treasury, purchasing, FP&A, and more.¬†
¬†
What You‚Äôll Do
We are looking for an Accounting Manager (Responsable comptable in French) to manage a number of our subsidiaries based in France and the US. This person will join our growing International Finance team based in Paris, France and works alongside the Finance Team in Madrid, Spain, Singapore, Luzern, Switzerland and London, UK. The Finance Team are responsible for the accounting for the Epic Group‚Äôs subsidiaries in: China, Korea, Japan, Singapore, UK, Canada, Switzerland, Netherlands, France, Poland, Germany, Finland, Sweden, Spain, Slovakia, and Serbia.
You will work alongside existing members of the International Finance team and partner with them and others within Epic to deliver high quality financial reporting, day-to-day accounting and support ad-hoc finance related projects. This will include both financial reporting and operational topics to enable complete and accurate financial reporting at the US, EMEA and Statutory levels.
This is a critical role to enable Epic to continue to grow its finance and accounting presence within a key International market. The role will report into Epic‚Äôs International finance team (based throughout Europe) but will work closely with senior leadership within the wider Epic Group such as Corporate Tax, FP&A, HR and Legal.
In this role, you will

Ensure completeness, accuracy and quality in all areas of General Ledger accounting and financial reporting
Own the month end and year end financial closing activities for a number of subsidiaries (France and US)
Recording journal entries (timely and accurately)
Performing account reconciliations across GL accounts
Assisting with subsidiary cash flow forecasting, spend analysis, and expense coding
Assisting of members of the GL Accounting team on an as needed basis
Partner with the existing out-sourced accounting staff to ensure that there is a strong holistic view of accounting and finances, and that finances are managed, controlled and presented in a way that is representative of business operations
Management of the annual statutory audit requirements for the French subsidiaries
Collaborate regarding system and process enhancements including UAT when necessary
Fixed asset accounting and administration (including depreciation, asset tracking and leases)
Accrual and provision calculations and postings
VAT & Tax declarations, statistical report preparation and submissions
Intercompany reconciliations and mismatch corrections
Performing analytical reviews and trend analysis including understanding business strategy
Partner with cross functional teams to assist with the implementation a new ERP (Workday) with regional customization and support change management to associated front-end processes
Be the point-of-contact for any accounting or transactional queries from the Business
Involvement in finance and accounting projects.

What we‚Äôre looking for

5+ years financial accounting experience, preferably within both an International and French business and accounting environment
Bilingual in French and English is required
Already residing in France or a right to work in France
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent experience in Finance or Accounting, or a related field.
Chartered Accountancy qualification or equivalent (preferred but not required)
Good knowledge of both US GAAP, IFRS and French GAAP, including a deep knowledge and understanding of French tax and legal financial reporting obligations
Strong knowledge of General Ledger accounting processes and procedures
Team player and collaborative
Experience of dealing with External Auditor requests
Strong communications, presentation, and interpersonal skills, including the ability to summarize key accounting and operational issues to management.
Experience of working in different ERP systems (Workday is preferable)
Analytic problem solving skills
Someone who is user-focused, solutions-focused, and innovative
Highly proficient with Microsoft Excel (complex formula, VBA, macros and pivot tables) and proficient with other Microsoft Office applications
Excellent organizational and prioritization skills¬†
Ability to multitask and meet deadlines in a timely manner
Attention to detail, organization and experience in a fast-paced environment¬†¬†
Relevant education in finance, accounting or business administration
Independent and self-starter with a ‚Äúcan-do‚Äù attitude

¬†
EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our current benefits package includes supplemental basic medical, dental, vision and life insurance as well as disability.
We also offer an employee paid voluntary top up medical plan, and a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.
