title: Unreal Engine Programming Apprenticeship
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
About the Program
Epic Games Apprenticeships are designed to develop, support, and cultivate talent from alternative educational backgrounds and expand access to opportunities in interactive entertainment and 3D engine technology.
As an apprentice, you will be immersed in a year-long dynamic learning and working experience, paired with a strong network of mentors and embedded in a real-world development environment. You will be exposed to daily business at Epic, where you‚Äôll work on challenging projects focused on building real-world skills and competencies to ready you for the workforce.¬†
To ensure we can choose from among the broadest base of highly qualified talent, we encourage people from across the spectrum of communities and identities to apply for this position.
Career Path Overview
Programmers are the technical minds who power our games and 3D experiences. Whether it's world-building for players in Fortnite, high octane excitement in Rocket League, redefining reality in Unreal Engine, or escalating bizarre chaos in Fall Guys, our programming path has something for every game engine enthusiast. In this pathway at Epic, you will make impactful contributions to both internal and external tools, features and products that will be seen and used by hundreds of thousands of creators, developers, and engineers alike.¬†
What you‚Äôll learn and work on
Our teams create tools for content creators of Unreal Engine, Fortnite, Rocket League, and other games and applications from UI to Cinematics.
Apprentices joining this team will end up in one of three paths: Build Engineer or Procedural Tools Programmer or UI Programmer

Build Engineers help maintain, monitor, extend, and provide front-line support for projects utilizing the build farm at the company.
Procedural Tools Programmers build efficient & scalable tools to give technical and non-technical artists the tools to create large worlds and complex systems.
UI Programmers work closely with Artists and Designers to deliver clear and meaningful interactions for Fortnite players so they can focus on the fun.

The Required Application Materials

Resume detailing your software/game development experience [what did you build?, What language did you build it in?]¬†
A portfolio/Website/Links showcasing your software development or UI development work.
Cover letter or statement of interest indicating why you want to participate in the apprenticeship, personal career goals, learning experiences, and what you hope to get out of the program. Applications without the above will not be considered.

The Apprenticeship Journey

Step 1 - Apply! Applications will be accepted for this opportunity until February 14th, 2023.
Step 2 - Selected candidates will speak with a recruiting team member who will learn more about you and prepare you for the interview process.
Step 3 - Virtual interview with the hiring team week of 2/27. Successful candidates will move to the offer stage.
Step 4 - Pre-apprenticeship training. You will participate in a 18-week focused bootcamp to prepare for your first day at Epic.
Step 5 - Begin your paid work experience at Epic!¬†

Specific Tasks May Include
(Build Engineer)

Assist in maintaining the Epic Build Farm, monitoring performance, making improvements to the farm, fielding requests to add new jobs, fix, tweak jobs
Assist with UE Engine Release tasks & processes owned by the team
Maintain various build services owned by the team
Assist with Perforce branch creation - when requested

(Tools)

Design, implement and maintain procedural content generation code in UE.
Partner with UE5 team members to create and implement new engine extensions and features.
Improve existing features in the engine editor.
Investigate and fix bugs to improve the overall editor experience.

(UI)

Help ensure Fortnite‚Äôs front-end experiences are maintained and updated with new features
Work on deep-level systems and UI feature development both inside and outside of core gameplay
Dive into things like Social Features, Challenges, Battle Pass, Lobby, and Store
Collaborate with UX designers to ensure UI features are next level
Be accountable for features after shipping, including general bug fixes and iteration

¬†
Who We‚Äôre Looking For

Candidates age 18+ from non-traditional tech backgrounds, including but not limited to: coding bootcamp grads, candidates looking to re-enter the tech workforce, self-taught coders, or candidates without a Computer Science degree
You have some prior exposure to the concepts of programming, including a minimum of 6 months experience engineering/developing software with an object oriented programming language.
You are a proactive, fast learner who naturally leans into owning outcomes from start to finish.
Able to collaborate across disciplines ranging from technical to non technical.
You respond well to constructive feedback, a collaborative mindset, and you are flexible and responsive to change
You have strong verbal and non-verbal communication skills

¬†
Apprenticeship applications will be accepted until February 14th, 2023, Interviews begin on February 27th, 2023, with a¬†start date of March 27th 2023 if hired. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the posting location for the duration of the apprenticeship. Employment sponsorship is not available for this position. For more information about Epic Early Career opportunities, visit epicgames.com/earlycareers. ¬†
This is going to be Epic!
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

title: Senior Technical Designer in Animation
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
ENGINEERING - GAMES
What We Do
Unreal projects have been leading the pack of real-time entertainment with our constantly growing team of engineering experts.¬† We‚Äôre always improving on the tools and technology that empower content developers worldwide.
What You'll Do
Epic Games is searching for a highly experienced Senior or Lead Technical Designer in Animation to join our team working on Fortnite. As a Technical Designer in Animation, you will use your animation sense and technical understanding of character animation to design and create animation systems that facilitate realistic and high quality motion. Working with animation, design, and engineering colleagues, you will develop new tools and/or refine existing ones to ensure the animation/behavior pipeline operates smoothly and efficiently. You will also help identify potential issues and deploy correct solutions, using your technical knowledge to help bridge and facilitate communication between the animation team and other departments, such as engineering and design.
In This Role You Will

Facilitate the creation of animation behavior tools/techniques/philosophies that allow the building of complex movement systems in a manner accessible by content creators
Design and implement animation state machines/behaviors and runtime solutions
Look for opportunities to improve the animation pipeline/workflow and help provide solutions for technical animation problems, including performing training and creating documentation for the animation team
Analyze, troubleshoot, and solve in-game animation implementation issues and animation-related technical challenges
Closely collaborate with the animation leadership to maintain the style and quality bar for animations in the game

What We're Looking For

A strong animation sense and a clear understanding of character motion and how to achieve it with modern animation methods
A good understanding of the animation pipeline, including source content creation tools such as Maya and the export process into a game engine
Knowledge of how to combine animations to create good-looking motion
At least 10 years of experience with AAA game development in a similar role, preferably on a large team using an established game engine (internal or commercial); experience with Unreal Engine is a plus
Familiarity with modern animation behavior tools and concepts, such as blend trees and state machines; experience with Unreal Engine Animation Blueprints is a plus
Good communication and collaboration skills, especially with team members from other disciplines; leadership skills and experience leading a team is a plus
User-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative. These traits equal success at Epic and influence everything we do

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. title: Apple Platform Programmer
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
What You'll Do
We are looking for an Apple Platform Programmer passionate about creating world-class, industry leading game engine technologies, targeting the full spectrum of Apple platforms. You‚Äôll work with the latest in Apple software and hardware offerings to design and implement platform APIs, guide cross-platform API development, and create robust platform toolchains as required by the demands of a variety of both gaming and non-gaming related projects. If you're an experienced engineer looking for an opportunity to grow and contribute to our engine and feature development across all of Apple‚Äôs platforms, we want to talk to you!
In this role, you will

Implement and improve various low-level systems that interface with platform APIs, i.e. memory allocators (physical and virtual), file systems, input systems, graphics APIs (Metal), shader compilers, etc.
Analyze and continuously strive to solve and optimize problems related to a modern game engine (load times, memory usage and platform specific performance issues)
Make improvements to platform toolchains, i.e. compiler/linker support, deployment to device, SDK upgrades, platform specific data management tools, debugger integration, crash reporting, etc.
Help us embrace, support, extend and enhance our engine for future hardware.
Support external customers

What we‚Äôre looking for

Strong programming background and C++ knowledge
Experience with a broad range of engineering areas in shipping games or real-time visualization systems, with special attention given to low-level code and deep optimization
Experience with OS level systems on macOS
Well-versed in software engineering principles, especially API design
Familiarity with an existing game engine with an understanding of engine and editor concepts
Familiarity with development tools and profiling on modern systems, including Instruments, Xcode GPU frame capture and profiling
Experience developing in a large codebase at a fast pace, making trade-offs between usability, performance, and power
Prior shipped projects with UE4 is a plus

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.¬†
Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
Pay Transparency Information
The expected annual base pay range(s) for this position are detailed below. Each base pay range is relevant only for individuals who are residents of or will be expected to work within the specified locale. Compensation varies based on a variety of factors, which include (but aren‚Äôt limited to) things such as skills and competencies, qualifications, knowledge, and experience. In addition to base pay, most employees are eligible to participate in Epic‚Äôs generous benefit plans and discretionary incentive programs (subject to the terms of those plans or programs).
California Base Pay Range$117,200‚Äî$195,300 USD
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

title: Senior Engine Programmer, UEFN
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
ENGINEERING
What We Do
Unreal projects have been leading the pack of real-time entertainment with our constantly growing team of engineering experts. We‚Äôre always improving on the tools and technology that empower content developers worldwide.
What You‚Äôll Do
As part of the Fortnite Team you‚Äôll be working on an ambitious new project that aims to deliver content and experiences faster and in more flexible ways.
Using the tools and pipelines of Unreal Engine, you‚Äôll work on all aspects of the core engine technology behind a cutting-edge on-demand user generated content system. This platform will have the capability to deliver content to millions of users, within minutes of it being published.
Most importantly you‚Äôll work with a creative, energetic, and fun team to continue making Fortnite one of the most popular and engaging gaming experiences in the world!
In this role, you will

Design and implement new engine runtime features for Fortnite, and the Unreal Engine itself
Design and implement APIs and supporting tools as required by the demands of the project.
Optimize both memory and performance in systems that have to scale from high-end to mobile systems
Analyze and fix common problems in a game engine such as load times, memory usage, and performance problems
Contribute to the broader design and implementation of the whole project

What we‚Äôre looking for

Excellent C++ experience, and familiarity with scripting systems like Blueprint, Lua, Python, etc.
Experience in a broad range of engineering areas on shipping games or real time visualization systems, with special attention given to low-level code and deep optimization
Well-versed in software engineering principles, especially API design
Experience in a cross-disciplinary development environment with excellent communication skills. You should be able to communicate and explain trade-offs with non-engineers!
Experience with an existing game engine and editor concepts. UE4 or UE5 would be nice to have.
Fearless attitude to making deep and profound changes to an existing engine to provide paradigm shifting improvements that change the world
Experience developing in a large codebase at a fast pace, making trade-offs between usability, performance, and power

This position is listed in multiple locations across North America and Europe including:
Vancouver, CanadaCary, North CarolinaLondon, United Kingdom
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

title: Senior Cloud Engineer, Infrastructure Engineering
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

ONLINE INFRASTRUCTURE
What We Do
We enable Epic‚Äôs online services teams to build, deploy, and manage services that are used by more than half a billion players around the world. Our mission is to provide world class tools and platforms to improve the experience of our developers and make it easier, faster, and safer to build, operate, and scale their applications. We operate at a massive scale as one of the largest cloud computing users in the world.
What You'll Do
As a Senior Cloud Software Engineer in the Infrastructure Engineering organization you will work on the Cloud Developer Platform and Interfaces that enable streamlined application and service development on top of our Cloud Infrastructure. As a customer centric engineering organization, you‚Äôll work closely with our customers ensuring fast turn around of feature requests and bug fixes. You will be working on capabilities that will reduce engineering effort to provision, deploy, configure, update and repair activities during the lifecycle of an application, game or service running on our cloud infrastructure. You will work with multiple teams across the globe and help us to continue evolving as a center of excellence both for Cloud Infrastructure as well as Online Game Developer Experience. We are a dev+ops style organization practicing, ‚Äúyou build it, you run it‚Äù for all capabilities that we offer.
In this role, you will¬†

Work as part of our global network control plane team developing automation that will focus on making it easier for our developers to get the connectivity they need in AWS
Develop high quality, stable code for use in web services, libraries and tools
Write and publish RFCs, design specifications and developer documentation
Problem solve at every layer of the technology stack
Participate in bottom up planning around release schedules, workload and priority
Design for privacy, security, compliance, high availability, performance and resilience across all web services and infrastructure capabilities

What we‚Äôre looking for

In-depth experience in Golang, or other languages like Java, C/C++, or Rust
Excellent understanding of AWS networking components
Good understanding of network principles
Extensive knowledge of working with AWS and Kubernetes solutions like EKS

ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.

ONLINE INFRASTRUCTURE
What We Do
We enable Epic‚Äôs online services teams to build, deploy, and manage services that are used by more than half a billion players around the world. Our mission is to provide world class tools and platforms to improve the experience of our developers and make it easier, faster, and safer to build, operate, and scale their applications. We operate at a massive scale as one of the largest cloud computing users in the world.
What You'll Do
As a Lead Engineer in the Infrastructure Engineering organization you will lead the Network Control Plane team working on the Cloud Developer Platform and Interfaces that enable streamlined application and service development on top of our Cloud Infrastructure. This is a part leadership, part hands on role requiring you to be able to write code as well as manage your team. As a customer centric engineering organization, you‚Äôll work closely with our customers ensuring fast turn around of feature requests and bug fixes. You will be working on capabilities that will reduce engineering effort to provision, deploy, configure, update and repair activities during the lifecycle of an application, game or service running on our cloud infrastructure. You will work with multiple teams across the globe and help us to continue evolving as a center of excellence both for Cloud Infrastructure as well as Online Game Developer Experience. We are a dev+ops style organization practicing, ‚Äúyou build it, you run it‚Äù for all capabilities that we offer.
In this role, you will¬†

Lead the global network control plane team developing automation that will focus on making it easier for our developers to get the connectivity they need in AWS
Manage a small team of engineers delivering and supporting the automation required to maintain our networking in AWS
Develop high quality, stable code for use in web services, libraries and tools
Write and publish RFCs, design specifications and developer documentation
Problem solve at every layer of the technology stack
Participate in bottom up planning around release schedules, workload and priority
Design for privacy, security, compliance, high availability, performance and resilience across all web services and infrastructure capabilities

What we‚Äôre looking for

Experience managing and developing a small team of talented engineers
In-depth experience in Golang, or other languages like Java, C/C++, or Rust
Excellent understanding of AWS networking components
Good understanding of network principles
Extensive knowledge of working with AWS and Kubernetes solutions like EKS

ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

title: DevOps Engineer
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
Information Technology
What We Do
Create and maintain a proactive and stable IT environment as well as provide IT support to our Epic people. You will be empowered to shape processes that deliver optimized IT service across our business. Work with emerging technologies while enabling IT success for everyone.
What You'll Do
Epic Games is growing operations inside our IT team to support the development and operations of core Epic services. The person in this role will work closely with our Unreal Engine teams and our build team to grow and develop products within the Unreal Engine ecosystem, Epic‚Äôs internal build services, with the goal of enhancing the user experience for everyone at Epic. We are seeking a results-oriented DevOps Architect who has helped teams scale through production insights, developer guidance, real-time metrics, and of course automation. 
In this role, you will

Design and implement hybrid cloud infrastructure to support multiple game development pipelines
Partner with our development teams to design and deploy scalable build solutions
Design systems that cleanly integrate with both legacy and emerging technologies
Provide technical leadership and help improve devops processes; sometimes providing technical oversight and mentorship to other engineers on the team
Lead and influence the architectural design of systems by validating solutions, determining quality, and adhering to repeatable standards
Provide escalation level troubleshooting and timely resolution of system, network, and infrastructure problems

What we're looking for

7+ years of previous experience as a software architect, developer, or engineer
5+ years expertise in designing, analyzing & troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems
5+ years experience with cloud technologies; including AWS and Kubernetes
3+ years experience with infrastructure as code, configuration management, and continuous integrations tools (e.g. Ansible, Terraform, Packer, Jenkins, and Codefresh)
Ability to define and execute initiatives to reduce failures, troubleshoot issues across the entire infrastructure stack, expand monitoring capabilities, and manage technical operations
Demonstrable experience with a variety of scripting languages for automating tasks, generating reports, and creating tools (e.g. Powershell, Go, NodeJS, .NET)
Understanding of microservice, API-driven, and event-driven application design
Previous experience implementing continuous delivery and DevOps solutions
Proven experience with Windows, MacOS, and Linux platforms
Proficiency in .Net or Go
History of working with automation

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.¬†
Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!

title: UI/UX Design Apprenticeship
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
UI/UX Design Apprenticeship
About the Program
Epic Games Apprenticeships are designed to develop, support, and cultivate talent from alternative educational backgrounds and expand access to opportunities in interactive entertainment and 3D engine technology.
As an apprentice, you will be immersed in a year-long dynamic learning and working experience, paired with a strong network of mentors and embedded in a real-world development environment. You will be exposed to daily business at Epic, where you‚Äôll work on challenging projects focused on building real-world skills and competencies to ready you for the workforce.¬†
To ensure we can choose from among the broadest base of highly qualified talent, we encourage people from across the spectrum of communities and identities to apply for this position.
¬†
Career Path Overview¬†¬†
This apprenticeship will focus on the UI/UX discipline, pursuing either Technical UI or UX Design. Designers are the creative minds that power our products and help shape the future of interactive entertainment at Epic.¬†

Tech UI Designers help execute UX and UI's vision in the engine.¬†¬†¬†
UX Designers define the screen layouts, interactions and flows that make up the ‚Äúuser experience‚Äù for players.¬†

¬†
What You‚Äôll Learn and Work on
Apprentices will learn how to help implement UI and system-focused thinking in the Unreal Engine with UMG. This includes blueprint scripting, UMG layout building, possible C++ coding, and creating materials. You will work alongside UI Artists, UX Designers, UI Engineers, and fellow Tech UI Designers, with a dynamic team to help ship features to millions of players around the world.
¬†
Specific Tasks May Include

Assist Tech UI Designers in implementing UI features.
Translate designs into reusable and modular UMG components
Work with UX & UI Art to identify UI implementation needs and pass those onto engineering.
Work alongside engineers, artists, game designers, and UX researchers to redesign existing features
Translate goals and constraints into compelling player-facing features by conducting user research and brainstorming solutions to challenging problems.
Create wireframes, interactive prototypes, and documentation for multiple platforms and inputs
Present and pitch new designs to various stakeholders.

¬†
Who We‚Äôre Looking for

Candidates age 18+ from non-traditional tech backgrounds, including but not limited to: coding bootcamp grads, candidates looking to re-enter the tech workforce, self-taught coders, or candidates without a UX degree.
You are a proactive, fast learner who naturally leans into owning outcomes from start to finish.
Able to collaborate across disciplines ranging from technical to non technical.
You respond well to constructive feedback
You demonstrate a collaborative mindset
You‚Äôre flexible and responsive to change
You have strong verbal and non-verbal communication skills
You understand fundamental visual design concepts

¬†
The Apprenticeship Journey

Step 1 - Apply! Applications will be accepted for this opportunity until February 14th, 2023.
Step 2 - Selected candidates will speak with a recruiting team member who will learn more about you and prepare you for the interview process.
Step 3 - Virtual interview with the hiring team will take place on Friday, March 3rd, 2023.. Successful candidates will move to the offer stage.
Step 4 - Pre-apprenticeship training. You will participate in a 18-week focused bootcamp to prepare for your first day at Epic.
Step 5 - Begin your work experience at Epic!¬†

¬†
The Required Application Materials

Resume
Cover letter or statement of interest indicating why you want to participate in the apprenticeship, personal career goals, learning experiences, and what you hope to get out of the program. Applications without this will not be considered.

Apprenticeship applications will be accepted until February 14th, 2023, targeting a start date in early spring 2023. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the posting location for the duration of the apprenticeship. Employment sponsorship is not available for this position. For more information about Epic Early Career opportunities, visit epicgames.com/earlycareers. ¬†
This is going to be Epic!
¬†
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. title: Environment Outsource Lead
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
ART
What We Do
Push your artistic talent to the limit on a team of world-class environment, character and concept artists who strive to innovate and inspire.
What You'll Do
Epic Games is searching for an experienced Outsourcing Lead to support and supervise creative content provided by outsource partners. The outsource Lead will provide front-line creative feedback for work submitted for Epic review
Though the role will be mainly supervisory, the individual should be an experienced artist, having worked in game studio pipelines before, and have a solid hands-on art background.¬†
The ideal candidate would be a talented artist who is able to communicate with outsource partners, including documenting existing pipelines, collecting or creating bench mark and technical example assets, collecting photo reference, creating asset blockouts, creating simple blockout paint overs, and finally packaging all files to send off to the external artists. 
In this role, you will

Work with the Lead and Director level to establish visual direction for our outsourcing vendors.
Collect or generate detailed documentation, video reference, and examples of art asset production, procedures, and engine requirements to support the external vendors.
Clearly communicating feedback to the outsource partner, and ensuring those creative notes and goals are met. Informing leadership in the event that isn‚Äôt happening.¬†
Communicate cross-discipline with artists, level designers, game designers, and production to understand needs and goals of props being created.
Make any needed fixes to keep assets consistent and technically game ready as they‚Äôre handed off from the outsource partner.
Provide prototype meshes with accurate scale and pivot placement, with understanding of the technical constraints, including vert count management, material setup, and PBR texture creation.

What we're looking for

Experience in shipping AAA titles across multiple platforms.
Experienced shipping production assets for games, specifically within the Environment discipline.
Strong understanding of latest toolsets in game art creation. Including but not limited to, Unreal Engine, Substance Painter, Marmoset, Perforce, and 3D modeling packages.
Must be highly organized, self-driven, customer focused, and a great team player.
Ability to critique, mentor, and improve art through written feedback loops.
A keen understanding of technical hurdles, ability to autonomously make choices to further art quality, and excellent communication skills are a must.
Experienced working within a team and a high pressure production environment.
User-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative. These traits equal success at Epic and influence everything we do.

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents. Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.

Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

ADMINISTRATION
What We Do
Our Administrative team plays a key role in Epic's success by providing administrative, scheduling, organizational support, and more to our senior leadership.
What You'll Do
Epic Games seeks multiple Executive Assistants to support their leadership teams.
In this role, you will

Calendar management and meeting scheduling
Booking travel arrangements, including flights, hotels, rental cars, and taxis
Submitting and reconciling expense reports
Providing general support to visitors, including booking conference rooms, organizing catering, completing NDAs, compiling agendas, and scheduling meetings
Working with finance and legal teams to execute contracts and pay invoices
Ability to handle sensitive information in a confidential manner
Maintaining contact lists
Take accurate minutes of meetings, and follow up on action items
Assisting in the preparation of regularly scheduled reports
Event planning for offsite meetings and team events

What we're looking for

Proven experience as an executive assistant or other relevant administrative / managerial support experience
Excellent time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work
Attention to detail and problem solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Able to meet deadlines in a fast-paced, quickly changing environment
Proficient in Excel, Word, and calendaring software
At least 4 years of experience as an Executive Assistant
Experience working in gaming, entertainment, technology, or communications fields is preferred
College degree, preferred

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents. Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
¬†
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.
Like what you hear? Come be a part of something Epic!
Epic Games deeply values diverse teams and an inclusive work culture, and we are proud to be an Equal Opportunity employer. Learn more about our Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Policy here.

title: Business Development Manager
job_description:
WHAT MAKES US EPIC?
At the core of Epic‚Äôs success are talented, passionate people. Epic prides itself on creating a collaborative, welcoming, and creative environment. Whether it‚Äôs building award-winning games or crafting engine technology that enables others to make visually stunning interactive experiences, we‚Äôre always innovating.
Being Epic means being a part of a team that continually strives to do right by our community and users. We‚Äôre constantly innovating to raise the bar of engine and game development.
BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT | UNREAL ENGINE
What We Do
Unreal Engine‚Äôs BD team helps customers across verticals maximize their adoption of Unreal Engine and related products towards a robust and vibrant Metaverse.
What You'll Do
This role will strategically develop business with key Games accounts by maximizing the value of UE for partners on existing projects and driving further adoption of UE (and other Epic tools and services) across those key accounts. The essence of this job is to make UE and partnership with Epic invaluable to the world‚Äôs best game developers and publishers. The BDM will serve as the glue that connects partner needs to UE‚Äôs capabilities and to Epic Games as a whole.¬†
BDMs don‚Äôt provide reactive support and their involvement with key accounts is not transactional. They are engaged in an ongoing manner and proactively work with UE licensees to deeply understand the unique needs of their projects and strategically gain line of sight to future needs/projects (including sister studios within parent organizations). SBDMs materially improve the finished product by marrying their knowledge of customer needs with their insight into features/roadmap of UE (and other Epic tools and services). They assure that partners are maximizing their use of UE, even in ways and on projects they might not have previously considered.
Given that this is a new discipline, the BDM will have to thrive with ambiguity, excel at creating new processes that fit into existing frameworks, and then be able to scale those new processes across a broader set of accounts. Ideally, the BDM will also have the potential to manage a team of BDMs should the need arise to further resource this discipline.
In This Role You Will

Be the voice of Epic with major partners and key accounts
Maximize value of UE to key accounts by marrying partner needs to UE/Epic capabilities
Be the subject matter expert on some of Epic‚Äôs biggest partners: gather critical intelligence and report internally on partner needs, dev cycles, network of sister studios, tech decision process, concerns etc.
Determine relationship plan, drive ongoing efforts to educate, train and keep key accounts up to date with everything UE and Epic as a whole
Drive internal key account review process
Strategically identify and maximize opportunities to drive further adoption of UE within key accounts
Serve as voice of key accounts internally to support, engine team, and UE execs
Serve as key bridge between (i) key accounts and Epic, (ii) BD and Support

What We're Looking For

Prior experience with all categories of game developers; from AAA and AA to Indie and Mobile.
Experience in a sales or business development capacity working with the game developer community in the Americas
Highly motivated, goal oriented, self starter capable of working at a high level in a team or on their own
Management experience within high growth organizations
Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively work with a variety of positions and functions within and outside the organization
Intimate knowledge of the games community in the Americas
Strong connections in the games community
Experience negotiating with international organizations
Proficiency in any other languages is a plus
You‚Äôre user-focused, passionate, scrappy, solutions-focused, and innovative. These traits equal success at Epic and influence everything we do.

EPIC JOB + EPIC BENEFITS = EPIC LIFE
Our intent is to cover all things that are medically necessary and improve the quality of life. We pay 100% of the premiums for both you and your dependents. Our coverage includes Medical, Dental, a Vision HRA, Long Term Disability, Life Insurance & a 401k with competitive match. We also offer a robust mental well-being program through Modern Health, which provides free therapy and coaching for employees & dependents.¬†
Throughout the year we celebrate our employees with events and company-wide paid breaks. We offer unlimited PTO and sick time and recognize individuals for 7 years of employment with a paid sabbatical.
ABOUT US
Epic Games spans across 19 countries with 55 studios and 4,500+ employees globally. For over 25 years, we‚Äôve been making award-winning games and engine technology that empowers others to make visually stunning games and 3D content that bring environments to life like never before. Epic‚Äôs award-winning Unreal Engine technology not only provides game developers the ability to build high-fidelity, interactive experiences for PC, console, mobile, and VR, it is also a tool being embraced by content creators across a variety of industries such as media and entertainment, automotive, and architectural design. As we continue to build our Engine technology and develop remarkable games, we strive to build teams of world-class talent.

title: Unannounced Project Associate Production Engineer (New Grad / Early-in-Career)
job_description:
Production Engineers are force multipliers who use their expertise across Bungie systems and their passion for supporting others to augment the studio's effectiveness at shipping high quality content. As a Production Engineer, you will identify improvements to our workflows and unblock and provide desk-side support to content creators often on tight deadlines. You will use this experience both to be an advocate for content creators to the Engineering org for long-term solutions and in the meantime to find workable short-term solutions to get things humming again. You will also document new knowledge and learn deeply about the various systems at play in how Bungie makes amazing games.
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS

A recent graduate from a U.S. college, university, or related program within 12 months from October 2022
Planning to graduate in Fall 2022 through Spring 2023

OR

Moving from primarily learning to primarily working within 12 months
Transitioning from one craft, function, or discipline to a new one within 12 months

RESPONSIBILITIES

Solve unexpected and difficult problems in unfamiliar areas, often in times of crisis
Support a small team or area in day-to-day work
Identify workflow and process improvements
Test and verify usability of in-development workflows
Implement game content as appropriate
Create and maintain documentation on proprietary tool sets

REQUIRED SKILLS

Service-oriented mentality. (You get joy from seeing others succeed.)
Quick learner in unfamiliar areas
Demonstrated autonomy and proactivity
Ability to communicate with technical and non-technical developers
Experience with Windows command line and Microsoft Office products, especially Excel
Experience with source control software, especially Perforce
Demonstrated ability to break a process down into its individual steps and think about how to address each one, especially how to tell a computer to address each one

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS

Training in scripting or object-oriented programming (or equivalent experience) or training in game art or game design workflows (or equivalent experience)
Customer service experience, especially desk-side technical support experience
Familiarity with Digital Content Creation applications (3DS Max, Maya, Photoshop, Wwise)
Familiarity with game development suites (Unity, Unreal)
Familiarity with end user UR or UX best practices

Listed below is this role's base pay range. In other locations that Bungie has approved for remote work, this pay range may be adjusted up to +/- 10% and some roles may be classified as non-exempt (hourly).¬†This range is determined by an array of factors, including training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs, and market demands. Additionally, it is subject to change and may be modified in the future.¬†In the journey to make incredible worlds, Bungie employees don't simply do meaningful work - they receive meaningful support. Competitive salaries and discretionary bonus opportunities are just the start. We offer comprehensive healthcare coverage, generous 401(k) matching, flexible time off policies, paid parental leave, social clubs, and so much more. ¬†

20 days of accrued time-off in the form of PTO and sabbatical days, depending on the level of the position
10 paid Floating Days annually, prorated in the first year of employment based on start date
10 paid Bungie-observed holidays annually
One hour of Paid Sick Time (PST) for every 30 hours worked¬†

Familiarity with project management with sensitivity to time and deadline driven workflow
Collaborative, team-oriented work style
Must be able to handle a variety of multiple changing priorities in a dynamic environment

Game experience desired but not essential

title: MBA Product Management Intern
job_description:
As a Product Management MBA Summer Intern at Bungie, you will develop product strategy and help build the roadmap for Destiny 2. You will conduct industry research, draw insights, craft and communicate recommendations to stakeholders, and help prioritize new content and features that grow our player base and revenue.
In this role you will be embedded in the Product Management discipline, reporting to the Principal Product Manager for Destiny 2 Seasons. You will work closely with Product Managers as well as Analytics, Consumer Insights, Development, Marketing, and Publishing teams.
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS

Currently enrolled in a U.S. college, university, or related program and returning to school in the fall upon conclusion of the internship
Available to work full-time for 12 weeks throughout the summer with a set May or June start date

RESPONSIBILITIES

Conduct competitive product research, identify key differentiators, insights, and best practices, and translate findings into actionable feature recommendations for Destiny 2
Build expertise in industry-leading first-time user experience and player on-boarding features, and recommend updates to the Destiny 2 new player experience based on your findings
Define new game features for Destiny 2 that grow the player base in key markets and demographics, and build alignment with stakeholders to prioritize these features
Develop strategy and guard rails to guide expressions of the Destiny IP and franchise
Learn, have fun, and help evolve a game that millions of people love to play

REQUIRED SKILLS

Currently enrolled in a Master‚Äôs in Business Administration or equivalent degree program
Excellent problem-solving, critical thinking, and analytical skills. Comfortable deriving insights and recommendations from data
Familiarity with business frameworks and their application to ambiguous problem spaces
Adept at balancing multiple concurrent projects through effective delivery, prioritization, stakeholder management, and time management
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to influence partners and stakeholders through clear, concise documentation and presentations
Desire to learn and grow professionally, and openness to feedback and improvement
Familiarity with the gaming industry, and interest in product and data optimization in gaming
Experience with the Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) or equivalent applications

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS

Familiarity with the Destiny franchise and/or Destiny 2
Passion for any of the following: first person shooters, live service games, collection- and progression-based (grinding) games

title: Gameplay Design ‚Äì Abilities Intern
job_description:
Do you love the challenge of designing great action gameplay?‚ÄØ Do you obsess over core game feel like camera FOV and shake changes, controller rumble values, ability and weapon synergies, and other behind-the-scenes mechanics? Are you excited to do the hard work of generating alignment across a large team, and taking them along for the journey through development?‚ÄØ Are you a game designer looking to work on AAA games with talented and passionate people in a team environment? If so, we have the job for you! Bungie is looking for a passionate, creative and hard-working Gameplay Design Intern for Destiny.
As a Gameplay Design Intern, you will work closely with the entire Design Team designing, crafting, and implementing a robust sandbox of gameplay systems and content. You will collaborate with team members from other disciplines to drive a holistic gameplay experience. You will contribute to the design processes to ensure your work is the very best it can possibly be.
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS

Currently enrolled in a U.S. college, university, or related program and returning to school in the fall upon conclusion of the internship
Available to work full-time for 12 weeks throughout the summer with a set May or June start date

RESPONSIBILITIES

Help build compelling second-to-second gameplay experiences
Learn from the Destiny Abilities team on what it takes to take an ability from Concept to Ship
Collaborate on design, implementation, and balancing of Destiny Abilities
Make the gameplay experience accessible to as many people as possible
Work with audio, effects and animation artists to make in-game cause and effect clear to players
Execute on features that match the creative direction of the game

title: Data Engineer Intern
job_description:
Have you ever transformed billons of rows of data into clean resources? Do you want to? Data Engineering at Bungie gives you the opportunity to move data from game activity logs to transformed actionable insights.As a Data Engineer Intern at Bungie, you will learn to develop and support robust data systems that scale with our games and internal processes. You will learn the nuances of data from various systems (gameplay, marketing, HR, etc.) and help transform that raw data into actionable insights. You will work daily with analysts, designers, and other engineers to understand how we can help to build experiences that our players want. Most importantly, you will work with a fun, collaborative team committed to making the amazing games!
ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS

Currently enrolled in a U.S. college, university, or related program and returning to school in the fall upon conclusion of the internship
Available to work full-time for 12 weeks throughout the summer with a set May or June start date

RESPONSIBILITIES

Build and enhance Python and SQL code to create an ELT pipeline in a cloud database environment
Use SQL to translate new and existing game features from business request to internal, actionable reporting resources
Learn to monitor, enhance, and add quality checks to a live data pipeline that processes millions of rows per day
Communicate with analysts, product managers, and designers about designed data models and how best to action our robust data sources

REQUIRED SKILLS

Understand the components required to ETL (extract, transform, and load) data into a destination from a known source.
Experience with SQL or Python
Ability to collaborate via code reviews and regular stand-ups with a small team
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Flexibility: ability to adjust and adapt to changing needs, priorities, and requests

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS

Experience with a shared code repository, such as git
Interest in the gaming industry

title: Senior Data Scientist ‚Äì Machine Learning (Social)
job_description:
Bungie is seeking a Senior Data Scientist to join our newly formed Machine Learning team.¬† Reporting to the Director of Machine Learning, you will scope, prototype, and deploy machine learning models that will support social initiatives across our organization.¬† In this role, you will directly support Bungie social teams by building knowledge graphs in order to extract insights that drive the future of co-experience in our games.
As part of the Bungie Analytics & Insights team, you will join a diverse team of analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and researchers.¬† You will leverage your expertise in data analysis, data science, and engineering to build machine learning services for our games and create internal tools that empower Bungie teams to continue doing what they do best. Most importantly, your work will be essential to creating unmatched entertainment experiences designed to inspire friendships and lifelong memories.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Work with partners across the organization, gathering requirements, designing project plans, determining approaches, and defining success criteria for machine learning solutions
Develop, deploy, and maintain machine learning services end-to-end in a cloud environment

Communicate the results of your analyses to both technical and non-technical colleagues

REQUIRED SKILLS

Experience working within cloud-based infrastructure to build, deploy, and manage models at scale in a live service environment
Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL
Advanced knowledge of machine learning frameworks such as scikit-learn, PyTorch, and Tensorflow
Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical models: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.
Effective at data visualization and storytelling geared towards both technical and non-technical audiences
Familiarity with graph data science algorithms and graph databases (Neo4j, AWS Neptune)

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS

Advanced degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning, or a related field
Experience working within a variety of different technical environments
Experience with Tableau or similar data visualization tool
A love of games

title: Senior Application Security Engineer
job_description:
Would you like to work on awe-inspiring worlds that bring people together, with supportive industry talent, at a company that values work-life balance and is invested in creating an inclusive workplace for every employee? Are you serious about game security? ¬†Do you love digging into machine code? ¬†Are you keen to build up the walls that keep bad actors out of our games? ¬†At Bungie, we build worlds that inspire friendships, and the Product Security Team exists to keep those worlds and our players safe.¬†
As an Application Security (AppSec) Engineer, you will design and maintain our anti-cheat protections and detections. ¬†You will become an expert in these systems and a resource for our analysts in their hunt for malefactors. ¬†You will work with customers on our game teams to identify current and future security needs and identify workable solutions, and you will be a resource for our gameplay engineers and designers, helping them ensure fair and honest gameplay.¬†
RESPONSIBILITIES¬†

Architect, develop, and maintain anti-cheat technology in our C/C++ game client(s)¬†
Analyze cheat and release binary behaviors to inform future anti-cheat direction¬†
Keep abreast of developments in the cybersecurity and OS development industries¬†
Collaborate with data scientists and analysts to develop and improve cheat detections¬†
Develop and maintain relationships with external security partners¬†
Help come up with policies that improve our security landscape¬†

REQUIRED SKILLS¬†

C/C++ application development (optimized code, data layout, robust access patterns)¬†
Low-level debugging skills (multi-threaded debugging, optimized code debugging, etc.)¬†
Willingness to be part of a ‚Äúwe‚Äù culture where you work closely with others to reach common goals‚Äîteam fit and culture are very important to us¬†
Knowledgeable about Windows APIs and Windows Kernel internals¬†

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS¬†

Anti-cheat or cybersecurity experience¬†
Familiarity with kernel mode operation¬†
Reverse engineering experience¬†
C# and/or tools experience¬†

title: Intellectual Property Paralegal
job_description:
We are looking for an Intellectual Property Paralegal to help attorneys and legal department with research, preparation, analysis of documents, and interviewing clients and witnesses.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Reviewing and managing US Patent and Trademark Office and foreign counsel correspondence.
Coordinating invention disclosure mining schedule and assisting inventors with navigating initial disclosure process.
Generalized IP litigation support.
Tracking due dates via docketing systems and matter management and coordinating with attorneys and staff to meet all identified due dates.
Overseeing the execution and legalization of documents for submission in intellectual property matters.
Collecting assets and filing documentation with intellectual property offices.
Proactively preparing client reporting and prosecution documents. Communicating with US Patent and Trademark Office, attorneys, foreign associates, staff, and clients regarding all aspects of patent prosecution.
Reviewing outside counsel and other vendor invoices for accuracy and processing payment of the same.
Assisting with due diligence and other intellectual property issues related to agreements or other transactional matters.
Assisting with compliance with applicable laws, corporate governance policies, and supervisory procedures.
Drafting, proofreading, and updating presentations, reports, and templates.
Preparing, reviewing, and negotiating simple form contracts and correspondence.

REQUIRED SKILLS

Extensive experience working with intellectual property and patent prosecution.
Strong attention to detail and experience managing an extensive patent prosecution docket.
An exceptional client service focus.
An ability to work independently and to prioritize and multi-task to complete projects effectively and efficiently.
Outstanding communication (oral & written) and organization skills.
Having the experience and flexibility to work on a broad variety of legal matters.

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS

A Paralegal Certification.
Trademark and copyright prosecution experience.
Video game industry experience.
Working knowledge of Clarivate IPFolio.

title: HRIS Analyst
job_description:
The People Team strives to deliver a seamless and positive employee experience across the entire employee lifecycle. By leading with care and empathy, we develop efficient and fundamental people processes, systems, policies, and programs. As a team, we roll-up our sleeves and support each other to grow, develop, and make an impact.
We are searching for a driven, savvy, and well-organized individual to join us as the HRIS Analyst. This position will be responsible for supporting and maintaining Workday HCM and other People modules within the Workday ecosystem. They will serve as a point of contact and subject matter expert for Workday support. This role is responsible for ensuring data integrity and analyzing data flows for process improvement opportunities. The HRIS Analyst also supports upgrades, patches, testing, and other technical projects as assigned.
RESPONSIBILITIES

Monitors the daily operation and performance of Workday and escalates performance issues as necessary.
Diagnoses and resolves issues (end-user, business process, security, etc.), utilizing resources such as Workday Community to drive resolutions and identify root cause.
Participates in the ongoing design, configuration, testing, deployment, change management, and maintenance of Workday changes / issues / enhancements.
Develops and maintains simple to reasonably complex reports, working with functional teams to understand and interpret the information.
Runs and distributes scheduled reports and supports business requests for ad hoc report generation.
Supports maintenance of inbound / outbound Workday HCM integrations to third party vendors including payroll and benefits providers.
Tracks all bug fixes, enhancements, and requests through Jira for review by Bungie‚Äôs Workday Governance Committees.
Performs data uploads into Workday as needed (EIB).
Maintains training and procedure documentation.
Performs other duties as assigned.

REQUIRED SKILLS

Experience with Workday configuration and administration.
Experience and knowledge of Workday HCM, Compensation, Time Tracking, Absence, Talent, Learning, and Benefits.
Basic knowledge of Workday domains, data structures, business processes, and reporting functional areas (e.g. within Core HCM, Compensation, Talent, Benefits and Payroll).
Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Ability to consult with stakeholders and identify metrics and interpretation needed in deliverables.
Self-motivated with a focus on driving results and strong sense of accountability.
Discretion and confidentiality when handling sensitive information.

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS

Proficiency in Workday reporting tools.
Experience with Workday Advanced Compensation, Headcount Reconciliation, Prism, and/or integrations.
Completed Workday training / accreditation.

title: Unannounced Project Staff Concept Artist
job_description:
Bungie is looking for an exceptional Staff Concept Artist who will work closely with the Art Director and Art Leads to establish the style and feel for the game universe in Bungie‚Äôs exciting unannounced title. You will also work closely with the production art team to help them envision what the finished results can be for the in-game content they are creating. We are looking to be amazed and bewildered with creative designs and artwork that have the capability to inspire creative vision in those around you.
If this role speaks to you, we are right there with you, it's what drives us every day. Give us a shout, we want to hear from you. We are the makers of worlds, dreams, and amazing things.
RESPONSIBILITIES 

Collaborate closely with the Art Director and other Concept Artists to produce quality designs that define and expand the look of the game
Create inspiring and original visual designs, thumbnails, sketches, model sheets and production concept work within deadline
Partner with other disciplines to create concept art for use by Production Artists to create 3D assets that fulfill the visual style and gameplay goals
Advocate, inspire, and ensure that concept art is consistent with defined visual style for the game with other creatives
Create additional illustrated concepts for marketing and PR needs

REQUIRED SKILLS¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† 

Ability to quickly iterate concepts given input from the Art Director
Professional attitude and an ability to provide and receive constructive criticism
An exceptional understanding of mood, lighting and architecture with a keen eye towards form, shape, structure, and silhouette regarding illustration and design
Superior eye for light, value, composition, color, staging and detail in environmental design
Strong foundation in the traditional arts, including, but not limited to, figure drawing, landscape painting, and illustration
The ability to carry an idea from the conceptual phase to the finished illustration and an understanding of translating these ideas to real-time game content
Self-driven, good communicator and a great team player

NICE-TO-HAVE SKILLS¬†¬†¬† 

Strong understanding of character proportion, costume design, and spatial scale with environmental design
Experience with Photoshop and 3D Software
A passion for games

title: Environment Art Lead
job_description:
Bit Reactor is in search of a Lead Environment Artist to join us in exploring and expanding the Star Wars universe.¬† Our environments are populated with variety of assets that range from architecture, hard surface objects and organic forms that will be both familiar and new to fans.¬† You will lead a team of Environment Artists to craft beautiful worlds that will be visually stunning yet technically performant and fun to play.
¬†
Responsibilities:

Provide direction and feedback to the Environment team
Work with Concept Artists, Game Designers, Level Designers, Narrative Designers, VFX Artists, and Audio Designers to craft the visual design and scope of all levels, biomes, and general environmental needs of the game
Work alongside production to plan and prioritize the project's Environment tasks
Set quality expectations and help guide artists towards the vision of the project, while working with our partners to ensure that our work honors the rich depth of the Star Wars universe
Mentor and aid in the development of team members as individuals and as a unit
Maintain a healthy team culture
Participate in sourcing and hiring environment team members
Work with art outsourcing manager to establish and document art outsourcing processes
Work with Technical Artists and Engineers to define and maintain performance standards
Collaborate with Lighting Artists to assure that assets work within the established needs of the lighting system, while offering feedback that helps to achieve the vision for the environment

¬†
QualiÔ¨Åcations:

Shipped at least one title as a Lead Environment Artist
5+ Years experience creating AAA environments including Architecture, Environments and Props
Excellent communication and organization skills
Proven ability to create and optimize 3D assets
Strong leadership skills with a passion to build relationships and lead with empathy
A portfolio showing recent examples of Environment artwork
An expert understanding of form, shape, light, texture, and composition
Extensive experience with PBR workflows
Extensive experience with trim sheets, deferred decals, and tiling texture workflows
Experience with developing foliage and organic forms
Expert proficiency of industry standard tools such as 3ds Max, Maya, Zbrush, and Substance Suite
Experience working with Unreal Engine 4+

¬†

title: Senior Systems Designer
job_description:
We are looking for an experienced systems designer interested in driving and owning new feature development and maintaining existing features for Guild Wars 2. Do you love MMOs and the social experience of games? Are you passionate about designing and implementing systems that integrate with content to create holistic experiences? Do you have experience leading development of features from design to implementation? Are you familiar with the constraints and complexities of working on a live game? Do you enjoy driving standards and consensus around best practices? Are you the type of person that loves building consensus and creating a shared vision with a team? If any of this sound like you, we would love to hear from you!
Why Join the ArenaNet Design Team?
The Design team at ArenaNet are the ones responsible for envisioning and implementing the encounters, events, items, rewards, etc. that our players interact with in the game. We work collaboratively across multiple disciplines to create, iterate, and refine ideas and put them in the game. Our work requires empathy, patience, communication, the ability to understand a variety of players and playstyles, and attention to detail.
As a designer, you will utilize your love of games along with your innovation and creative problem-solving skills to define and craft experiences and features that affect our players over the lifetime of their relationship with the products that we (and you) develop.
We also believe that a healthy team is the first step to making fun, engaging games. And a healthy team is one of mutual respect, psychological safety, and diversity. We believe that new perspectives and voices help us to improve our game and find the best ideas.
TYPICAL TRAITS:

Experience designing and implementing features from concept to release on at least 1 shipped title in a systems designer role
A desire to work collaboratively with various teams and disciplines to bring ideas to life
Understanding of player motivations and game reward systems
Familiarity with maintaining live systems and games
Experience with scripting languages like Lua, JavaScript, Python or Blueprint
You have learned or imagined how to design systems that cultivate dramatic gameplay experiences.

NICE TO HAVES

Passion for Guild Wars or other MMO games
Experience working on multiplayer online games
Knowledge / Experience of UX needs and working with UX designers and artists

We are open to remote work in AZ, CA, CO, FL, GA, ID, IL, MA, MD, NC, NV, NY OR, TX, UT and WA or onsite/hybrid/flex at our office in Bellevue, WA.Total compensation is salary plus¬†an annual bonus potential. Please note that the listed pay range is a general guideline only. We take into consideration the geography in which you live and your experience and qualifications when determining final salary. This role is also eligible for medical, dental, vision and life insurance, short and long term disability, 401(k), flexible and dependent care spending accounts, PTO, paid holidays and parental leave.Remote pay range$75,000‚Äî$125,000 USD
