title: Dev Manager/Director
job_description:
Overview
1047 Games began with the simple principle that people should have fun while making great games. Bucking convention and driven by a passion to create the ultimate gaming experience, Ian Proulx and Nicholas Bagamian founded 1047 Games in 2017 in their Stanford dorm room. Their love for arena shooters of the past drove them to create Splitgate, a unique sci-fi first-person shooter that adds portal guns to upend the genre.¬†
What started as two computer science majors putting portals into a first-person shooter for a project demo has evolved into a VC-backed company which has raised more than $120MM in funding.¬†
At 1047 Games, you‚Äôll find a permanently remote, dedicated team of top-tier talent from some of the world‚Äôs biggest gaming and tech companies who share our founders‚Äô vision. Grit, ingenuity, a desire to have fun, and a start up mentality define our crew. We are currently working on a brand new shooter in the Splitgate universe.
What We're Looking For:

A passionate development manager/director: You love to take on difficult, seemingly impossible problems and dig in to find creative ways to solve them
A hard worker: You love to put in the extra effort, because you enjoy your work and know the impact of finishing the tasks at hand
Passion for gaming: You can recognize what separates exceptional games from the average ones. You understand the mindset of gamers which enables you to create and implement features that will further benefit the game

What You Will Be Doing:

Maintain team tasks and scheduling to ensure delivery of features and content
Help with tracking, capacity planning, and prioritization of work
Manage change requests and advise stakeholders on their effect, budget and resourcing
Identify opportunities for improvement and collaborate with others to find creative solutions¬†
Help build, improve, and drive processes across our project management tools; planning, scope/capacity tracking, tool and plugin testing, and establishing best practices.
Build and maintain an effective working schedule to ensure that project development milestones are delivered on time
Keep the development team informed of project goals, schedule, status and deliverables
Identify, assess, and prioritize risks followed by a coordinated application of resources to minimize and manage risks
Work with the project leadership team to establish the strategy to meet milestones and important deliverables.
Working on roadmap planning with dev leads, and aligning with team leadership to establish time and targets

Qualifications:

5+ years of professional experience as a project manager, with experience in shipping AAA games.
Formal education or professional certification related to project management is highly preferred
Excellent change management skills, i.e., comfortable with ambiguity and constant change, yet able to set priorities and work commitments.
Have passion, energy, enthusiasm to achieve results.
Self-reflective; acknowledge own experience and experiences of others.
Expertise with Production tools, including JIRA, Confluence, or similar task tracking solutions
Knowledge and experience in Agile and Waterfall development practices
People management experience in career growth & skills development desired
Proficient understanding of various project management methodologies¬†
Organizational skills and ability to execute on projects on time, and at the expected level of quality.
A good understanding of various disciplines that go into game development such as programming, art, design and audio.

title: QA Tester-Seasonal
job_description:
OVERVIEW:Have you ever thought it would be cool to get paid for playing video games? Come join us at 2K Vegas and do exactly that!To support our new and upcoming releases, we are hiring seasonal QA Testers to join our team. You will test video games titles on various consoles, PC‚Äôs and handhelds to check the software for errors and log them into our test database. Reports to a QA Lead and/or QA Manager.
This is a 4-month seasonal assignment and will be based at our office in Downtown Las Vegas (this is not a remote opportunity).
Ongoing employment opportunities may be considered for top performers.2K players expect regular game releases which means our teams work tight deadlines, so there will be overtime. But we know you‚Äôll have fun working here and enjoy being part of our teamwork-based culture and family like environment.
If you are ready to be the voice of 2K players and help shape the future of gaming, we want to meet you!
RESPONSIBILITIES:

Find defects in the software using established and tedious methods
Accurately execute all assigned test cases.
Enter detailed, but concise, bugs into bug database
Regress fixed bugs on each release
Be prepared to provide insight as to the playability of a title
Provide a positive role model, in terms of work performance, attitude and attendance

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:

Technically proficient with PCs and gaming consoles
Computer literacy, specifically MS Word, G Suite, Outlook and Database Software

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

High School diploma or equivalent
Minimum age of 18 years and above
Ability to test both 2D and 3D games repeatedly, while listening and looking for bugs
Ability to test using a handheld gaming device and various other gaming platforms
A positive attitude with the ability to work in a team environment
Reliable, and can be counted on to work all scheduled shifts
Capable of working any mandatory overtime; which can occur during the work week, weekends, and occasional holidays
Must be able to communicate effectively in English, in both written and oral forms
Ability to sit for long periods of time and occasionally lift up to 20 lbs. assisted and unassisted

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

Quality Assurance testing experience or experience troubleshooting PC/Console Games a plus

Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use¬†2K.com¬†accounts.

title: Recruiter
job_description:
JOB TITLE: Recruiter
LOCATION: Brno, Czech Republic
FUNCTION: Recruitment
REPORTS TO: Recruitment Manager
CONTRACT: Fixed Term
Please send CVs in English
¬†
What We Need:
Are you passionate about game development? We have a fantastic opportunity for a talented individual to join our AAA international studio as a Recruiter. Successful candidates will be PC literate and have good communication skills in English. This rare opportunity requires a fast-paced, proactive, organized, customer-centric, and passionate recruiter to manage recruitment across studio locations
What You Will Do:

Handle the full end-to-end lifecycle recruitment process.
Work closely with hiring managers to understand job requirements and the profile of successful candidates.
Align with other recruiters and HR to understand hiring processes.
Source candidates.
Initiate and follow up on reference checks, application letters, resumes, and portfolios
Conduct initial phone/video interviews.
Be responsible for the logistics of all interviews between candidates and hiring teams.
Prioritize, coordinate and lead and document post-interview debrief/feedback sessions with interview teams and candidates.
Prepare and deliver job offers to candidates.
Keep the company's applicant tracking systems updated with accurate and relevant information.
Be an outstanding partner to your Hiring Managers and key collaborators throughout the hiring process.
Market Hangar 13 across and proactively source candidates from, numerous online mediums.

Who We Think Will Be A Good Fit:

Experienced in reviewing CV‚Äôs and portfolios and evaluating them against the needs of our hiring teams and projects.
Experienced working with multiple customers and providing AAA service to all collaborators and team members.
Excellent communication skills.
Standout colleague.
Proven attention to detail.
Ability to meet project timescales, prioritize, and handle time optimally
Experience with direct sourcing techniques.
Accustomed to detailing your work daily in an Applicant Tracking Software (‚ÄúATS‚Äù).
MS Office Suite knowledge.
Very good command of English (spoken and written).

Nice to have

Experience as an in-house recruiter in video game development/or creative studio environment (video games, animation, VFX).
Expertise in the Greenhouse or similar ATS.
Basic knowledge of game development professions, tools, and workflows.
Solid knowledge of the game industry.
Czech/Slovak language as an advantage.

Who We Are:
Hangar 13 is the internal 2K development studio behind the award-winning Mafia franchise. The studio is comprised of industry veterans drawn from a diverse range of studios, who have collectively shipped hundreds of titles across a wide variety of genres. Though we hail from all over the world, and our backgrounds are wildly different, one thing binds us all together ‚Äì the belief that ‚ÄúEvery Player‚Äôs Story is Unique.‚Äù
Hangar 13 is based in four locations: Novato (California), Brighton (UK), and Brno & Prague (Czech Republic).
We work collaboratively across our 4 locations to develop games as one global team. Each of our locations provides the opportunity to work on big-budget, AAA console in a diverse and inclusive environment!
Brno:
Located in the south-east part of the Czech Republic, just a 2-hour drive from Prague, 3 hrs from Budapest and mere 90 minutes from Vienna, surrounded by vineyards from the south-east and highlands from the north-west, Brno is a comfortable place to live and work. This Czech Republic¬¥s second largest city offers everything you need without the big city rush - modern architecture, perfect cuisine, award-winning bars, and diverse countryside.
OUR OFFER
‚ñ∫Friendly and informal work environment‚ñ∫ Attractive work on globally famous AAA games in a successful company for one of the biggest publishers‚ñ∫ Access to the most up-to-date SW/HW and technologies‚ñ∫ Flexible working hours‚ñ∫ Support for personal skills development‚ñ∫ Games and consoles to borrow‚ñ∫ Employee benefits (sick days, meal vouchers, language courses, refreshment at work, multisport card, well-being program, stock purchase plan, and more)‚ñ∫ Company events for the employees
If you are interested in this job opportunity, please send us your CV and a few words to explain your interest in this particular job (both in English).

title: Director, Global Creator + Influencer Marketing - All Titles
job_description:
Who We Are:
2K develops and publishes interactive entertainment globally for console systems, handheld gaming devices and personal computers, including smartphones and tablets. 2K is a leading publisher of today‚Äôs most popular gaming genres and most well-known for critically acclaimed game franchises like NBA2K, WWE2K, Bioshock, Borderlands, Evolve, XCOM and the beloved Sid Meier‚Äôs Civilization.
The role:
The Director of Global Creator + Influencer Marketing is a key leader in spearheading and sculpting the future of marketing within the company across all titles. Equal parts analytical, culturally savvy, self-starter and attuned to the future of creator and influencer marketing in entertainment, this role will need to influence, strategize and execute on holistically integrated creator and influencer campaigns for our titles.¬†
You will also lead and develop our NextMakers creator loyalty program and set the pace for program growth and development, as well align brand leadership to your future vision. We need a dreamer with a measured approach who is focused on helping educate and quantify success, who can plan for the near-term while building for the future. As the subject matter expert, you will be the champion and evangelist of creator + influencer marketing at 2K and help to build workflows with cross-functional teams that will help to best honor it.
This role is part of the larger 2K Global Marketing team, working directly under the Global Head of Digital Community Marketing who oversees social marketing, community, as well as creator and influencer marketing. This team is responsible for developing and executing creator and influencer strategies across all game titles and works heavily cross-functionally with our global and territory marketing, paid media, live services, brand partnerships and full digital community marketing team, to connect the creator ecosystem with our campaigns seamlessly.
We partner across the organization through continued influence and relationship-building to orchestrate a unified, effective, and scalable effort.¬† At any given moment we are the supporter, leader, approver, and/or responsible party with other internal and external teams. 2K has an ambitious roadmap for the future, and candidates should be driven by opportunity, passion for their work and collaborating with numerous functions within the organization as we head into the future. We‚Äôre building a future of marketing from a player-first POV and you will help us to prioritize and streamline integrating creators and influencers seamlessly into all of our campaigns.
¬†
What We Need:
Creator and Influencer Marketing Expertise¬†
Influencer and creator marketing is at the heart of our brand marketing strategies. You will be not only a subject matter expert, but help to sculpt integrated marketing plans that are driven by your proven knowledge and expertise. You will continue to proactively present forward-thinking strategies and work closely with teams to educate, brainstorm and collaborate on improved ways to build creator and influencer marketing into campaigns.
Forward-Thinking, Nimble Approach
The world of creator and influencer marketing is ever-evolving and this role will help to set the pace for future ways of working, to optimize our processes. Given the fluid nature of this work, you will possess the business acumen to steer the course through hardships, while working to lead and guide the team on effective ways forward. You will tackle any issues that come your way with grace and actively work to plan ahead to mitigate issues with cross-functional teams.
Entertainment / Sports / Gaming Talent Experience
We‚Äôre looking for someone with a deep understanding of creator and influencer marketing in the entertainment industry, or other adjacent creative or live spaces. You possess direct relationships with creators and influencers, agents, agencies and managers to land talent for future campaigns. You are able to lead a team of influencer and creator marketers and have expert knowledge of contracting, payout and legal posting parameters. You will be the authority in creator and influencer policy and can build strategic top-level plans, as well execute should it be needed.
Social Content Savvy
As most creator and influencer content lives on social media, we‚Äôre looking for you to have a deep knowledge and understanding of social marketing trends and parameters, as well as good taste in content and a knowledge for what ‚Äúperforms‚Äù on platform. Your social content expertise will set the tone for the types of content and briefs we output to creators and influencers, helping to direct campaigns in a meaningful, strategic way.
Global Marketing Mindset
This role is a part of our Global team and will help to sculpt our overall global plans, as well as work with territories to execute localized strategies from a global lens. You will have a global mindset, with the ability to prioritize and scale locally. You are on top of global creator and influencer trends and understand the nuances of language, regional platforms and evolving regional strategies.¬†
Ability to Manage + Grow Our NextMakers Program
Our NextMaker‚Äôs program fosters relationships with our most loyal and engaged gaming creators. We‚Äôve incubated an active community of global creators who are passionate about our games titles and we‚Äôre looking to continue to build a more qualitative experience for them within the program. You will build the strategy to help qualitatively grow this community and integrate new NextMakers into the program for future titles. You will also work closely with the NextMaker team to internally influence and evangelize program uses internally, championing team involvement and consideration across all marketing teams.
What You Will Do:

Lead, mentor and develop the NextMakers and Global Creator + Influencer Marketing team.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to prioritize and streamline creator and influencer marketing efforts, both for campaigns and ad-hoc projects.
Identify with marketing appropriate audience segments to target with via creators and influencers, sculpt campaigns from vetted data + insights.
Set KPI‚Äôs, benchmarks and objectives for all campaigns.
Manage and optimize campaign reporting and tracking global workflow.
Build and maintain relationships with key internal and external stakeholders, including creators and representation.
Lead cross-functional communication to connect creator and influencer content seamlessly to the community and social teams.
Develop the next phase of the NextMakers creator loyalty program and optimize workflow and output.
Drive long-term planning and execution for forward-thinking creator and influencer strategies, both at the title and 2K brand level.
Oversee creative ideation and social content development needed to to launch best-in-class influencer and creator campaigns for our titles.
Serve as the go-to liaison for all things creator and influencer, across all titles which include sport and core games.

Who Will Make A Great Fit:

A proven track record (7-10+ years) in games, sports, media, entertainment or a creator-oriented industry.
Powerful presentation skills with the ability to create compelling presentations to support strategy and thinking, as well as present to both peers and reports, and company leadership.
Strong staff management skills and cross-functional leadership chops, with an understanding of a matrixed organization and how to navigate.
An analytical and insights minded approach to creativity and innovation.
Experience building creator and influencer program infrastructure and long / short term planning.
Skilled in crafting integrated marketing strategies across all channels and touchpoints, including social, community platforms, paid media and brand partners.
Proven ability to negotiate and execute Global paid influencer + creator campaigns.
Strong experience successfully delivering complex projects requiring strong project management skills, attention to detail, timing and accountability.
Excellent written and interpersonal communication skills, with the ability to build long-term relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Experience working in companies and teams with complex business models, rapidly shifting priorities, and where change is the norm.
A reputation for successfully driving results in dynamic environments with a high degree of ambiguity and limited given direction.
Experience working directly with creators and engaging large and granular communities at scale.
Strong knowledge and proficiency with creator and influencer tracking tools (CreatorIQ), social metrics and sentiment reporting tools, as well as UTM‚Äôs and tracking links a big bonus.

Please note that 2K Games and its studios never uses instant messaging apps or personal email accounts to contact prospective employees or conduct interviews and when emailing, only use 2K.com accounts.
¬†

title: Senior User Researcher Manager
job_description:
Who We Are
Founded in 2005, 2K Games is a global video game company, publishing titles developed by some of the most influential game development studios in the world. Our studios responsible for developing 2K‚Äôs portfolio of world-class games across multiple platforms, include Visual Concepts, Firaxis, Hangar 13, CatDaddy, Cloud Chamber, and HB Studios. Our portfolio of titles is expanding due to our global strategic plan, building and acquiring exciting studios whose content continues to inspire all of us! 2K publishes titles in today‚Äôs most popular gaming genres, including sports, shooters, action, role-playing, strategy, casual, and family entertainment.
Our team of engineers, marketers, artists, writers, data scientists, producers, thinkers and doers, are the professional publishing stewards of our growing library of critically-acclaimed franchises such as NBA 2K, Battleborn, BioShock, Borderlands, The Darkness, Mafia, Sid Meier‚Äôs Civilization, WWE 2K, and XCOM.
At 2K, we pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment, which means encouraging our teams to Come as You Are and do your best work! We are dedicated to diversity and inclusion, and want our community of candidates to reflect this commitment. We encourage all qualified applicants to explore our global positions.
2K is headquartered in Novato, California and is a wholly owned label of Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc. (NASDAQ: TTWO).
¬†
What You Will Do:

Develop and optimize user acquisition campaigns for 2K playtesting to enable the recruitment of participants for current and future studies
Support the creation and management of 2K Gamelab research labs
Maintain a medium- and long-term testing schedule and clearly communicate the department‚Äôs capabilities to stakeholders
Guide team members in research planning, alignment, execution, analysis, and follow-up
Advocate for the player through human-centered research methods
Build strong relationships with partners and teams across various geographies
Practice and help evolve the team‚Äôs research techniques and toolsets to work efficiently in cross-team collaboration
Balance long-term research strategies with short-term research needs

Who We Believe Would Be an Excellent Fit:

Experience in team management and project coordination
Strong organizational skills and the ability to work autonomously
Comfortable speaking and leading discussion with a variety of business partners and stakeholders
Excellent analytical skills with strong attention to detail and the capability to visualize data
Strategic problem solver with the ability to build and execute department-wide plans

Preference for Candidates with:

A BA/BS in Human-Computer Interaction, Cognitive Science, Experimental/Cognitive Psychology, Statistics, or another related field
6+ years of experience in User Experience Research
Excel, SPSS, Salesforce, and Tableau experience
Video games industry experience, especially AAA console/PC products
Experience with team development
Travel, both domestic and international, may be required

If you love video games, enjoy working in an environment where you can make a real difference to the final product, and you have experience in the video game industry, then this position might be for you!
We want someone who not only has a strong background in User Research but who also thoroughly enjoys the process, the results, and the impact they can have on the games they support.

title: Level Designer
job_description:
WE ARE GAME MAKERS
Who we are:
We are a diverse team of developers driven by a passion for our art, united by our core values and inspired by a culture of inclusivity to build amazing games that thrill players everywhere. We pursue growth and innovation in an environment of safety and trust. Our culture is built on the belief that the more varied voices in our collective will strengthen our team and our games.¬† We are looking for our next teammate who will raise our bar and make us better.
¬†
What we need:
We're just beginning a development journey that will take us through design concepting, functional prototyping, milestone deliverables, systems building and tuning, map building, and deep polishing & optimization. We‚Äôre looking for a Senior World/Level Designer who can dig deep into each stage of this process, creating inspiring worlds and spaces, applying technical & creative passion to constantly improve the game through an iterative process. We want people who think differently at every step and help us to create a broadly appealing product that resonates with the widest set of fans possible.¬† Come and help us build the future of Multiplayer Action games!
Responsibilities:

Design, pitch, & hone world spaces/levels from inception to completion to post-launch. Examine desired player experience goals and introduce designs that help support and enhance that experience
Be an equal voice within the design team for making both large- and small-scale decisions throughout the project
Collaborate deeply with other disciplines. This role will touch on everything from animation to UI to environment art to sound, as well as work closely with core engineering teams
Own map ideas from inception to completion. This includes pitching ideas in their infancy to fine-tuning post-launch. We emphasize a culture of trust, and with that trust comes both responsibility & accountability
Understand how world design impacts other areas of the game and collaborate deeply with other disciplines.¬† This role will touch on everything from animation to UI to environment art to sound, as well as work closely with core engineering teams
Daily hands-on engine work to bring ideas to life
Understand how world design fits into the overall creation direction of the game, both on a macro and micro level

¬†
Who you are:
You‚Äôre an experienced World/Level Designer with multiple shipped titles under your belt.¬† You‚Äôre comfortable not just building map content off an established template, but also figuring out what that template is in the first place.¬† Our ideal candidate has proven experience building world spaces across all phases of development and is excited to build a world from the ground up.
Required experience:

Experience in creating, or at minimum a strong passion as a player of Multiplayer Action games a MUST¬†¬†
3-5 years or 2+ shipped titles in a World/Level Design role, preferably in the Multiplayer/Action genre
Experience with modern game engines (Unreal, Unity, etc.)
Experience building maps, levels, or worlds ‚Äì particularly in the AAA, action, or shooter spaces ‚Äì multiplayer experience preferred
Rock-solid understanding of interplay between systems and world spaces; can take a set of systems or player abilities and build spaces that highlight those abilities in interesting and creative ways
Familiar with fundamental world-building concepts: flow, landmarking, scale, visibility, metrics, etc.
Ability to thoughtfully critique and evaluate 3D spaces
Understanding of how art, color, lighting, composition, etc. can complement gameplay design
Comfortable with rapid iteration based off feedback from many sources: peer review, data analytics, player surveys, etc.¬† Capable of filtering large volumes of feedback into concrete and actionable improvements
Clear understanding of the iterative level design process from inception all the way to post-ship support

¬†
Relevant experience:

Strong passion for online multiplayer action games a MUST
Experience working in multiplayer games or systems
Some experience programming, both code & visual scripting (C++, C#, etc. | Blueprint, Kismet, etc.)
A passion for diversity & representation in games & game development
A self-starter who can align with the team's goals but isn't hesitant to create solutions on their own
Ability to iterate & collaborate under deadlines & production constraints
Backgrounds in art/architecture/CS/etc. a plus

¬†
The pay range for this position in California at the start of employment is expected to be between $65,000 and $100,000 per year. However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. title: Senior Materials Artist
job_description:
WE ARE GAMEMAKERS
¬†
Who we are:
We are a diverse team of developers driven by a passion for our art, united by our core values and inspired by a culture of inclusivity to build amazing games that thrill players everywhere. We pursue growth and innovation in an environment of safety and trust. Our culture is built on the belief that the more varied voices in our collective will strengthen our team and our games.¬† We are looking for our next teammate who will raise our bar and make us better.
¬†
What you will do:¬†

Create Base materials in Substance Designer and incorporating them to our material library and well as Substance Painter library
Experience exporting sbsar files for use in Substance painter
Use proprietary software for tasks such as refining the look of materials within our engine
Test build and troubleshoot assets and environments to make sure they are error-free before submitting them to the game
Proactively seek feedback to ensure accuracy and quality standards are met
Collaborate with other artists and departments throughout the production process

Who We Think Will Be A Great Fit:

2+ years‚Äô experience as a Material Artist within the video games industry
Extremely proficient in the creation of high-quality, clean, and efficient material assets
Ability to adapt to proprietary software and incorporate it into their workflow
Technical enough to check the art within our game
Strong application and knowledge of Substance Designer, Substance Painter and/or other art creation tools
An eye for attractive environments and texture creation
Skillful in creating both hard surface and organic materials
Knowledge of working with hi-res meshes and baking details onto low-res versions
Strong communication skills and a high attention to detail
Ability to work with a high degree of self-direction

¬†
The pay range for this position in California at the start of employment is expected to be between $90,000 and $135,000 per year. However, base pay offered is based on market location, and may vary further depending on individualized factors for job candidates, such as job-related knowledge, skills, experience, and other objective business considerations. Subject to those same considerations, the total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a bonus and/or equity awards, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment. If hired, employee will be in an 'at-will position' and the company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation or benefit program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

title: Material Artist
job_description:
Who we are:
We are a diverse team of developers driven by a passion for our art, united by our core values and inspired by a culture of inclusivity to build amazing games that thrill players everywhere. We pursue growth and innovation in an environment of safety and trust. Our culture is built on the belief that the more varied voices in our collective will strengthen our team and our games.¬† We are looking for our next teammate who will raise our bar and make us better.
¬†
What we need:
As a Material Artist at 31st Union Valencia Office, your passion, knowledge and experience will be integral to the look and style of a new generation of player driven experiences derived by your ability to create high-quality materials and textures that bring life to the worlds we build. With technical skill and artistic understanding, you will help us build a library of materials to be used by all art disciplines. Your ability to collaborate on tasks as well as your proactive approach to material creation will be key to meeting our goals in an optimal time frame.
Responsibilities:

Create visually stunning textures and materials for physically-based render pipeline
Work closely with the key contributors to construct, oversee and maintain the material library
Work with Engineering and Material Technical Artists to reach scalable performance while still pushing the boundaries of visual quality
Collaborate with technical stakeholders in designing and improving material pipelines
Collaborate with 3D artists, designers and other development teams to understand and meet content creator needs of the game.
Help mentor material artists to improve authored texture and material quality and efficiency.
Help establish the look and tone of materials for a beautiful new game!

¬†
Who you are:
You are an experienced Materials Artist with strong knowledge in materials and shading. You are proficient at creating both stylized and PBR materials in both Substance Designer and Substance Painter with expert knowledge in node-based material editors, tiling layered materials, shader networks and procedural texturing. You possess a keen ability to communicate and collaborate across disciplines sharing ideas and articulating visions. You are inspired by growth and excellence and thrive on sharing your knowledge with your teammates while continually honing your craft. Iterating, communicating and creating together is what drives your passion for art and games. You are knowledgeable in all the tools, techniques and asset creation pipelines: UE4, Substance Designer, Substance Painter, Photoshop, ZBrush, modeling, baking, texturing, UV creation, unwrapping. You have created a gorgeous portfolio that showcases your ability to create and apply high quality materials to assets.
¬†

title: Senior Gameplay Programmer
job_description: We have an excellent opportunity for a passionate game developer to join our Total War team as a Senior Gameplay Programmer.Based at our well-established studio in Horsham, in the heart of West Sussex, UK, you will be working as a key member of the code team on our next unannounced Total War title. In this role, you will be able to make a real impact on our game. You will bring your knowledge and experience to help push the boundaries of our game by collaborating with the wider development team, striving to make our titles better than ever before.Flexible working at Creative Assembly includes hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio. We recognise that there is no one-size-fits-all approach and empower our teams to define the working patterns which work best for them, which may mean different things for different teams and roles and at different times.This role is Hybrid and has an expectation of at least 2 days per week in our Horsham studio. This role cannot offer fully remote working. Further details can be discussed during the recruitment process.Key Responsibilities¬†¬†In the role of Senior Gameplay Programmer, you will be working closely with your peers, using your coding skills and expertise to improve our existing gameplay and craft new and compelling features for future Total War titles.¬†On a day-to-day basis, you will:Build and maintain well-engineered C++ code with high levels of stability and performanceUse your experience to solve challenging problems, from designing and building entirely new systems to optimising features to be performant, maintainable and extensibleContribute to technical design in areas such as AI, UI, and gameplayCollaborate with your teammates to encourage and uphold high standards across the teamWork with our principal programmers and leads to contribute to the technical roadmap of our future titles.EssentialExperience of at least one full cycle shipped AAA titleStrong C# or C++ programming skillset, with knowledge of the latest language featuresAbility to write clean, maintainable, and extensible codeStrong problem-solving skillsSelf-motivated with a drive to improve yourself and othersA desire to collaborate closely with other disciplinesPassion and interest in games and game development.DesirableCross-platform development experienceGraphics programming experienceExperience of a complete game development lifecycle from pre-production, through to post-release supportExperience working in a large codebaseBroad gaming experience and a sense for good game designAn avid gamer, ideally strategy games.About Creative AssemblyIt‚Äôs an exciting time to be a part of our craft-led studio as we push boundaries, creating deep and detailed experiences that last.¬†Our teams are diverse from across the world, from trainees to industry veterans who constantly challenge us and make sure we are striving for the best within our games and our studio life. We are united through our shared values of Quality, Focus, Teamwork, Respect and Trust and we win awards for our culture and our people-centric approach, having won a Best Place to Work Award for six consecutive years. We invest in our people, the studio, and our projects. We are a company that‚Äôs secure and safe ‚Äì you don‚Äôt need to worry about job security at CA.We‚Äôll give you the creative freedom, tools, support, and development to achieve your potential.¬†Our studios are based in Horsham, UK and Sofia, Bulgaria, including several bespoke state-of-the-art audio suites and a dedicated motion capture facility.¬†We offer many benefits to support you and your family including:Flexible working: hybrid, fully remote within country of employment for eligible roles, and in-studio workingWork from Anywhere for a temporary period each year (restrictions apply such as VISAs)Enhanced holiday allowance, maternity and paternity breaks, flexibility with our core hours, and no-notice holidaysBespoke relocation package for you and your dependents, with support throughout the process from our dedicated Relocation SpecialistsPrivate medical and dental insurance, life insurance, permanent health insurance, critical illness cover and free health care screeningGenerous holiday allowance plus full studio closure over the Christmas and New Year period, and all UK Bank holidaysAnnual discretionary studio bonusJoin our award-winning education and social responsibility programme; the Legacy Project, as an industry ambassador to mentor and educate othersDefined career development pathways and personalised training support including SEGA Dev Day, internal masterclasses, prestigious creative workshops, on-site training with renowned specialists and global conference attendanceOpportunity to join our Diversity and Inclusion Network ‚Äì an employee-led groupSeason ticket travel loans and cycle to work scheme with free bike servicing and discounted car valet service on siteFree games and merchandise plus access to our extensive games libraryFree breakfast in the studio every day - toast, bagels, pancakes, cereals, yoghurts, fresh fruit, smoothies, juices, milkshakes and more in our fully stocked kitchenWellbeing support with an employee assistance programme and onsite confidential sessionsIn-studio heavily subsidised massage therapyDiscounts for home technology, travel insurance, corporate gym membership, cinema tickets, holidays, trips out and Ikea vouchers, and many local businesses including estate agentsStudio parties for you and your family; such as our Summer Festival, Christmas Party plus a separate Children‚Äôs Christmas Party. We also have Cinema days and wrap parties for game releasesStudio community activities such as life drawing, creative writing, Pilates, Walking Challenges, Couch to 5k, basketball, game and movie evenings, board game club, 5-a-side football, CA Choir, Sword fighting (yes, sword fighting) and loads more.Our studio sites have disabled access. title: Senior Finance Manager
job_description: With a rich history of developing multiple AAA franchises such as Little Big Planet and Crackdown, as well as contributing to genre-defining titles like the Forza Motorsport and Hitman series, Sumo Sheffield‚Äôs vast development experience spans multiple genres and platforms. ¬†As winners of the TIGA Star Employment Award for 2021, recipients of the GI Biz 2020 Best Places to Work Award and listed as one of the UK‚Äôs 100 Best Large Companies to Work for in 2021 and 2022, Sumo Digital has enjoyed 20 years of stability and growth since its formation in 2003 and continues to strive for excellence across every single project.¬†The team have a track record of working on some of the world's biggest and best games and received two BAFTAs for their work on Sackboy: A Big Adventure. As the scale and exclusivity of projects continues to grow, there‚Äôs never been a more exciting time to join the Sumo Sheffield family!Senior Finance Manager¬†A fantastic opportunity has arisen for a Senior Finance Manager in the Sumo Group finance team. The initial 12 months of this role will be focused on Group FP&A, Services & Capex. This is a leadership role within the finance team, responsible for the consolidation of the Sumo Group strategic plan, project managing quarterly and long term forecasting, interacting directly with the executive board and working in close collaboration with commercial finance and reporting teams. You will act as strategic finance business partner to all of Sumo Group‚Äôs central support functions, including IT, HR, Facilities, Marketing, Business Development and Legal, you will also lead a small team. The team is responsible for all aspects of Group Services finance, including forecasting and reporting operating and capital expenditure, identifying and delivering cost saving opportunities, managing risk and leading and influencing strategic initiatives and business cases.¬†Sumo is a dynamic, growing business with multiple Senior Finance Managers across the Group and as such the specific requirements of our Senior Finance Managers may change as the needs of the business changes. Within this role you will:Be a finance business partner to the Group services leads and be recognised as a trusted advisor.Influence business decisions in area of expertise to drive better outcomes.Support the finance leadership team as required on strategic financial modelling and analysis for the Group Board and Operating committee.Lead the Group FP&A and Group Services business partnering team: coach, mentor and develop the Assistant Finance Manager ‚Äì Central Services, Support the finance leadership team in the overall development, training, wellbeing and engagement of junior members of the finance team.Drive positive change, identify and deliver operating efficiencies in the way we work through programme of continuous improvement.Lead the Group quarterly and long term strategic forecasting cycle, working in close collaboration with the commercial finance team and Group reporting team to drive content and timelines, ensuring these align with Sumo Board requirements and the requirements of Tencent reporting and forecasting.Prepare and present to the Group Executive Board members the Group consolidated finance content for all strategic forecasting, ensuring accuracy and consistency with operating business analysis, and providing key commercial analysis and insight.Manage forecast versions using the Group‚Äôs financial reporting tools (TM1 and others), ensuring forecasts are accurately uploaded and presented. Drive continuous improvement and transformation across finance forecasting and reporting systems for effective and efficient reporting and analysis.Support the Group financial controller on the preparation and analysis of Group long term cash flow forecasting.Establish and maintain a regular cadence of reporting, review and monitoring for all Services business partners.Be responsible for budgeting, forecasting and financial reporting across both opex and capex, ensuring integration with all Operating Businesses in the Group.Proactively identify and manage risks, and identify and deliver cost saving opportunities and areas of efficiency to optimise department financial performance.Work closely with the Group Head of Health and Safety and Facilities to manage accounting for the Group‚Äôs property portfolio and significant capital projects.Influence the HR department in developing accurate and insightful operational KPIs and headcount-based modelling, ensuring alignment with operating businesses in each forecasting cycle.Take the lead on key strategic projects and investment business cases within areas of responsibility.Undertake investment appraisal reviews and post investment ROI analysis on projects and capital spend.Ensure compliance with all financial processes, policies and controls.Support the Group statutory audit process providing information and liaising with auditors as necessary.To be successful you will have:A relevant accounting qualification (ACA, ACCA, CIMA) with significant post qualification experience.Experience of financial reporting and providing commercial insight to a range of stakeholders.Very strong presentation skills, both written and oral, ability to flex style depending on audience.The ability to build relationships with key stakeholders and broader business stakeholders including influencing skills, negotiation, facilitation, and conflict resolution.A deep understanding of the Group‚Äôs commercial business drivers and strong business acumen.An enthusiastic, team-based ethos. Ability to break down silos and collaborate across multiple team members, teams and parts of the Group.The ability to prioritise in a dynamic business, be well organised, and able to work autonomously and to strict deadlines.Show a willingness to learn and develop new skills.A desire to implement change and best practice.Exceptional attention to detail.A strong desire to implement change and best practice, with the confidence to question processes¬†and recommend improvements.Strong excel skills and the ability to analyse and manipulate data.What we offer:.    Defined Annual Bonus Scheme.    ULEV car scheme .    Monthly allowance to spend on enhancing benefits¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ¬†.    Salary Sacrifice Pension.    Flexible Working¬†¬† .   21 days free-use holiday    + your birthday off    + 5 learning days including 1 volunteer day    + a duvet day    + Christmas shutdown from Christmas Eve to New Year    + Bank Holidays    + extra allowance accrued for longer service.    Free dental insurance¬†.    Life Assurance 4x Salary.    Income Protection of 75% for 5 years¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† .    Enhanced Mat/Paternity & Adoption pay.    Employee Assistance Programme:.    Help at Hand - Remote GP, Mental Health & Physio appointments.    Free financial & home buying support consultations.    Cycle to Work Scheme.    Payroll Giving Scheme.    Access to 4,000 Udemy Courses.    Career Development Pathway¬†¬† .    Wrap Parties..    Project Completion Awards.    Game/Creative Jams.    Big Family Events.    Studio social activities, e.g. running, board games, film, yoga, life drawing‚Ä¶.    Prism ‚Äì Sumo‚Äôs employee diversity focus group¬†.    Free fruit and drinks in our studios.    Employee Referral Bonus¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† Where do we stand on diversity?At Sumo, we want to enable everyone to bring their full, authentic selves to work every single day. We acknowledge that the games industry is far from perfect and a global organisation with people all over the world, from all kinds of backgrounds, we know it‚Äôs part of our duty to provide everyone at Sumo with a safe, accepting and affirming working environment.We encourage and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.¬†More about Sumo Sheffield¬†Sumo Sheffield is located just outside the city centre in Sumo Digital‚Äôs HQ, just off J34 on the M1 and a stone‚Äôs throw from the city‚Äôs primary shopping and leisure complex. With a multi-building campus comprised of industry-leading facilities, an onsite gym and subsidised canteen, Sumo Sheffield provides everything needed for all teams to create the world‚Äôs best games.¬†Sheffield is the fifth largest city in the UK and is easily accessible by road and rail from Leeds, Manchester and the Midlands. The city enjoys a wealth of facilities to suit a wide array of interests, including:o¬†¬† World-class sports facilitieso¬†¬† Iconic theatres and gallerieso¬†¬† Multiple retail and shopping experiences o¬†¬† Diverse and renowned restaurants and eaterieso¬†¬† The award-winning National Video Game MuseumMore about Sumo Digital¬†Sumo Digital is an award-winning international family of studios. Recent releases from Sumo Digital studios include: BAFTA-Award winning Sackboy: A Big Adventure, Hood: Outlaws & Legends, Control Ultimate Edition on Google Stadia, Apple Arcade Award-winning Little Orpheus, Hot Shot Racing, WST Snooker and Spyder.Apply for this job

title: Senior Compliance Tester
job_description: Greetings from The Bunker! Secret Mode is the publishing wing of the award-winning Sumo Group Ltd. Our goal is to publish internally developed projects from any of our 14 game development studios across the UK, US, Europe and India, as well as third party independent game developers.Now is an exciting time to join a rapidly growing team early on in Secret Mode‚Äôs journey. If you have a strong passion for video games and want to help us build the best games publisher in the business, please reach out to us. We‚Äôd love to have a chat!As a part of Secret Modes new QA team, you‚Äôll be responsible for testing games from external development partners and ensuring these meet 1st party requirements across Nintendo, Sony and Microsoft Platforms.Successful candidates will work alongside QA Leadership to assess product compliance requirements. They‚Äôll help develop and maintain compliance specific test plans and produce detailed bug reports where requirements are not met. You‚Äôll keep abreast of changing compliance guidelines and adapt testing strategies to suit.¬†This role will be primarily based within the studio with hybrid working opportunities.In your new role you will:Check games adhere to all 1st party certification requirementsHelp develop and maintain test plans focused on 1st party requirements (Sony, Microsoft and Nintendo)Keep up to date with changes to compliance requirements across supported platforms. Employee Referral Bonus¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† We are Secret Mode.¬†Quality drives us.Fun informs us.Community is our reason for being.Inclusivity is at the heart of everything we do.To delight and inspire is our goal.¬†Secret Mode is managed by a small group of industry veterans and a team of experienced and newcomers to the industry alike. ¬†We‚Äôre looking for diverse, creative, driven people who share our passion for all things video games, no matter their background. ¬†¬†As part of the Sumo family, we‚Äôre able to offer a super benefits package including generous holidays and flexible working hours. We‚Äôre based in Royal Leamington Spa but are flexible on work-from-home options. ¬†Our environment is fast paced, dynamic and friendly and built upon the basis of every team member having the opportunity to shine and have a realisable input into the games we publish. We‚Äôre in the amazing position of building a brand-new team, and creating a culture that‚Äôs all about passion, respect, diversity, fun and togetherness. We‚Äôre looking for people that love what they do and love to share their enthusiasm with each other. We have taken the #RaiseTheGame pledge to fully dedicate ourselves to inclusivity in our hiring and working processes and already have aligned ourselves with amazing initiatives and charity organisations to make a difference in the industry we all love.Apply for this job

title: Lighting Assistant
job_description: Skydance offers a dynamic, inclusive, and ever-evolving culture where innovative ideas are welcomed, and growth fostered. The partnership between unique creativity and technological advancements are demonstrated within each pillar of the company. At the heart of it all is a commitment to boldly entertaining and relevant storytelling.¬†While all Animation studios look to hire people who are creative and hard-working, Skydance Animation is specifically looking for pioneers who seek to push the limits of what the world‚Äôs most collaborative art form can achieve, and to give those pioneers the space and the resources to build a new studio that‚Äôs doing something different.---As a Lighting Assistant, you will provide support to the lighting and compositing departments.¬†ResponsibilitiesTake care of the specific needs that the lighting department may need during the production of the shots.¬†Take care of the specific needs that the compositing department may have once the shots have been finished in lighting.¬†Manages the versioning of files, final deliverables, and the archiving of projects.¬†Create new mattes or AOVs.¬†Split scene render layers into extra layers while preserving the shot integrity.¬†¬†Render debugging and troubleshooting.¬†Check final output renders and updates comp scripts.¬†Directly assists all senior and junior artists¬†RequirementsSome experience in the animation or VFX industry.¬†Knowledge of Animation or VFX workflows.¬†Experience working with Maya and being used to working with render layers.¬†Arnold and Houdini knowledge is a plus.¬†Knowledge of compositing package Nuke.¬†Good understanding of how different render layers get assembled in compositing.¬†¬†High English level desirable.¬†#Animation Skydance is a diversified media company founded by David Ellison in 2010 to create high quality, event-level entertainment for global audiences. The Company brings to life stories of immersive worlds across its feature film, television, interactive, and animation divisions.¬†Skydance is proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to building and fostering a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workforce. We welcome and consider applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, citizenship, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, pregnancy status, military/veteran status, disability, or any other protected category. Diversity in the workplace is not just a commitment, it is who we are and a reflection of what makes our world special. ¬†Recruitment Fraud AlertIt has come to our attention that there may be fraudulent activity by individuals impersonating our Talent Acquisition team. Skydance will only contact you from an official ‚Äú@skydance.com‚Äù email address. If you suspect that you are being contacted by an unauthorized person or believe that the correspondence you have received is suspicious, please do not click on any links or attachments in such emails and submit any questions or concerns to our information security team at¬†information.security@skydance.com.¬†Apply for this job

title: Technical Artist - Rigging | AAA Title
job_description: Who is SkyBox Labs?SkyBox Labs is a game development studio that works on some of the world‚Äôs most iconic games. Our projects include working as a co-developer on Halo Infinite, projects in the Minecraft Universe, supporting the development of Magic: The Gathering Arena, supporting development of Fallout 76, and developing unannounced titles including partner projects and internal IP. As one of Vancouver‚Äôs fastest-growing game studios, since our inception in 2011, SkyBox Labs has evolved from a group of 8 people developing independent projects to a team of over 200+ engineers, artists, designers, producers, and more. Interested? Let's talk about who we're hiring for:SkyBox Labs is looking for a talented Technical Artist - Rigger to join our team to work on an exciting, unannounced co-development partnership. This coveted AAA action RPG is a fan favourite around the world! In this role, you will collaborate with a passionate team of creators to build and maintain efficient 3D and animation content and pipelines. You will become deeply knowledgeable about the toolset and will act as a bridge between animators and programmers to ensure seamless content integration. By joining this team, your creative input and skills will be highly valued and instrumental in the development of the game. We encourage real ownership within our teams, giving members the space to express and expand their own originality. If animation and rigging are your passions, and fresh ideas stoke your creativity we encourage you to apply.A snapshot of your role:Collaborate closely with our Design, Animation and Engineering teams to build and improve pipelinesHave a comprehensive understanding of the engine and associated toolsUse proprietary rigging system and technologyCreate technical content for a variety of assets (for example skeletons, skin weighting, cloth, hair, weapons)Build facial and body rigging systems (biped/multiped rigs)Provide support for Animators, Artists and Designers to bring our assets to lifeDevelop and support the Maya Python tools by contributing to the codebaseSound like you? This is what we're looking for:At least 5 years of professional experience working with real-time game engines, including expertise in Rigging with Autodesk Maya or similar softwareFamiliarity with scripting or programming languages such as Python, C++ or C#Strong communication and self management skillsA collaborative mindset and a keen eye for detailEnthusiasm for creating iconic gaming experiencesComfortable with fast paced developmentPassion for supporting and enabling othersNice-to-haves:Professional experience as an artist or animator in games3D Modeling experienceMotion Capture experienceKnowledge of anatomy and facial rigging approachesPlease note, only those who submit a demo reel or online portfolio will be considered for the role.#LI-HYBRID #LI-LM1And here is why we think you'll love working at SkyBox Labs:Our studio‚Äôs success can be attributed to our culture of empowerment, collaboration, and personal growth.¬†At SkyBox Labs, you can contribute to industry-leading titles, from legendary AAA franchises to independent IP, without compromising on culture. As a rapidly growing independent company, we maintain a ‚Äòsmall studio‚Äô feel with our flat structure, leading with authenticity, and fostering connection.We relentlessly support your growth and development. From team building through personal interest groups and clubs to studio-wide knowledge sharing through learning lunches, and more formalized programs like SkyBox U, we support our team every step of the way.¬†One major thing that we‚Äôre proud of is that we‚Äôve been able to grow to the studio that we are today while ultimately cultivating an environment of trust and mutual respect where you can thrive. We value our team members‚Äô diverse backgrounds, hobbies, skills, and interests and we celebrate them! This is demonstrated through our broad spectrum of social clubs: Join our soccer team, fitness group, or one of our many D&D groups - you can even start your own!Flexible Hybrid and Remote Work Models:With the goal to provide the best possible work environment for all, the majority of our team is working in a flexible hybrid work model from Vancouver and Victoria. The opportunity to work permanently remotely across Canada is also available for certain designated roles. SkyBox Labs is proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace, dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce. Only candidates that reside in Canada or are willing to relocate will be considered for this role. Additionally, although we appreciate all interest, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.¬†¬†Learn more about us at¬†http://skyboxlabs.com/¬†Apply for this job

title: Technical Director (new project)
job_description: Located in Montreal, Reflector Entertainment, a subsidiary of Bandai Namco Group, a renowned entertainment studio that works with the best talents in the industry to produce captivating content for international audiences. Using a transmedia approach focused on creating rich narrative universes, the company is successful in developing compelling original properties that draw fans in across various platforms.¬†Here is an overview of what we offer our team:¬∑A hybrid working model with a minimal presence of one day per week at the studio.¬∑Flexible working hours. Whether you're more productive in the morning or in the evening, it's up to you to manage your 37.5 hours per week.¬∑Collective insurance in addition you will also have accesses to a health care spending account, telemedicine, two (2) personal days and unlimited paid sick days from day one.¬∑Holidays are enhanced.¬∑We reimburse employees for transport expenses incurred in commuting to work.¬∑Employee assistance program, voluntary retirement savings plan with Reflector contributions.¬∑Human-sized studio with the means of a large group.¬∑You get two (2) weeks of paid vacation from Reflector in December to give you time to rest and spend time with your family, in addition to your banked vacation weeks.¬∑We offer a wide range of activities to suit all tastes and interests, to allow you to have fun and thrive (lunches, 5 to 7, game nights, etc.).¬†Summary:The Technical Director will be responsible for managing and overseeing the programming team. The holder of the position will establish the link between the game's artistic vision and its technical implementation.Key Responsibilities:¬∑Determine the best technology for all projects.¬∑Understand the engine middleware and constraints of the different projects.¬∑Manage the programming process and identify programming tasks and time estimates.¬∑Ensure that each game is built with a productive methodology and solid programming practices, technical notes, code reviews, keeping in mind long-term quality and future code sharing between projects.¬∑Identify technical risks of projects and develop emergency plans to be implemented with the team.¬∑Maintain positive working relationships with technology teams to improve the use of shared technologies.¬∑Manage and optimize the technical collaboration between internal and/or external studios working on the game.¬∑Maintain regular internal communications and encourage a pleasant team atmosphere.¬∑Interface with design and art director to identify needs and implement features in projects.¬∑Manage the performance of the programming team.¬∑Assume responsibility for the development and professional training of the programming team.¬∑Facilitate and encourage the sharing of technical knowledge and code between projects.¬†Qualifications:¬∑¬†A university degree in programming, computer engineering, software engineering or equivalent.¬∑5 to 10 years of experience in the game industry on console platforms.¬∑At least 3 years of experience in multi-platform console development as a lead programmer or chief programmer.¬∑Having published at least 3 games, one of which as a senior programmer, lead programmer, or technical director.¬∑Experience working on a published game, from concept to release, preferably a AAA open world title for console.¬∑Interest and experience in most aspects of game technology development (audio, 3D, animation, gameplay, UI, networking, and tools).¬∑Knowledge of technological constraints on various platforms.¬∑Knowledge of C/C++ languages.¬∑Experience in multi-platform development.¬∑¬†Experience in optimization.¬∑Leadership and communication skills, both oral and written.¬∑Good sense of organization.¬∑Strong coaching and leadership skills.¬∑A proactive and independent attitude.¬∑The ability to troubleshoot and an open mind.¬∑The ability to work efficiently under pressure and to adapt to change.If you are passionate about video games and have the skills as a Technical Director, interface development and project management tools, leadership, communication, and problem solving, we invite you to apply for this position at Reflector Entertainment.-Apply for this job

title: Creative Director (new project)
job_description: Located in Montreal, Reflector Entertainment, a subsidiary of Bandai Namco Group, a renowned entertainment studio that works with the best talents in the industry to produce captivating content for international audiences. Using a transmedia approach focused on creating rich narrative universes, the company is successful in developing compelling original properties that draw fans in across various platforms.¬†Here is an overview of what we offer our team:¬∑A hybrid working model with a minimal presence of one day per week at the studio.¬∑Flexible working hours. Whether you're more productive in the morning or in the evening, it's up to you to manage your 37.5 hours per week.¬∑Collective insurance in addition you will also have accesses to a health care spending account, telemedicine, two (2) personal days and unlimited paid sick days from day one.¬∑Holidays are enhanced.¬∑We reimburse employees for transport expenses incurred in commuting to work.¬∑Employee assistance program, voluntary retirement savings plan with Reflector contributions.¬∑Human-sized studio with the means of a large group.¬∑You get two (2) weeks of paid vacation from Reflector in December to give you time to rest and spend time with your family, in addition to your banked vacation weeks.¬∑We offer a wide range of activities to suit all tastes and interests, to allow you to have fun and thrive (lunches, 5 to 7, game nights, etc.).¬†SummaryThe Creative Director will be a major asset during the development of the game. He/she will oversee all strategic decisions that have an impact on the overall quality of the game.Key Responsibilities:¬∑Design and maintain an efficient creative pipeline to ensure quality and consistency of all projects.¬∑Define, in close collaboration with the producer and executive producer, the objectives of the production and any necessary adjustments.¬∑Develop and implement an overall vision and creative foundations of the game (visual effects, theme, context, gameplay, etc...).¬∑Work closely with the production team to ensure that quality criteria are met.¬∑Supervise the work of the development team to ensure that the creative vision of the project is integrated into all aspects of the production (artistic, design, programming).¬∑Supervise action plans and coordination between internal and external studios to ensure effective collaboration.Qualifications:¬∑At least five (5) years of supervision experience of art and design teams in the video game console industry.¬∑Work experience on a published game, from conception to release, preferably on an open-world AAA title on console.¬∑Delivery of minimum three (3) games.¬∑Understanding of product strategic objectives and ability to work towards them.¬∑Ability to formulate ideas, communicate with art team and make constructive suggestions.¬∑Team spirit, creative direction, and ability to deliver exceptional quality projects.¬∑Engaging leadership, ability to lead and develop a team focused on collective success, make the best decisions for the studio and demonstrate agility.If you are passionate about video games and you have the skills to lead a team in developing high-quality games, we invite you to apply for this position at Reflector Entertainment.¬†-Apply for this job
